title: Reborn Di Consort Is Not to Be Trifled With
description: A deposed empress is betrayed and murdered by her husband the Emperor and her cousin. Given a chance by a mysterious entity, she vows to return and seek revenge.
context:
Title: Reborn Di Consort Is Not to Be Trifled With
Description: A deposed empress is betrayed and murdered by her husband the Emperor and her cousin. Given a chance by a mysterious entity, she vows to return and seek revenge.

INT. GREAT HALL - NIGHT

Moonlight cuts through cracked shutters, illuminating the deposed EMPRESS QIN SHUANGYUE. She sits alone on the cold floor, her magnificent red wedding dress and phoenix crown now faded reminders of her fall from grace. Her expression is stone, her eyes hollow.

The hall doors groan open. Torchlight spills across the floor.

QIN SHUANGYUE turns her head slowly, and in her eyes, sorrow hardens into quiet resolve.

EXT. PALACE COURTYARD - DAY

A light snow falls on the gray stones. QIN SHUANGYUE's brother, QIN YI, son of the Duke of Zhenguo, is forced to his knees by two SOLDIERS. His scholar's robes are torn, his face bloodied but defiant.

A third SOLDIER shoves Shuangyue forward. She stumbles, then steadies herself, chin lifted.

Her cousin QIN SHUYA enters in fine sable robes, flanked by SOLDIERS bearing an imperial edict and a lacquered tray with wine pot and cups.

QIN YI
(strangled)
Sister—don't—

A SOLDIER silences him with a blow. Shuangyue flinches, her hands clenching into fists.

QIN SHUYA
(coldly triumphant)
Third Sister, His Majesty is merciful. He grants you a final reunion before death.

QIN YI
It's poison! Turn away!

QIN SHUYA signals with her eyes. A SOLDIER draws his sword and stabs Qin Yi.

QIN YI falls dead, blood staining the snow.

QIN SHUANGYUE
(a broken whisper)
Brother...

SHUYA pours the wine deliberately. The dark liquid steams in the winter air.

MING YANYU, the new Emperor of Great Wei, emerges onto the gallery above, his dragon robes stark against the stone. He watches with cold detachment.

MING YANYU
Your father, the Duke of Zhenguo, plotted treason and has been executed by slow slicing. Qin Shuangyue, I show mercy for our past as husband and wife by granting you an intact corpse. Do not be ungrateful.

QIN SHUANGYUE
(voice trembling with fury)
Treason? My father bled for your throne. You used us, then discarded us like refuse.

MING YANYU
(angrily)
Your tongue remains sharp. Cripple her hands and feet!

SOLDIERS seize Shuangyue's arms. One stomps on her wrist. The CRACK echoes. She bites back a scream, her face draining of color.

QIN SHUYA
The Crown Prince is already dead. Third Sister should go to the underworld for a family reunion.

QIN SHUANGYUE
continuation:
(frozen)
What did you do to Cheng'er?

QIN SHUYA
(smiling contemptuously)
His little heart made excellent medicine for my fertility. The Emperor's new heir deserves proper omens.

QIN SHUANGYUE
(raging)
Ming Yanyu, how vicious you are! That was your own son!

MING YANYU
That was clearly a bastard child you conceived with Ming Yuchen!

QIN SHUYA grabs Shuangyue's chin, forcing the poisoned wine down her throat.

QIN SHUANGYUE collapses, convulsing. Black blood trickles from her lips.

QIN SHUANGYUE (V.O.)
If I must walk through hell... I will return. And you will suffer as I have suffered.

A SOLDIER runs in frantically.

SOLDIER
Your Majesty! Prince Chen is leading troops into the palace!

MING HONGLI, Prince Chen of Great Wei, wearing armor and wielding a sword, charges in with killing intent, engaging the SOLDIERS in fierce combat.

In the chaos, Hongli's blade finds Shuya's throat. She drops the wine cup, surprise frozen on her face as she falls.

Ming Hongli defeats all the SOLDIERS and runs to Qin Shuangyue, taking her into his arms.

MING HONGLI
(anguished)
Qin Shuangyue!

Qin Shuangyue dies in Ming Hongli's embrace, her eyes fixed on the sky as a single tear slides down her cheek.

MING HONGLI
(roaring to the heavens)
Ah—!

INT. VOID SPACE - NIGHT

QIN SHUANGYUE, wearing white robes, her soul floating in darkness.

A WHITE-HAIRED OLD MAN appears before her.

WHITE-HAIRED OLD MAN
Qin Shuangyue. Walk through shadow and return to sun. But the price is memory—of all you loved.

Images of her brother and son's tragic deaths flash before Qin Shuangyue's eyes.

QIN SHUANGYUE
(resolute)
I am willing.

EXT. PALACE COURTYARD - DAY

Ming Hongli holds Qin Shuangyue's body, grief-stricken, as snow covers them both.

ON SCREEN: TO BE CONTINUED

title: I Am a Super Tycoon in 2060
description: A man killed in a hit-and-run accident is transported to the year 2060, where global resource surplus has caused extreme price deflation, making his small amount of cash incredibly valuable.
context:
Title: I Am a Super Tycoon in 2060
Description: A man killed in a hit-and-run accident is transported to the year 2060, where global resource surplus has caused extreme price deflation, making his small amount of cash incredibly valuable.

EXT. DOWNTOWN STREET - NIGHT (2024)

JACK MULLEN (40s), weathered hands clutching a brown envelope, steps off the curb. Headlights bear down. Tires SCREAM.

SMASH CUT TO:

EXT. ALLEYWAY - DAY (2060)

Jack lands hard on pristine asphalt. No blood. No pain. The envelope sits beside him, cash spilling out ($200).

He squints at holographic billboards advertising:
"BOTTLED WATER: 2¢ / LUXURY APARTMENT: $1.50/month"

LINA (20s, wearing recycled-tech jumpsuit) rounds the corner.

LINA
Whoa! You can't sleep here. Shelter's three blocks—

She spots the cash. Her eyes widen.

LINA
Is that... paper currency?

JACK
(standing, confused)
Where am I?

LINA
2060. And you're holding a felony.

JACK
It's two hundred bucks.

LINA
That's enough to buy a city block.

INT. AUTOMATED MARKET - CONTINUOUS

Jack and Lina enter. Robotic VENDORS display prices:
"organic apple: 0.001¢" "transport pod: 8¢"

Jack approaches a FOOD VENDOR.

JACK
One coffee.

The vendor scans his $20 bill.

VENDOR
(robotic voice)
Accepted. Your change: $19.9999. Please wait six hours for transaction approval.

Lina pulls him aside, urgent.

LINA
You don't spend it all in one place. Ever. The Resource Authority tracks large transactions.

JACK
So I'm rich but I can't... be rich?

LINA
You need a sponsor. Someone to launder your temporal cash into digital micro-credits.

A uniformed AUTHORITY OFFICER enters, scanning the room.

LINA
(whispering)
Too late. That twenty just flagged us.

OFFICER
(to Jack)
Sir, I need to verify your currency's origin timestamp.

JACK
I don't know what—

LINA
(interrupting)
He's my temporal transfer. Section 7b.

OFFICER
Sponsor papers?

Lina pulls out a forged tablet document. The officer scans it.

OFFICER
(eyes narrowing)
This expires in twenty minutes.

The officer leaves. Lina exhales.

LINA
That cost me my last credit. You're buying me dinner. 1950s-style.
continuation:
EXT. SKYLINE TERRACE - SUNSET

Jack and Lina share canned beans heated over a small fire. The city glows—towering vertical farms, solar skin buildings.

JACK
So you saved me why?

LINA
Everyone deserves a reset. Even ghosts from the waste era.

JACK
I was a ghost before. Working paycheck to paycheck...

He holds up the remaining cash.

JACK
Now I'm a king with paper.

LINA
(shaking her head)
You're a target. Tomorrow we digitize that money. Give you a real life.

JACK
And if I don't want to? If I want to burn it all at once?

LINA
Then you learn why deflation's a curse. One man's fortune is everyone's poverty.

Beat. Jack looks at the city, then at his worn hands.

JACK
Let's digitize it. But you keep half.

LINA
(startled)
What?

JACK
You gave me a future. Seems fair.

Lina smiles. First genuine smile.

LINA
Welcome to 2060, Jack.

FADE OUT.

title: The Masked Dialogue
description: A mother is dragged away by demon clan members as her daughter escapes, leading to a confrontation between powerful warriors and the demon clan.
context:
Title: The Masked Dialogue
Description: A mother is dragged away by demon clan members as her daughter escapes, leading to a confrontation between powerful warriors and the demon clan.

INT. VILLAGE SQUARE - DAY

Two DEMON CLAN MEMBERS wearing skull masks drag QING'ER'S MOTHER through a square littered with broken pottery and fresh scorch marks. Glowing blue chains pulse around her body.

QING'ER'S MOTHER
(panicked, but clear)
Qing'er, run! Don't look back!

QING'ER stands at the forest edge, tears streaming, watching her mother disappear. She turns and sprints.

EXT. BAMBOO FOREST - DAY

QING'ER runs desperately into a bamboo forest and collides with a group of people: a MAN IN MODERN UNIFORM, a WOMAN IN A LIGHT-COLOURED DRESS, a FEMALE SWORDSWOMAN, and a man named HEI ZE.

QING'ER
(crying out)
Help!

QING'ER collapses to her knees, exhausted.

MAN IN UNIFORM
What happened?

QING'ER
(grief-stricken)
They took my mother. The demon clan—they're destroying the village.

MAN IN UNIFORM
(frowning)
How many?

QING'ER
At least ten. Maybe more.

MAN IN UNIFORM
(quietly)
Then we are ten too few, or just enough.

WOMAN IN DRESS
(softly)
continuation:
This child can't go back.

FEMALE SWORDSWOMAN
I'll shield her. Go.

MAN IN UNIFORM
(to Qing'er)
Will you trust us?

QING'ER
(looking at them)
You... you feel different from them.

MAN IN UNIFORM
We are. Stay with her. We'll return with your mother if she still—

He stops, seeing Qing'er's face crumple.

MAN IN UNIFORM
We'll stop them. That's our vow.

QING'ER nods. The Female Swordsman takes her hand.

FEMALE SWORDSWOMAN
Hold on tight.

They run deeper into the forest.

The Man in Uniform pulls a military insignia from his gear. It dissolves into shadow. Hei Ze removes his hood, revealing pale eyes that begin to glow.

MAN IN UNIFORM
(to Hei Ze)
For the first time, let us show the power of Dou Saint and Dou Emperor.

HEI ZE
(softly)
Let them remember why they feared those names.

Energy spirals around them—blue lightning and black flame. The bamboo groans, bending away.

They walk toward the village, each step leaving scorched prints in the earth.

FADE TO BLACK.

title: Since We Parted, A Billion Reunions
description: A father's business deal leads to a tragic moment when his daughter is kidnapped while waiting in the car.
context:
Title: Since We Parted, A Billion Reunions
Description: A father's business deal leads to a tragic moment when his daughter is kidnapped while waiting in the car.

INT. CAR - DAY

XINYI traces hearts on the fogged window. FATHER checks his phone at a red light.

XINYI
Dad, you promised today was just for us.

FATHER
(quietly)
This is the last time. For your school.

He pulls into a convenience store lot, parks under a streetlight. Locks the doors.

FATHER
(removes a silver necklace)
Mom wore this when she was scared. Put it on. Two minutes.

He puts it on her, points to the store entrance.
continuation:
INT. CONVENIENCE STORE - DAY

FATHER signs papers with MR. ZHU by the window, constantly glancing at the car.

FATHER
Never again after today.

MR. ZHU
Good father.

EXT. ROADSIDE - DAY

A TRAFFICKER on a tricycle watches, then approaches the car.

TRAFFICKER
Little girl, your dad forgot his phone.

XINYI
(softly)
He said don't open the door.

TRAFFICKER
See? He's waving at me.

He points to the store. Xinyi looks. The TRAFFICKER unlocks the door with a tool, covers her mouth. She struggles weakly. He places her in the cart, covers her. A butterfly hair clip falls to the pavement.

EXT. ROADSIDE - DAY

FATHER walks out, smiling. Sees the car door open. The necklace hangs from the seat.

FATHER
Xinyi?

He picks up the butterfly clip from the pavement. Recognizes it—he gave it to her that morning.

FATHER
(whisper)
No...

He sees the tricycle turning. A small shoe visible under the cloth.

FATHER
(shouting)
XINYI!

He sprints to his car, fumbling with his keys.

title: Future Diary
description: A photographer encounters a mysterious old man in white during a photoshoot at a pig farm.
context:
Title: Future Diary
Description: A photographer encounters a mysterious old man in white during a photoshoot at a pig farm.

INT. PIG FARM - DAY

Funky music plays with a strong rhythm.

A beautiful woman in an orange dress and high heels walks down the aisle of the pig farm, carrying an iron basin. Her movements are graceful and alluring. Pigs poke their heads out from the pens on both sides.

The WOMAN turns to face the camera, striking various poses.

A PHOTOGRAPHER in the distance takes photos of her.

PHOTOGRAPHER
Hey, hey, not bad. Looking good, beautiful. Very good, let's take a break.

The WOMAN stops posing and walks toward the PHOTOGRAPHER. The PHOTOGRAPHER looks down at his camera, reviewing the photos.

PHOTOGRAPHER
(confused)
Miss, when we were shooting just now, was there an old man around?

WOMAN
(puzzled)
An old man? No, it's just the two of us, right?

The PHOTOGRAPHER continues scrolling through the camera. He zooms in on one photo. In the image, an old man in white clothes holding a fan stands behind the WOMAN.

PHOTOGRAPHER
(shocked)
What the... There's an old man right here! What's going on?

Suddenly, all the lights in the pig farm go out. Everything plunges into darkness.
continuation:
PHOTOGRAPHER
(panicking)
What the... Why did it go dark? Miss?

A beam of light suddenly illuminates. The OLD MAN in white Tang suit appears in front of the PHOTOGRAPHER, smiling at him.

OLD MAN
Young man. The diary shows what will be. Your final photo proves it.

The PHOTOGRAPHER checks his camera. The last image shows the WOMAN, lifeless beside the basin. He looks up—she's stumbling toward it.

PHOTOGRAPHER
(desperate)
Miss! Stop!

He lunges, pulling her back as the basin crashes. The lights RETURN. The OLD MAN is gone.

The WOMAN touches the camera screen, showing her alive and safe.

WOMAN
You saw it. My death.

She sees the PHOTOGRAPHER's reflection in the lens—behind it, the faint image of the OLD MAN's fan.

WOMAN
(whispering)
The diary... now has your name, doesn't it?

PHOTOGRAPHER
(quietly)
Let's finish the shoot.

He pockets the diary that materialized in his hand.

FADE OUT.

title: Canary Training Manual
description: A dark tale of control and complicated relationships involving power dynamics and past connections.
context:
Title: Canary Training Manual
Description: A dark tale of control and complicated relationships involving power dynamics and past connections.

INT. APARTMENT - NIGHT

In the dark room, LU JINGCHU sits on the sofa, turning a lighter over in his fingers. Flame on. Flame off.

The door opens. YE XIN walks in, exhaustion in her posture.

LU JINGCHU holds up a photograph. A young man's face.

YE XIN stops. Stares.

LU JINGCHU pulls her to the sofa, ignites the photo. The flame lights his cold face.

LU JINGCHU
Three years. You still keep his photo?

He drops the burning photo, grips her chin.

LU JINGCHU
You knelt for your father's life. Now you posture for a ghost? Even if Lu Zhisen returns, would he want what's left?

YE XIN meets his eyes. Something steels there.

YE XIN
If I had a choice, I'd choose neither.

LU JINGCHU smiles, thin. Kisses her hard. Pushes her toward the bedroom.
continuation:
INT. BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS

LU JINGCHU throws YE XIN onto the bed, pins her wrists.

YE XIN
(struggling)
Get off me!

LU JINGCHU
(whispering)
Keep cursing.

He leans down. She turns away.

INT. BEDROOM - DAY

Morning. Sunlight.

LU JINGCHU smokes. YE XIN lies with her back to him.

LU JINGCHU
Dinner tonight. Come.

YE XIN
(coldly)
Take someone else.

LU JINGCHU
Fine.

She picks up her phone. The screen shows a news article: "Lu Zhisen Returns, Spotted With Companion." The photo: Lu Zhisen with a woman.

She looks at it. No tear. She zooms in on the woman's face, then closes it.

She sits up. Looks at LU JINGCHU's back. Practices a small smile in the mirror.

title: The Foolish Prince
description: A war hero is reduced to a helpless fool in a wheelchair, living with his betrothed's family who mock and plot against him.
context:
Title: The Foolish Prince
Description: A war hero is reduced to a helpless fool in a wheelchair, living with his betrothed's family who mock and plot against him.

MONTAGE

EXT. BATTLEFIELD - DAY

Stirring orchestral music.

YOUNG MASTER LIN, in battle-scarred armor, rides his black warhorse through the city gates.

He leads his troops in a desperate battle, swords clashing, the combat brutal.

YOUNG MASTER LIN
For the empire!

YOUNG MASTER LIN swings his blade, cutting down enemies. An arrow grazes his temple.

YOUNG MASTER LIN
First warrior of the grasslands? Just a man!

He gallops toward the setting sun.

INT. LIN MANOR COURTYARD - DAY

Scene transition. Music becomes light, mocking.

YOUNG MASTER LIN sits in a crude wooden wheelchair, plain white robes. Expression vacant, but his knuckles whiten on the armrests.

YOUNG MASTER LIN
Giddyup, giddyup, horsey run fast!

WORTHY NEPHEW walks over, prying YOUNG MASTER LIN's fingers off.

WORTHY NEPHEW
Enough.

AUNT emerges with a plate of pastries.

AUNT
Worthy Nephew, come sit. Qiuxue will— Oh my!

She sees YOUNG MASTER LIN and nearly drops the pastries.

YOUNG MASTER LIN
Mother, I'm riding a big horse!

WORTHY NEPHEW
There's no horse.

AUNT
(to YOUNG MASTER LIN)
You fool, stop embarrassing us. Go inside, now!

YOUNG MASTER LIN lowers his head, wheels himself to the corner. His jaw tightens.

WORTHY NEPHEW
(to AUNT)
Aunt, this is the fool Old General Lin betrothed to Miss Lin.

AUNT
(angrily)
continuation:
Worthy Nephew, the old master must have been blind! Claiming he arranged an excellent match for Qiuxue. But as soon as he died, they sent us this—this good-for-nothing!

AUNT turns with a practiced smile.

AUNT
But Qiuxue keeps him here from pity. Nothing more.

WORTHY NEPHEW
Miss Lin's compassion is known. But marriage?

AUNT
Oh, absolutely not! We honor the old general's memory.

WORTHY NEPHEW
Then let me relieve her burden.

He walks to YOUNG MASTER LIN's wheelchair.

AUNT
Worthy Nephew?

WORTHY NEPHEW
(confidently)
A small kindness. Fresh air.

YOUNG MASTER LIN
(fearfully)
Big horse...

WORTHY NEPHEW
(leaning close, voice like silk)
Let's find you a real one, fool.

YOUNG MASTER LIN
(immediately excited)
Real horse? Charge, charge!

WORTHY NEPHEW pushes the wheelchair at a run.

EXT. BACK ALLEY OF LIN MANOR - DAY

WORTHY NEPHEW helps YOUNG MASTER LIN onto a brown horse. The stablehand looks away.

YOUNG MASTER LIN
(sitting on the horse, terrified)
Too high... let me down... scared...

WORTHY NEPHEW ignores him, slaps the horse's flank hard.

The horse bolts forward.

YOUNG MASTER LIN
Ahh!

He falls, crashing onto stone. Coughs blood, lies motionless.

WORTHY NEPHEW watches coldly, a satisfied smirk.

WORTHY NEPHEW
(softly)
Farewell.

The horse stops in the distance. In the shadows, YOUNG MASTER LIN's fingers curl into a fist.

title: Deserted City
description: A young woman returns to her hometown five years after being falsely accused, only to find the past still haunts her. Her grandmother arranges a marriage to help her start anew in another city.
context:
Title: Deserted City
Description: A young woman returns to her hometown five years after being falsely accused, only to find the past still haunts her. Her grandmother arranges a marriage to help her start anew in another city.

INT. HAITONG'S HOME - DAY

ON SCREEN: DESERTED CITY

A red "Fu" character peels at the corners on the weathered door. HAITONG (17), hair plastered to her face, fumbles with her keys in the downpour.

HAITONG
Grandma! The sky just opened up!

She ducks inside, stripping her soaked uniform with practiced haste, pulling on a worn tank top. The sound of heavy, unsteady footsteps approaches.

LAO WANG (50s, reeking of alcohol) shoulders through the unlocked door, eyes glazed.

LAO WANG
Xiao Tong... your grandma mentioned you'd be alone...

He lunges. Haitong's textbook falls, pages scattering.

HAITONG
(screaming)
Get away!

LAO WANG
Don't fight. No one will believe you anyway.

HAITONG
(struggling, nails raking his arm)
Help! Someone!

LAO WANG'S WIFE appears in the doorway, breathless. Her face hardens at the scene—not just the struggle, but the bottle slipping from Lao Wang's pocket. She chooses her target.

LAO WANG'S WIFE
(rushing toward HAITONG)
You little slut! Setting traps for my husband? I'm right here!

She grabs Haitong's hair. The first blow lands.

LAO WANG'S WIFE
Bitch! Whore! This is YOUR home—if you didn't invite him, how'd he get in? I've heard about girls like you. Desperate for cash. Just like your mother who dumped you here!

HAITONG
(crying, protecting her face)
He broke in! Look at the door!

LAO WANG'S WIFE
Explain to the police! Oh wait—they'll see exactly what you are.

NEIGHBORS cluster at the threshold. NEIGHBOR A (40s, laundry basket in arms) points with her chin.

NEIGHBOR A (Female)
Seventeen and already wrecking homes. Shameless.

NEIGHBOR B (Male)
 apple doesn't fall far from the tree.

NEIGHBOR C (Female, older)
Grandma Hai tried so hard...

NEIGHBOR B (Male)
Parents died. Bound to happen.

NEIGHBOR A (Female)
If she had any decency, she'd disappear.

NEIGHBORS
(talking over each other)
Little demon. Vixen. She asked for it.

ON SCREEN: FIVE YEARS LATER
continuation:
INT. BUS - DAY

HAITONG (22), black-framed glasses masking her eyes, watches Wan City blur past the rain-streaked window. Her knuckles are white on her portfolio.

HAITONG (V.O.)
Five years. I built a new name. But Grandma's letters... they smell of this rain.

INT. OLD BUILDING STAIRWELL - DAY

Haitong climbs. The walls still bear the ghost of old posters—"SLUT," "VIXEN"—now faded, layered with peeling paint. She touches one.

LAO WANG'S WIFE (O.S.)
You actually came back.

She stands on the landing, gripping a shopping bag, eyes colder.

LAO WANG'S WIFE
Everyone remembers. How you tried to steal him. The lies you told.

HAITONG
I didn't invent his fingerprints on my neck.

LAO WANG'S WIFE
(flinches, then recovers)
Words. All just words.

GRANDMA HAI shuffles out, a wool shawl over her shoulders, holding a thermos of tea.

GRANDMA HAI
Xiao Tong. You came.

LAO WANG'S WIFE
(to GRANDMA HAI)
You're still covering for her?

GRANDMA HAI
(protecting HAITONG)
I'm covering nothing. You're standing in my doorway.

LAO WANG'S WIFE
Like grandmother, like granddaughter. Everyone knows you—

HAITONG
Enough.

She steps forward. Lao Wang's Wife stumbles back, dropping her bag. Oranges roll down the stairs.

GRANDMA HAI
(to LAO WANG'S WIFE)
Next time you slander my granddaughter, bring proof. Or a lawyer.

HAITONG
(supporting her grandmother)
Grandma, let's go inside.

GRANDMA HAI
Xiao Tong. You never apologized. I did.

HAITONG's phone rings—an unknown number. She answers.

HAITONG
(answering)
Hello?

HR (V.O.)
Miss Haitong? Shengda Group. We need to discuss your application.

HAITONG
Yes, I interviewed last week—

HR (V.O.)
We've received... concerning information about your history in Wan City. Several firms in our network share a background system. Given the documentation of "moral deficiencies"—

HAITONG
Documentation? It was never—

HR (V.O.)
The system is the system. I'm sorry. We'll be rescinding the offer. And... others may follow.

The call ends. Haitong's portfolio slips. Pages scatter—her resume, shredded by rain.

HAITONG
(crying)
Grandma, they found me.

GRANDMA HAI
(holding HAITONG)
The world is small for women with rumors. But hearts can be bigger.

HAITONG (V.O.)
I thought the internet forgot. But Wan City is the internet.

Haitong picks up a piece of her resume. Her hand trembles, then stills.

HAITONG (V.O.)
Fine. If Wan City is a cage, I'll find a door.

GRANDMA HAI
Qin Chuan. Remember him? My friend Aiyu's grandson. He works in Beijing now. A good boy. Quiet. Steady. He needs... a partner. For family reasons. No one there knows our ghosts. You could breathe again.

ON SCREEN: BEIJING CITY

INT. MARRIAGE REGISTRATION OFFICE - DAY

STAFF MEMBER
Sign here. And here. Congratulations.

HAITONG holds the certificate. Her signature is firm. QIN CHUAN (30s, clean-shaven, eyes distant) signs without looking up.

HAITONG (V.O.)
I married a signature.

QIN CHUAN slides a matte black card across the counter.

QIN CHUAN
I fly to San Francisco tonight. For work. The PIN is our date. Use what you need. I'll be back in three months. We can... figure it out then.

He turns. Haitong watches him—his posture military-straight, his left hand drumming a rhythm against his thigh.

HAITONG
Wait. I didn't come here for charity.

QIN CHUAN
(pausing)
Neither did I.

He's gone before she can process it. The staff member already gestures to the next couple.

HAITONG (V.O.)
He left me with a number and a question.

She looks at the card. Then at the certificate. Her thumb runs over the seal.

HAITONG
(to herself)
Three months.

STAFF MEMBER
Miss? Your husband forgot his pen.

HAITONG takes it—a heavy fountain pen, engraved with initials that aren't his.

ON SCREEN: TO BE CONTINUED

title: The Storm Rises Again
description: A humble fish vendor's quiet life shatters when his wife's betrayal with a local strongman forces him to confront the cost of survival in Jinghai Market.
context:
Title: The Storm Rises Again
Description: A humble fish vendor's quiet life shatters when his wife's betrayal with a local strongman forces him to confront the cost of survival in Jinghai Market.

INT. FISH MARKET - NIGHT

LI YOUCAI and his HENCHMEN shove WANG QIANG's head into a fish tank. Water erupts, scattering silver-scaled fish.

LI YOUCAI
(laughing)
You see? Even the fish know their place.

The HENCHMEN yank WANG QIANG out, gasping. Water streams from his nose and mouth.

LI YOUCAI
(grabbing Wang Qiang's collar)
Twenty years selling fish, and you still think this water belongs to you?

The HENCHMEN force WANG QIANG to his knees. His fingers curl through the wet gravel.

LI YOUCAI
Show him the price of pride.

HENCHMAN
Yes, boss.

WANG QIANG
(through gritted teeth)
Cai. This is between us.

LI YOUCAI
(contemptuously)
Is it? Your wife didn't think so. She paid your protection fee with something sweeter than cash.

LI YOUCAI's HENCHMEN kick WANG QIANG's legs out. He collapses face-down among scattered crawfish, their claws clicking in the puddles.

LI YOUCAI slides his arm around ZHANG FANG's waist. She stares at WANG QIANG's unconscious body, her smile tight as a wire.

WANG QIANG (V.O.)
My father taught me that still waters run deep. But tonight, the water broke me.

BLACK SCREEN

ON SCREEN: Half an hour earlier
continuation:
EXT. MARKET - DAY

The market churns with evening crowds. A POLICE SIREN wails in the distance, ignored.

INT. WANG QIANG'S FISH STALL - DAY

WANG QIANG deftly guts a carp for an OLD LADY, his knife flashing with practiced grace.

WANG QIANG
Twenty even, Auntie Chen. The liver's good for your eyes.

OLD LADY
(quietly urgent)
Qiangzi... I saw Zhang Fang go into Youcai's shop ten minutes ago. She looked... she looked like she was walking to her own execution.

WANG QIANG's knife stills. A drop of blood beads on his thumb.

OLD LADY
The stall fees can wait. Go.

WANG QIANG wipes his hands, his movements precise, too calm. He unstraps his apron.

EXT. MARKET ALLEY - DAY

WANG QIANG moves through the maze of stalls, his pace quickening with each step. Vendors avert their eyes.

WANG QIANG
(under his breath)
Fang...

INT. LI YOUCAI'S BUTCHER SHOP - DAY

LI YOUCAI reclines in a blood-stained apron, sipping baijiu. ZHANG FANG stands at the window, her back to him.

LI YOUCAI
You think running to me saves him? Every choice has interest.

ZHANG FANG
(quietly)
Just take the money and let us be.

LI YOUCAI
The money was never enough.

WANG QIANG appears in the doorway, his knuckles white on the frame.

WANG QIANG
Fang. We're leaving.

LI YOUCAI
(mock surprise)
The fishmonger prince arrives. Tell me, does it sting more knowing she came to me, or that she enjoyed the transaction?

WANG QIANG
(steady)
The stall fee. Give it back.

LI YOUCAI
Your wife paid it. Didn't you, darling?

LI YOUCAI pulls ZHANG FANG to him. She stumbles, her eyes locking with WANG QIANG's—filled with something unreadable. Shame, fear, and beneath it, defiance.

WANG QIANG
(roaring)
Let her GO!

WANG QIANG snatches a cleaver from the block. The blade catches the light.

BLACK SCREEN

ON SCREEN: TO BE CONTINUED

title: Fu Beichen's Marriage Crisis
description: A wealthy CEO remarries a woman who looks identical to his enemy, only to be confronted at his wedding with the shocking news of his ex-wife's death.
context:
Title: Fu Beichen's Marriage Crisis
Description: A wealthy CEO remarries a woman who looks identical to his enemy, only to be confronted at his wedding with the shocking news of his ex-wife's death.

INT. WEDDING VENUE - DAY

NEWS ANCHOR (V.O.)
Today marks Jiangcheng's most anticipated event. Billionaire Fu Beichen marries Shen Mengyao, heiress of the Shen empire, in what the media calls the wedding of the century.

ON SCREEN: "Fu Beichen's Fiancée: Shen Mengyao" and "Fushi Group President: Fu Beichen"

INT. GROOM'S LOUNGE - DAY

SHEN MENGYAO, radiant in her wedding gown, finds FU BEICHEN alone with his phone.

SHEN MENGYAO
Beichen?

FU BEICHEN
(brusque)
I'm fine. Leave me.

SHEN MENGYAO
You're shaking. It's our wedding day.

FU BEICHEN
I know what day it is. Please. Just go.

SHEN MENGYAO
(faltering)
I'll be waiting.

She exits. FU BEICHEN grips his phone, staring at a message thread: "Lin Nian."

FU BEICHEN (V.O.)
Two years. You think a signature ends everything? I sent you this invitation so you'd see what you threw away. I want you to feel it.

FU BEICHEN'S ASSISTANT enters with a parcel.

FU BEICHEN'S ASSISTANT
President Fu. From Miss Lin Nian. Wedding gift.

FU BEICHEN
She didn't deliver it herself?

FU BEICHEN'S ASSISTANT
Courier. No personal note.

FU BEICHEN
Typical.

The assistant hands him a weathered black umbrella.

FU BEICHEN'S ASSISTANT
She said this was yours. Returning it.

FU BEICHEN
She kept this for ten years just to throw it back at me?

He drops it. Next, a gold bank card.

FU BEICHEN'S ASSISTANT
Seventeen million. The debt her family owed. Paid in full.

FU BEICHEN
Where did she get—

FU BEICHEN'S ASSISTANT
She didn't say.

FU BEICHEN discards the card. Finally, a small pink diary with a lock.

FU BEICHEN'S ASSISTANT
Sir... the diary. She said you'd understand.

FU BEICHEN
(cold)
Burn it. I don't want her memories in my life.

FU BEICHEN'S ASSISTANT
Yes, President.
continuation:
INT. WEDDING VENUE - DAY

FU BEICHEN and SHEN MENGYAO stand before the OFFICIANT.

OFFICIANT
Miss Shen Mengyao, do you take Fu Beichen as your husband, in prosperity and adversity, in abundance and want?

SHEN MENGYAO
I do.

OFFICIANT
Mr. Fu Beichen, do you take Shen Mengyao as your wife, in sickness and health, until death parts you?

FU BEICHEN sees LIN NIAN's ghostly smile in Shen Mengyao's face.

SHEN MENGYAO
(softly)
Beichen?

FU BEICHEN
I do.

OFFICIANT
Exchange the rings.

FU BEICHEN places his ring on her. As Shen Mengyao lifts his hand, the doors burst open.

MEN IN BLACK flood in. SONG YIHENG leads them.

FU BEICHEN
Song Yiheng! This is madness!

SONG YIHENG
I brought Niannian. Since you invited her.

FU BEICHEN
She chose not to come.

SONG YIHENG raises a black-and-white memorial portrait of LIN NIAN.

SONG YIHENG
She died three days ago. Cancer.

FU BEICHEN
(stricken)
No. She would've told me...

SONG YIHENG
Would she? After what you did?

ON SCREEN: TO BE CONTINUED

title: Husband Goes Bankrupt, Wife Turns the Tables in One Shot
description: After her husband is scammed and loses everything in a rigged pool game, his wife reveals her hidden skills to win it all back.
context:
Title: Husband Goes Bankrupt, Wife Turns the Tables in One Shot
Description: After her husband is scammed and loses everything in a rigged pool game, his wife reveals her hidden skills to win it all back.

INT. LIVING ROOM - DAY

Fast-paced montage shots.

A man (HUSBAND) holds an axe, his expression furious, violently chopping a pool cue in half.

A woman (WIFE) walks in from the doorway, watching him with a calm expression.

HUSBAND swings the axe, smashing a table lamp. Glass shatters.

HUSBAND drops the axe and sinks to his knees among the splinters.

WIFE stands quietly, watching him.

HUSBAND
(sobbing)
I'm sorry... I'm so sorry.

HUSBAND grabs the hem of her coat. She gently pulls away and sets down her briefcase.

WIFE
(flatly)
How much?

HUSBAND
(looking up)
What?

WIFE
The real number. Not what they told you.

HUSBAND
Five hundred... they said five hundred thousand. But I only—

WIFE
(interrupting)
Small bets first. They let you win. Someone raised the stakes. You were drunk enough to say yes.

HUSBAND
(stunned)
How do you—

WIFE
Because that's how Marcus runs his games. He did the same thing to my father.

She picks up the broken cue pieces, examining them.

WIFE
This isn't even your cue. Yours is still in the car. You were too drunk to notice they switched it.

HUSBAND
continuation:
(voice cracking)
The house... I mortgaged it. They come tomorrow—

WIFE
Today. Noon. Not tomorrow.

She checks her watch. 10:47 AM.

WIFE
We have seventy-three minutes.

HUSBAND
(panicking)
I'll go to the bank—

WIFE
The papers are signed. The only thing that voids them is clearing the debt before the notary arrives.

She shows him her phone. A text reads: "Notary finalizing transfer at 12:00 PM."

HUSBAND
(desperate)
What do we do?

WIFE
(eyes sharp)
You take what's left of this cue. We go find your friends.

She helps him to his feet, brushes dust from his shirt.

WIFE
And when we get there, I need you to do exactly what I say.

HUSBAND
(quietly)
What are you going to do?

WIFE
I'm going to borrow a proper cue. And you're going to bet everything we have left.

HUSBAND
We have nothing—

WIFE
Not true.

She taps her temple.

WIFE
We have me.

WIFE heads for the door. Husband stares after her, then at the wrecked room. A flicker of hope crosses his face.

A flash of determination crosses WIFE's face as she exits.

title: When I Left, I Still Resent This Long Separation
description: A former noblewoman, now destitute and dying in a ruined temple, is confronted by her adopted daughter who reveals the truth about the betrayal that destroyed their family.
context:
Title: When I Left, I Still Resent This Long Separation
Description: A former noblewoman, now destitute and dying in a ruined temple, is confronted by her adopted daughter who reveals the truth about the betrayal that destroyed their family.

INT. RUINED TEMPLE - NIGHT

A stormy night with thunder and rain. A dilapidated temple.

SHEN CHANGLI, white-haired and dressed in rags, sits on a pile of dry straw, looking sadly at a painting in her hands.

SHEN CHANGLI
Shuhua... your fifteenth birthday. I promised you a jade comb from the capital.

SHEN CHANGLI coughs violently, her frail body shaking. She carefully tucks the painting inside her tattered robes.

The temple door is kicked open. XIE YURONG, dressed in luxurious robes, walks in surrounded by GUARDS. She covers her nose with a handkerchief in disgust.

XIE YURONG
Is this even a place for people to live?

XIE YURONG
Shen Changli, you were once a high and mighty descendant of a military family. How is it that now you live worse than a stray dog?

SHEN CHANGLI
Eighteen years ago, you were freezing in a temple like this. I took you in. I gave you a name.

XIE YURONG suddenly steps forward and snatches the painting from SHEN CHANGLI's hands.

SHEN CHANGLI
(panicked)
What are you doing?

SHEN CHANGLI lunges forward trying to grab the painting back, but is pushed to the ground by XIE YURONG. She struggles to get up, clutching the painting tightly, crying in pain.

XIE YURONG
I tore all her portraits. But you kept one.
continuation:
XIE YURONG
Now you'll never be able to find her.

SHEN CHANGLI
(sobbing)
Yurong, she is your sister!

XIE YURONG
Who told you to drive your own daughter out? While giving me her title, her dowry, her life?

XIE YURONG
If I found her, where would I be?

SHEN CHANGLI
(desperate)
I raised you as a noble lady for eighteen years. Even a wolf would recognize its pack.

XIE YURONG
I recognize opportunity. You taught me that.

XIE YURONG
Every time I called you Mother, I earned another piece of your empire.

XIE YURONG kicks SHEN CHANGLI, who falls to the ground. The painting also falls onto the dry straw.

XIE YURONG
(coldly laughing)
Shen Changli, let me tell you the truth. The Crown Prince's bed? My design. The witnesses? My coin. Your husband's execution? My signature.

XIE YURONG
But the hand that struck her? That pushed her into the snow? That was yours.

SHEN CHANGLI, hearing the truth, clutches her chest. She coughs blood, but with her last strength, grabs the painting and clutches it to her heart as she dies.

Fresh blood splatters onto her daughter's portrait.

END SCENE

title: Cherished in His Heart
description: A young woman discovers she is pregnant after a mysterious night with a stranger, unaware that he is searching for her.
context:
Title: Cherished in His Heart
Description: A young woman discovers she is pregnant after a mysterious night with a stranger, unaware that he is searching for her.

INT. HOSPITAL CONSULTATION ROOM - DAY

The sterile room smells of antiseptic. SU QIN (23, anxious but composed) sits across from a NURSE (40s, professional but tired) who consults a tablet.

NURSE
Ms. Su? Your results are ready.

The nurse slides a diagnostic report across the desk. SU QIN's fingers tremble as she picks it up.

INSERT - ULTRASOUND IMAGE
A small gestational sac, 6 weeks.

SU QIN (V.O.)
Six weeks. That night... the man in the hotel.

INT. HOTEL CORRIDOR - NIGHT (FLASHBACK)

Handheld, dreamlike. SU QIN stumbles, fanning herself. Her face is flushed, breathing ragged. She clutches the wall for support.

SU QIN (V.O.)
(hushed)
So hot... what did they put in my drink?

GU BEISHEN (29, sharp features blurred in the darkness) appears, equally unsteady, his expensive shirt unbuttoned. He grips a doorframe.

They notice each other. Time slows.

GU BEISHEN
(bruised voice)
You're... from the family dinner?

SU QIN
(confused, defensive)
What? No. I'm just—

She backs into a wall. He follows, but stops an arm's length away. Their eyes lock. Something passes between them—recognition of mutual vulnerability.

GU BEISHEN
(whisper)
You're not her. But you smell like...

He leans in slightly. SU QIN doesn't pull away. Their foreheads almost touch.

SU QIN
(barely audible)
Gardenias.
continuation:
INT. HOTEL ROOM - NIGHT (FLASHBACK CONTINUES)

Dimly lit. They fall through the door together, a tangle of urgent need and shared desperation.

QUICK CUTS:
- Their hands clasp, fingers intertwining.
- GU BEISHEN's thumb wipes a tear from SU QIN's cheek.
- He produces a simple pearl earring from his pocket.
- She flinches as he gently fastens it to her lobe.

GU BEISHEN
(whispering against her temple)
This will keep you safe.

SU QIN
(aching)
I don't even know your name.

He kisses her before she can finish. The world dissolves.

INT. HOSPITAL CONSULTATION ROOM - DAY

BACK TO SCENE.

SU QIN looks up from the report, pale.

NURSE
Ms. Su? Are you alright?

SU QIN
(stammering)
I... I don't know how to—

NURSE
(softening)
It's a lot. Your chart says you're unmarried. Do you have family support?

SU QIN
My parents are...

She stops. The nurse nods, understanding.

NURSE
You have options. But you're already near the surgical cutoff. If you're considering termination, costs run 6-8 thousand, depending—

SU QIN
(quietly)
That's... I don't have—

NURSE
(sighs)
Then you'll need to decide fast. Either way, you'll need prenatal vitamins if you continue.

The nurse stands, leaving SU QIN with the report. She touches the pearl earring still in her ear.

INT. HOSPITAL LOBBY - DAY

GU BEISHEN (immaculate suit, controlled) walks with LU LINJING (32, cheerful doctor). Both carry coffee.

LU LINJING
Ninth Brother, you flew three thousand miles because you "can't feel anything"? That's not a medical diagnosis, that's poetic despair.

GU BEISHEN
(icy)
My therapist recommended a change of scenery. Not a commentary.

LU LINJING
Right. And testing for every allergy known to medicine was... what?

GU BEISHEN
Precaution.

They pass the consultation wing desk. SU QIN emerges, folding her report into her bag, her hair concealing her face.

GU BEISHEN freezes. His nostrils flare subtly. He turns.

HIS POV: SU QIN walking away. A glimpse of her profile. The pearl earring catches the fluorescent light.

GU BEISHEN (V.O.)
Gardenias... and the earring. It's her.

He starts after her, abandoned coffee cup in hand.

ON SCREEN: TO BE CONTINUED

title: Cute Baby National Master: Asked to Perform Immortal Arts, You Perform Magic Tricks
description: A world-famous magician transmigrates into a seven-year-old national master in an ancient dynasty, where he must use his magic tricks to solve supernatural crises and help the struggling empress.
context:
Title: Cute Baby National Master: Asked to Perform Immortal Arts, You Perform Magic Tricks
Description: A world-famous magician transmigrates into a seven-year-old national master in an ancient dynasty, where he must use his magic tricks to solve supernatural crises and help the struggling empress.

INT. TRUCK - DAY

ZHAO XU, a young and handsome man, drives a cargo truck through heavy rain, jaw tight with fatigue.

On the passenger seat, his phone rings. The caller ID shows "Boss Zhou."

ZHAO XU taps the phone. 

BOSS ZHOU (V.O.)
Xu. Five thousand seats. You're on in twenty.

ZHAO XU
(casually)
Prop check ran long. I'm five minutes out.

BOSS ZHOU (V.O.)
Don't make me remind you what's riding on this.

ZHAO XU
You won't have to.

He hangs up. Rain hammers the windshield.

ZHAO XU
(muttering)
One last show. Then I'm done.

A CYCLIST swerves in front of the truck without warning.

ZHAO XU's eyes widen. He slams the brakes.

Tires SCREAM. The truck HYDROPLANES.

EXT. NATIONAL MASTER'S RESIDENCE - DAY

An elegant ancient-style mansion with a plaque reading "National Master's Residence."

A EUNUCH stands at the entrance, voice cracking with urgency.

EUNUCH
Imperial decree has arrived!
continuation:
INT. NATIONAL MASTER'S RESIDENCE MAIN HALL - DAY

ZHAO XU, now a seven-year-old child in oversized robes, sleeps fitfully on a worn couch.

LU LINGLONG, a young maidservant with ink-stained fingers, shakes him awake.

LU LINGLONG
Master! The palace summons—now!

ZHAO XU
(groggy)
The what?

LU LINGLONG
An imperial decree! After three years of nothing but porridge! Do you know how hard it is to stretch one bag of flash powder?

ZHAO XU sits up, rubbing his eyes, and catches his reflection in a bronze mirror—seven-year-old face.

ZHAO XU
We're still this short?

LU LINGLONG
You're seven.

ZHAO XU (V.O.)
Seven years. One truck crash. A thousand magic props turned to ash—except what I held. I've performed for rats to survive. Today, I perform for a queen.

ZHAO XU stands, rolling up too-long sleeves.

ZHAO XU
Fetch the remaining smoke bombs. We're going to work.

LU LINGLONG
(voice cracking)
Thank the heavens.

EXT. PALACE SQUARE - DAY

EMPRESS WU, 25, stands rigid in plain armor. PRINCESS MEI, her younger sister, hovers close.

PRINCESS
Imperial Sister, the National Master is a child. What can he possibly—

EMPRESS
The tax silver didn't vanish. It was taken by something that left no footprints. Minister Cai blames my rule. I blame myself.

MINISTER CAI, smirking, approaches with a scroll.

MINISTER CAI
(mockingly)
Your Majesty, the hour expires. Perhaps the spirits are too greedy, they've eaten your little magician too?

The EUNUCH's voice cuts through the wind.

EUNUCH
The National Master has arrived!

OFFICIALS glance around. The square is empty except for swirling dust.

OFFICIAL
Where? I see nothing.

EMPRESS
Show yourself!

PRINCESS
(points)
There!

At the far end of the square, a single red silk ribbon unfurls—snaking across the stones as if pulled by invisible hands.

ZHAO XU (V.O.)
Last smoke bomb. Don't choke.

Thick white mist EXPLODES upward. Through it, a crimson carpet rolls out.

ZHAO XU, in ill-fitting National Master robes, walks the carpet alone. Every step echoes.

His seven-year-old face is stone-cold serious.

ZHAO XU
(to himself)
Showtime. For real.

title: Never Meet Again at the Place of Longing
description: A legendary warrior from ancient times gives up everything to reunite with her beloved in the Republican era, only to discover his betrayal.
context:
Title: Never Meet Again at the Place of Longing
Description: A legendary warrior from ancient times gives up everything to reunite with her beloved in the Republican era, only to discover his betrayal.

INT. ANCIENT ROOM - DAY

SHEN QINGTANG, dressed in elegant ancient attire, sits before her vanity. Her fingers trace the jade pendant on the table, its surface worn smooth by countless journeys.

SHEN QINGTANG (V.O.)
This pendant has carried me across centuries. But this time, I'm not returning.

EXT. DOORWAY - DAY

FLASHBACK:

SHEN QINGTANG, wearing red battle armor and drenched in blood, collapses through the doorway. Her sword CLATTERS against stone.

CHEN FENG, a Republican-era youth wearing glasses, rushes forward. His hands tremble as he presses cloth against her wounds.

CHEN FENG
Stay with me. Please. I don't even know your name, but please—don't die.

Her blood seeps through his fingers. His eyes are raw with genuine terror.

END FLASHBACK.

INT. ANCIENT ROOM - DAY

Close-up of SHEN QINGTANG, her reflection fractured in the bronze mirror.

SHEN QINGTANG (V.O.)
They call me the Nation-Guarding Martial Saint. Tomorrow, they'll call me a deserter. Let them.

INT. REPUBLICAN BEDROOM - DAY

SHEN QINGTANG wakes with a gasp. Republican-era ceiling fan spins lazily overhead. CHEN FENG dozes in a chair beside her, spectacles askew.

SHEN QINGTANG
Where...?

CHEN FENG
(startles awake)
My home. You're safe now.

He pours medicine with steady hands, but dark circles shadow his eyes.

CHEN FENG
Drink slowly. You've been feverish for three days.

He feeds her the spoonfuls with practiced care. She watches him, something softening in her gaze.

SHEN QINGTANG (V.O.)
He saved me when I had nothing. In this strange era, his kindness feels like the only certain thing.

INT. ANCIENT ROOM - DAY

SHEN QINGTANG closes the ancient book, its pages marked with Chen's careful annotations in modern ink. She lifts the jade pendant, now bound with thread from her own armor.

SHEN QINGTANG
(thirty years of longing in her voice)
One last time.
continuation:
EXT. QINZHEN HALL - DAY

SHEN QINGTANG emerges from the hall. Above, storm clouds gather. The jade pendant flares in her palm, dissolving into threads of light that weave through her armor, transmuting it into a Republican-era dress. She vanishes.

Light arcs across the sky, striking the Chen Residence.

EXT. CHEN RESIDENCE COURTYARD - NIGHT

The light deposits SHEN QINGTANG in the courtyard. Thunder rumbles. She looks up at the brewing storm, then at the house where Chen's silhouette moves behind a window.

SHEN QINGTANG
(whispering)
Not tonight.

She raises her hand. The clouds still, then unravel like silk threads, revealing a full moon.

She watches the moonlight touch Chen's window, a genuine smile on her face.

INT. KITCHEN - DAY

SHEN QINGTANG kneads dough, her ancient hands clumsy with modern tools. A burn mark scars her wrist—oven, not battlefield. She smiles at it.

SHEN QINGTANG (V.O.)
Last time he ate my pastries, he said they tasted like home. I want to deserve that word.

EXT. CHEN RESIDENCE COURTYARD - DAY

CHEN FENG's mother SUN XIUFANG adjusts his tournament robes. CHEN FENG stares at his hands—these hands that have held Shen's, that have learned sword forms from her memory.

SUN XIUFANG
The Zhao family sent their betrothal gift yesterday. After tomorrow's tournament, you'll be engaged to their daughter.

CHEN FENG
(something hollow in his voice)
Mother, Shen Qingtang—

SUN XIUFANG
—is a ghost from another time. Useful, but not a wife. You've always known this.

A beat. Chen looks away.

CHEN FENG
The Ancient Martial Arts she taught me... I've incorporated them into my own style. No one can tell.

SUN XIUFANG
Good. Let her win your preliminary matches. When she faces you in the final, she'll yield. She loves you.

CHEN FENG
She'll yield.

He says it like he's trying to convince himself. Then, quieter:

CHEN FENG
After the wedding... I'll give her a position. As concubine. It's more than she could have hoped for, in her era.

A plate SHATTERS.

They turn. SHEN QINGTANG stands there, flour on her hands, the shattered pastries at her feet. Her face is a battlefield of realization.

CHEN FENG
Shen—

The name dies in his throat. He sees what she heard written across her face.

SUN XIUFANG takes Chen's arm, pulling him back.

The courtyard becomes very quiet.

SHEN QINGTANG looks at Chen. Then at the broken pastries. Then at the sky she cleared for him last night.

Her expression goes very, very still.

EXT. CHEN RESIDENCE COURTYARD - CONTINUOUS

She turns and walks away. Not staggering. Not running. Walking like a warrior who has just discovered the war was a lie.

Behind her, CHEN FENG starts to reach out. His mother grips his wrist.

SUN XIUFANG
(quietly)
Let her go. You have a tournament to win.

CHEN FENG watches Shen disappear through the gate, his face unreadable.

EXT. ANCIENT BATTLEFIELD - DAY (FLASHBACK)

SHEN QINGTANG lies bleeding. Young CHEN FENG holds her, his glasses fogged with tears.

CHEN FENG (V.O.)
Please don't die.

INT. REPUBLICAN BEDROOM - NIGHT (FLASHBACK)

CHEN FENG squeezes SHEN QINGTANG's hand as she sleeps, his face full of wonder.

CHEN FENG (V.O.)
You came back for me.

EXT. CHEN RESIDENCE COURTYARD - DAY (PRESENT)

CHEN FENG stands alone in the courtyard, looking at the broken porcelain. He picks up a piece, holding it in his palm until it draws blood.

A shadow falls across him—Shen has returned, her dress now armor, her love now a weapon sheathed.

SHEN QINGTANG
You taught me something, Chen Feng. In this era, betrayal has a different name.

She drops the jade pendant at his feet. It cracks in two.

SHEN QINGTANG
Consider it a parting gift.

She turns. This time, he doesn't watch her leave. He stares at the broken pendant and the blood on his palm.

SHEN QINGTANG (V.O.)
I gave up eternity for a lie. But a warrior who has lost everything... has nothing left to fear.

Thunder rolls—real thunder, not hers to command. The storm she held back finally breaks.

In the distance, the Martial Arts Conference banner flaps in the rising wind. But Shen Qingtang walks away from all of it—from tournaments, from destiny, from the boy who saved her only to destroy her.

The rain begins. She doesn't look back.

FADE TO BLACK.

title: My General Dotes on His Wife's Maid
description: On a wedding day where a noble lady and her maid are both marrying the general as equal wives, the bride's arrogance leads to an unexpected turn of events.
context:
Title: My General Dotes on His Wife's Maid
Description: On a wedding day where a noble lady and her maid are both marrying the general as equal wives, the bride's arrogance leads to an unexpected turn of events.

INT. GENERAL'S MANSION WEDDING HALL - DAY

SFX: Stirring music

The hall is adorned with red silk, filled with guests. LADY ZHAO sits in the seat of honor, her posture rigid.

GUEST (V.O.)
(whispered)
A minister's daughter sharing the altar with her maid... and as equal wives? Unprecedented.

GUEST (V.O.)
(whispered)
General Zhao's reputation will be tested today.

GUEST (V.O.)
(whispered)
The Minister won't stand for an insult to his house.

The groom, ZHAO WUXU, dressed in red wedding attire, enters the hall with two brides. One is MENG YAOHUA, covered with a red veil, and the other is QING YUAN, her face hidden behind a round fan.

ZHAO WUXU
Mother.

LADY ZHAO nods with a measured smile.

OFFICIANT
The auspicious hour has arrived. Let the newlyweds bow together!

MENG YAOHUA suddenly lifts her veil, interrupting the ceremony.

MENG YAOHUA
Wait! I am the legitimate daughter of the Minister's household. Though we are married together, I should bow first. How can I bow side by side with a mere maid?

ZHAO WUXU
Since you are unwilling to bow together, then we shall not bow together.

MENG YAOHUA
(stunned)
General, this...

ZHAO WUXU ignores MENG YAOHUA, takes QING YUAN's hand, and they bow together toward the seat of honor.

QING YUAN
(softly)
General...

MENG YAOHUA stands to the side, her face filled with shock and humiliation.

QING YUAN (V.O.)
Ten days ago, I was sent to test a marriage. I never expected to become the bride.
continuation:
EXT. MINISTER'S MANSION - DAY (FLASHBACK)

TITLE CARD: Ten Days Ago

A group of maids walks in formation through the courtyard of the Minister's mansion.

MAID (V.O.)
(overlapping whispers)
Keep straight. Don't stumble.

INT. MINISTER'S MANSION GREAT HALL - DAY

The maids stand in formation. NANNY QIN holds a discipline ruler, her expression stern as she scrutinizes them.

MAID ONE
(whispered)
The Emperor's decree came down days ago. They're selecting a maid to test the marriage for the young mistress.

NANNY QIN
No good! Posture reveals character.

MAID TWO
(whispered)
General Zhao has campaigned for years without a woman. If he favors you after the test...

NANNY QIN
(sternly)
Silence! Whispers will be expelled!

NANNY QIN walks up to QING YUAN, measures her shoulders with the ruler, then lifts her chin to examine her carefully.

NANNY QIN
You. Come with me.

QING YUAN looks straight ahead with determined eyes.

title: Famine Year - The Village Eats Tree Bark While I Feast on Meat with My Family
description: A man transmigrates into a poor young man's body during a famine year, inheriting memories of his selfish past and facing a starving family.
context:
Title: Famine Year - The Village Eats Tree Bark While I Feast on Meat with My Family
Description: A man transmigrates into a poor young man's body during a famine year, inheriting memories of his selfish past and facing a starving family.

INT. DILAPIDATED HUT - DAY

A thatched hut suffocating under famine's weight. GU ZHOUYUAN (19) lies deathly still on moldy straw, corpse-pale. His younger brother GOUDAN (9) clutches his hand, weeping. Older sister GU ZHAODI (21) hovers, hollow-eyed, watching her brother's chest for any rise.

GOUDAN
(crying out)
Second Brother, Second Brother, wake up! Don't die!

At the doorway, SEVERAL VILLAGERS watch like carrion birds.

VILLAGER A
Even the Gu family's pampered son is about to starve. This famine year... it shows no mercy.

VILLAGER B
(quieter, cutting)
His siblings gave him everything. If he goes, at least they can finally eat.

GU ZHAODI
(whirling, voice raw)
All of you, shut up!

GU ZHOUYUAN's eyes SNAP OPEN—confusion, then the sickening lurch of wrong memories. Wrong life.

GOUDAN
continuation:
(overjoyed)
Sister, he's awake! Second Brother is awake!

GU ZHAODI
(crying tears of joy)
Second Brother is awake! Xiaoyuan, you scared me to death!

The VILLAGERS at the door recoil, murmuring superstitious prayers.

VILLAGER C
Hey, look at him...

VILLAGER A
How did he wake up?

VILLAGER B
How did he come back from the dead?

VILLAGER C
He really has a tough life!

GU ZHOUYUAN slowly sits up, head splitting. His gaze lands on ZHAODI's rope-thin wrists, GOUDAN's swollen hunger-belly, the empty pot in the corner. Memory fragments assault him—taking their food, their mother's last grain, complaining it wasn't meat.

GU ZHOUYUAN (V.O.)
I was a ghost in their lives. Now I'm the one who's haunted.

He looks at his siblings. They meet his eyes—then glance away, the old reflex. For the first time, he truly sees them. And himself.

title: So What If I'm Arrogant
description: A centuries-old cultivator emerges from seclusion and navigates the modern world, meeting a young woman he befriended online who has no idea of his true age.
context:
Title: So What If I'm Arrogant
Description: A centuries-old cultivator emerges from seclusion and navigates the modern world, meeting a young woman he befriended online who has no idea of his true age.

INT. GU YUROU'S BEDROOM - NIGHT

GU YUROU, wearing white pajamas, lies on her bed happily chatting on her phone.

The phone screen shows the chat history.

SO WHAT IF I'M ARROGANT (TEXT)
Where should we meet?

GU YUROU
Then it's settled. Tomorrow we'll meet at the bus stop across from Jiangcheng Huanshi Plaza.

EXT. MOUNTAIN COTTAGE - DAY

A group of VILLAGERS kneels before a thatched cottage shrouded in golden light. The VILLAGE CHIEF holds up a new smartphone.

VILLAGE CHIEF
Immortal, you mentioned the signal was weak. Please accept this.

A grand voice emanates from the cottage.

JIANG YI (O.S.)
A hundred years have passed. I have emerged from seclusion. There will be no more immortal in this valley. You need not return.

Golden light shoots skyward and vanishes. The villagers remain kneeling, awestruck.

YOUNG VILLAGER
(whispering)
The last cultivator... truly exists.

INT. ANCIENT STYLE ROOM - NIGHT

Candlelight flickers. JIANG YI, in traditional costume, sits with the new phone, replying to messages.

LITTLE ROU CAN'T SLEEP ENOUGH (TEXT)
Tomorrow we'll meet at the bus stop across from Jiangcheng Huanshi Plaza.

SO WHAT IF I'M ARROGANT (TEXT)
Good! I have a request!

GU YUROU looks at her phone and smiles.

SO WHAT IF I'M ARROGANT (TEXT)
In my heart there is a tiger that sniffs at roses. Bring a rose with you.

GU YUROU
(to herself)
Oh, right.

LITTLE ROU CAN'T SLEEP ENOUGH (TEXT)
We've been chatting for so long, but I still don't know how old you are. Are you a post-90s or post-00s?

SO WHAT IF I'M ARROGANT (TEXT)
What do you mean by post-90s and post-00s?

LITTLE ROU CAN'T SLEEP ENOUGH (TEXT)
Don't tease me. Of course post-90s means born after 1990, and post-00s means born after 2000.

JIANG YI sends a "oh" emoji.

SO WHAT IF I'M ARROGANT (TEXT)
Then I'm post-00s.

GU YUROU
Yay!

GU YUROU excitedly rolls around on the bed, hugging a teddy bear.

GU YUROU
(to herself)
Finally meeting after so long. He knows so much, yet he's my age. What does he even look like?
continuation:
INT. ANCIENT STYLE ROOM - NIGHT

JIANG YI puts down his phone and picks up a black and white photo of two men from the Republican era.

JIANG YI (V.O.)
A hundred years in seclusion, and it's time to emerge again. Brother, I will take care of your descendants.

EXT. BUS STOP - DAY

GU YUROU, wearing a white dress, holds a red rose and waits anxiously at the bus stop.

GU YUROU
(to herself)
"Tigers sniffing roses"... making me bring a rose. This is so embarrassing.

The petals suddenly fall off. She gasps as they instantly restore themselves. She stares at the rose in shock.

A man in a blue Taoist robe wearing sunglasses, JIANG YI, walks toward her. Several PASSERBY GIRLS turn to stare, phones out.

PASSERBY GIRL A
Wow, so handsome...

JIANG YI walks up to GU YUROU, also holding a red rose, and hands it to her.

JIANG YI removes his sunglasses.

JIANG YI
Are you Little Rou Can't Sleep Enough?

GU YUROU
(surprised)
You're So What If I'm Arrogant? You're post-00s?

JIANG YI
Born in 1900. According to what you said, that's post-00s. That's correct.

GU YUROU
(in disbelief)
1900 counts too?

GU YUROU is dumbstruck.

FADE OUT.

title: The Scam
description: A man in a denim jacket is tricked into signing away his house, which was meant to cover his sister's surgery costs, and confronts the scammer in a desperate attempt to get it back.
context:
Title: The Scam
Description: A man in a denim jacket is tricked into signing away his house, which was meant to cover his sister's surgery costs, and confronts the scammer in a desperate attempt to get it back.

EXT. STREET - DAY

DENIM JACKET MAN (30s, hollow-eyed) watches from across the street as SUITED MAN (50s, polished) and QIN HUAMEI (30s, nervous smile) exit a notary office, laughing over documents. He clutches a phone: a hospital text reads "Final payment: 48 hours."

His gaze drops to a loose brick near a construction barrier.

INT. HOTEL LOBBY - DAY

DENIM JACKET MAN follows them into a luxury hotel lobby. As SUITED MAN turns toward the elevators, DENIM JACKET MAN shoves him hard against a marble column. SUITED MAN's briefcase spills, papers scattering.

DENIM JACKET MAN
(brick trembling in hand)
Transfer it back. Now.

QIN HUAMEI
(backing away)
Security! Please!

TWO SECURITY GUARDS rush over, pinning DENIM JACKET MAN's arms.

DENIM JACKET MAN
(struggling, eyes fixed on SUITED MAN)
You forged my signature! My sister's surgery—

SUITED MAN
(straightening his suit, cold fury)
You're confused. Remove him.
continuation:
INT. HOTEL ENTRANCE - DAY

The SECURITY GUARDS deposit DENIM JACKET MAN on the sidewalk. One flashes a warning look.

SECURITY GUARD 1
Don't come back.

DENIM JACKET MAN sits dazed, a cut on his temple. SUITED MAN emerges, lighting a cigarette.

SUITED MAN
(exhaling)
Black and white, friend. Your signature. Her collateral.

DENIM JACKET MAN
(barely audible)
Three days...

SUITED MAN
Then work fast.

SUITED MAN drops the signed contract pages. They flutter around DENIM JACKET MAN, QIN HUAMEI's signature visible: Witness.

title: The You I Lost
description: Two children are separated during a kidnapping attempt. Fifteen years later, the boy, now a powerful CEO, searches for the girl who saved his life.
context:
Title: The You I Lost
Description: Two children are separated during a kidnapping attempt. Fifteen years later, the boy, now a powerful CEO, searches for the girl who saved his life.

INT. OUTSIDE ABANDONED BUILDING - DAY

Two PRIVATE SCHOOL CHILDREN, LITTLE MU (10, terrified heir) and YIYI (10, fierce protector), sprint through debris. THREE MEN in black pursue.

YIYI
(urgently)
Little Mu, hurry! We can't let them catch us!

VILLAIN LEADER
(40s, scarred)
Faster!

CHASER
Chase them! Faster!

LITTLE MU stumbles, his blazer tearing on rebar. He hits the ground.

LITTLE MU
(in pain)
Don't worry about me, just run!

YIYI runs back, yanks him up by the arm.

YIYI
I will never leave you behind!

INT. ABANDONED WAREHOUSE - DAY

YIYI and LITTLE MU hide behind a haystack, watching the window. The VILLAIN LEADER and his HENCHMEN search outside.

VILLAIN LEADER
We planned this for so long. If that little master escapes, I'll kill you all! They're nearby, split up and search!

HENCHMAN
Yes, Captain Tang!

YIYI and LITTLE MU hide, frozen. YIYI spots a CHILD'S VIOLIN CASE half-buried in the straw.

YIYI
(whispering)
Little Mu.

LITTLE MU
(comforting)
Don't be afraid.

YIYI takes off a jade pendant from her neck and ties it around his wrist.

YIYI
I told you I would take good care of you. This belonged to my mother. If we meet again, this will be our token. You must keep it safe.

YIYI grabs the violin and rushes out, drawing the enemies away.

LITTLE MU
(panicking)
Yiyi!
continuation:
EXT. WOODS - DAY

The VILLAIN LEADER catches YIYI by the hair.

VILLAIN LEADER
You brat, where's that boy?

YIYI keeps her mouth shut. The VILLAIN LEADER slaps her; the violin falls, splintering against a rock.

VILLAIN LEADER
Will you talk? Will you talk?

YIYI still refuses. The Villain Leader laughs.

VILLAIN LEADER
(to henchman)
Take her back first! The state orphanage will get a nice donation for this one.

HENCHMAN
Yes!

The HENCHMAN carries Yiyi away. LITTLE MU emerges, picks up the broken violin neck and pendant from the dirt.

LITTLE MU
(choking up)
Yiyi, wait for me.

INT. LUXURIOUS LIVING ROOM - DAY

Fifteen years later. YIYI (25, faded bruises) is pushed down by YAO YUWAN. She hits the marble floor.

YAO YUWAN
Give it to me! Give it to me!

A middle-aged wealthy woman, CHEN MEIRU, walks over.

YIYI
(timidly)
Mom...

CHEN MEIRU
(with disgust)
Who are you calling Mom? Your mother died of grief looking for you long ago!

YAO YUWAN
(clinging to CHEN MEIRU's arm)
Mom, Dad said that restaurant is really hard to book. We should hurry.

CHEN MEIRU
(indulgently)
Alright. If you weren't somewhat useful, I would have kicked you out long ago. Go practice! You're going to the Moon Garden tomorrow too.

CHEN MEIRU leaves with YAO YUWAN. YIYI lies alone on the floor, takes out the TWIN PENDANT from under her collar.

INT. OFFICE - DAY

The adult LITTLE MU, now XIAO MU (25, sleepless), looks at the pendant in his hand.

XIAO MU
Yiyi, where are you?

SECRETARY LI (40s, efficient) rushes in with a tablet.

SECRETARY LI
Mr. Xiao! There's a lead on Miss Yiyi!

XIAO MU
(excited)
Tell me quickly!

SECRETARY LI
Baokui Theater's gala performer list. She's there, with the pendant.

A glimmer of light flashes in Xiao Mu's eyes, his expression determined. Through the window, lightning illuminates Baokui Theater's dome.

title: He Is The Light
description: Song Zhinuan finds herself seated next to Zhou Siluo, the boy she never expected to be her deskmate, leading to unexpected encounters and complications.
context:
Title: He Is The Light
Description: Song Zhinuan finds herself seated next to Zhou Siluo, the boy she never expected to be her deskmate, leading to unexpected encounters and complications.

INT. CLASSROOM - DAY

SONG ZHINUAN, fingers tight on her backpack straps, pauses at the doorway. ZHOU SILUO taps a pencil rhythm on her desk. She straightens her collar before entering.

SONG ZHINUAN (V.O.)
Please don't notice me. Please don't—

ZHOU SILUO turns. His smile catches her mid-step.

ZHOU SILUO
Morning.

She slides into her seat, eyes on her backpack zipper.

ZHOU SILUO
The teacher thinks you're my last shot at not flunking. No pressure.

SONG ZHINUAN
(chin lifting)
I charge by the question.

He laughs—surprised, genuine.

ZHOU SILUO
Deal. So question one: why sit like you're bracing for impact?

SONG ZHINUAN
I don't—

ZHOU SILUO
(off her posture)
Defcon 1, clearly.

She consciously relaxes. He extends his hand.

ZHOU SILUO
Now we're just normal deskmates.

She stares at his hand. He lets it hang.

ZHU LIANG taps him from behind.

ZHU LIANG
Yo, Luo. Basketball.

ZHOU SILUO doesn't turn.

ZHOU SILUO
Busy.

ZHU LIANG
(surprised)
Since when?

He peers over ZHOU SILUO's shoulder at SONG ZHINUAN.
continuation:
ZHU LIANG
Oh. I get it. Hi, sister-in-law.

ZHOU SILUO's hand—still extended—flips into a warning finger.

ZHOU SILUO
Say it again and I'll delete your account.

ZHU LIANG
(mock-scared)
Empty threat.

ZHOU SILUO drops his hand, digs in his bag, and sets sesame crackers on her textbook.

ZHOU SILUO
Tutoring fee. In advance.

He exits. ZHU LIANG's arm slings around his shoulder as they go.

ZHU LIANG
She's got you leashed, bro...

BEST FRIEND slides into the empty seat, picking up the crackers.

BEST FRIEND
He remembered you like these.

SONG ZHINUAN
Coincidence.

BEST FRIEND
Right. And he 'coincidentally' told Mrs. Chen he needed academic assistance. ZHOU SILUO. Requesting homework help. Since never.

BEST FRIEND tears the package open.

BEST FRIEND
Keep telling yourself that.

A FEMALE CLASSMATE shouts from the doorway, her smile tight.

FEMALE CLASSMATE
Song Zhinuan. Someone's asking for you.

INT. HALLWAY - DAY

The FEMALE STUDENT leans against the lockers, arms crossed. Her nails tap ZHOU SILUO's pencil rhythm against her sleeve.

FEMALE STUDENT
You sit next to him now.

Not a question. SONG ZHINUAN's hand stops on the classroom door—still ajar.

FEMALE STUDENT
I need you to understand something. He doesn't want a tutor.

She steps closer. The overhead fluorescent flickers.

FEMALE STUDENT
He wants a project.

title: Dark Abyss Prison
description: A legendary female war god delivers the world's most dangerous criminal to a maximum security prison, only to discover his capture was part of a plan to challenge the prison's supreme ruler.
context:
Title: Dark Abyss Prison
Description: A legendary female war god delivers the world's most dangerous criminal to a maximum security prison, only to discover his capture was part of a plan to challenge the prison's supreme ruler.

INT. DARK ABYSS PRISON - NIGHT

Alarms SHRIEK. Red lights STROBE through smoke and shadow.

Inmates howl in their cells. Two PRISONERS face off in the common area.

CANNON FACE
(low, dangerous)
Number two spot's mine. Six months running.

PRISONER A
Prove it.

They clash. Others scramble for cover. A TOWER GUARD watches from reinforced glass, unblinking.

NARRATOR (V.O.)
They call this chaos. They haven't seen anything yet.

EXT. DARK ABYSS PRISON - COURTYARD - DAY

Rain hammers the concrete. A MILITARY TANK rolls through the gates. BLACK SUVs and ARMED SOLDIERS follow.

QIN SHIYUE (30s), red coat snapping in the wind, stands on the tank. Her uniform bears five stars—Great Xia's highest honor. Her eyes scan the prison with cold assessment.

NARRATOR (V.O.)
Qin Shiyue. Youngest Five-Star War God in history. She delivered him.

INT. DARK ABYSS PRISON - NIGHT

TANG JIE (40s), massive, wrists and neck locked in CARVED WOODEN SHACKLES that glow with faint runes. TWO SPECIAL OPS guards escort him. Qin Shiyue follows, hand on sword hilt.

Inmates press against cell bars, whispering.

PRISONER 2099
(quietly)
Tang Jie. The Butcher of Shanghai. They actually got him.

Qin Shiyue stops Tang Jie before a reinforced door.

QIN SHIYUE
Seventh 3S criminal this year. Don't make this difficult.

TANG JIE
(turns slowly)
Difficult? For you?

His eyes flick to her ready sword hand. Then to the pulsing runes on his shackles.

TANG JIE
You protect a family, General? A people?

QIN SHIYUE
That's not your concern.

TANG JIE
Exactly. You'd never walk into hell willingly.

The runes FLARE. The shackles CRACK and splinter.

TANG JIE
I needed the invitation.

He EXPLODES free. A SHOCKWAVE sends guards sprawling. Qin Shiyue draws her blade—

Tang Jie catches her wrist. Not a fight. A statement.

TANG JIE
Stay down.

He releases her. She drops to one knee, not from force, but from the weight of realization.

TANG JIE
(to the cells)
Three years without a king. That ends today.

The block erupts. Inmates cheer, bang bars.
continuation:
PRISONER 2099
The Emperor will fillet you for this!

He charges from his cell. Tang Jie side-steps, uses momentum to send him into the wall. One strike. Down.

CANNON FACE
(from the shadows)
The Domain Emperor's word is law here. You breathe because he allows it.

TANG JIE
Then I suggest he stop allowing it.

SNAKE MOUNTAIN DEMON
Kill the blasphemer!

Inmates pour from cells. A tide.

TANG JIE
(grinning)
Let's see what three years of fear has built.

He moves like a storm. Precise, economical. Bodies drop—disabled, not dead. This isn't rage. It's surgery.

Silence. Twenty inmates on the ground, groaning. Tang Jie stands untouched.

TANG JIE
Three years ago, I built this place. Then I left. Now I'm back.

BOOTS on metal stairs from above.

DOMAIN EMPEROR (O.S.)
You built a prison. I built an empire.

The DOMAIN EMPEROR (20s), young, descends in a black embroidered coat. Each step rings with authority.

PRISONER 2099
(from the floor)
My lord... we tried—

DOMAIN EMPEROR
I know. As planned.

He reaches the bottom floor. Faces Tang Jie.

DOMAIN EMPEROR
Three years. Forty-seven challengers. All failed because they wanted the throne. You want something else.

TANG JIE
What I built wasn't meant to be a throne room.

They move. Inhumanly fast. Tang Jie's raw power meets the Emperor's fluid precision. Blows echo like thunder.

Tang Jie lands a hit. The Emperor smiles.

Then the Emperor strikes.

Three blows. Tang Jie's defense shatters. A final palm sends him through a concrete pillar.

Tang Jie struggles up, coughing blood.

TANG JIE
(ragged)
You... you're not—

DOMAIN EMPEROR
(steps on his chest, firm)
I'm what this place needed.

He looks at Qin Shiyue, still on one knee.

DOMAIN EMPEROR
General. Tell your masters the Butcher is contained. His surrender?

He meets Tang Jie's eyes.

DOMAIN EMPEROR
We'll discuss terms.

FADE OUT.

title: Senior Sister Dotes on Me
description: A young boy survives a family massacre and is taken in by martial arts masters who promise to teach him and help him grow strong.
context:
Title: Senior Sister Dotes on Me
Description: A young boy survives a family massacre and is taken in by martial arts masters who promise to teach him and help him grow strong.

EXT. ZHOU FAMILY GATE - NIGHT

Several masked men in black, armed with weapons, breach the compound gate with brutal efficiency.

INT. ZHOU FAMILY LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

MOTHER clutches young ZHOU HAO, her back pressed against a lacquered cabinet. A jade talisman hangs at her throat.

MOTHER
Master!

FATHER rushes downstairs, his dao singing from its scabbard. He positions himself between his family and the intruders.

FATHER
Take the child and go!

MOTHER scoops up ZHOU HAO and sprints outside.

EXT. ZHOU FAMILY COURTYARD - CONTINUOUS

FATHER's blade becomes a whirling barrier as MOTHER races toward the servant's gate.

FATHER
Go! Don't worry about me!

MOTHER reaches the gate—locked. She frantically shakes the iron bars, then spots a loose one. With desperate strength, she pries it open and pushes ZHOU HAO through, pressing the jade talisman into his palm.

MOTHER
Run forward. Don't look back.

ZHOU HAO
(crying)
Mama...

MOTHER
Go!

ZHOU HAO runs forward, crying, as the iron bars clang shut.

MOTHER turns, her eyes resolute, and sprints back toward the fight.

FATHER is outnumbered and knocked to the ground.

MOTHER rushes forward, standing back-to-back with FATHER, fighting the remaining masked men together.

The two fight desperately, but there are too many enemies.

FATHER is struck down and falls.

MOTHER is cornered by a masked man. She fights back fiercely, taking down several enemies.

Suddenly, several silver needles strike MOTHER's back. She painfully falls to her knees, then collapses.

ZHOU HAO runs alone through the dark streets, crying as he runs. The jade talisman swings from his neck.
continuation:
EXT. PARK - DAY

OLD MAN, MAN IN SUIT, and MAN IN CHINESE TUNIC walk the morning paths.

MAN IN SUIT
Huh?

OLD MAN
Is that a child crying?

MAN IN CHINESE TUNIC
It really is. From the willows.

MAN IN SUIT
Over there.

The three follow the sound and find ZHOU HAO sitting alone on the grass, crying. The Zhou talisman hangs from his neck.

OLD MAN walks up and crouches down.

OLD MAN
Child, whose family are you from?

MAN IN SUIT
Why are you here alone?

OLD MAN
What's your name?

MAN IN SUIT
Who are your parents?

ZHOU HAO
(clutching the talisman)
Zhou Hao.

OLD MAN
Oh.

MAN IN SUIT
The Zhou family that was wiped out overnight...

MAN IN CHINESE TUNIC
The heir. We'd heard rumors.

The three exchange serious glances.

OLD MAN
(looking at ZHOU HAO)
Child, you may never see your family again. But you must be strong. Will you come with us? We can teach you martial arts and skills.

ZHOU HAO looks at the talisman, then at OLD MAN. He wipes his tears and nods.

MAN IN SUIT
Let's go, then.

MAN IN CHINESE TUNIC
Ha ha ha. The young miss will finally have a sparring partner.

The three men leave the park with ZHOU HAO.

title: The Medical Emperor Returns Invincible
description: A powerful medical master uses ancient techniques to cure the incurable and faces challenges from his past, including an arranged marriage.
context:
Title: The Medical Emperor Returns Invincible
Description: A powerful medical master uses ancient techniques to cure the incurable and faces challenges from his past, including an arranged marriage.

INT. ANCIENT ROOM - DAY

LING YUNLONG, a young man in a white traditional Chinese robe, sits cross-legged. Across from him, ELDER ZHU trembles, sweat beading on his forehead. Something WRITHES beneath the skin of his cheeks.

ELDER ZHU
(whispered)
It moves... when I sleep.

LING YUNLONG forms hand seals. Golden light collects at his fingertips like dew, then drifts into Elder Zhu's eyes—not as attack, but as question.

LING YUNLONG
(quietly)
Southern Border Gu sorcery. Third variation.

LING YUNLONG
The host lives seven days. The parasite lives forever. Which will you be?

EXT. FORBIDDEN LAND - NIGHT

Ling Yunlong's translucent figure appears in this shadow-realm echo of the room.

GU WOMAN (30s, sharp features, red robes like drying blood) appears with MASKED SUBORDINATES. They take defensive stance.

GU WOMAN
You don't belong here, Medical Emperor. This soul is claimed.

LING YUNLONG
And you don't belong in the living world. Your master still using orphans?

The Gu Woman attacks, hands flickering green venom-light. Ling Yunlong steps through attacks like avoiding raindrops. Deflections economical, almost gentle.

LING YUNLONG
(voice quiet)
I taught him this technique. Before he broke it.

His palm barely touches her chest. She flies back—from shock, not force.

GU WOMAN
(gasping)
You... you're the one—

INT. GHOST DOCTOR'S PAVILION - NIGHT

GHOST DOCTOR (50s, surgeon's hands, grave-robber eyes) coughs blood. Jewel-like Gu insect on table CRACKS, leaks black fluid. Portrait slips from his sleeve—child him beside younger Ling Yunlong.

GHOST DOCTOR
(choked whisper)
So... you remember...

He slides to floor, dead.
continuation:
EXT. FORBIDDEN LAND - NIGHT

Ling Yunlong holds energy needle over fallen Gu Woman. It trembles in his hand.

LING YUNLONG
Your master is dead. The Gu dies with him. But you—

He looks at her with pity.

LING YUNLONG
What will you die for?

Needle dissolves. He extends hand instead.

GU WOMAN
You're... sparing me?

LING YUNLONG
I don't kill students of medicine. Even broken ones.

INT. ANCIENT ROOM - DAY

Ling Yunlong gasps, eyes snap open. His hands shake slightly. Elder Zhu's face is clear, normal.

Elder Zhu bows deeply, the gesture of one emperor to another.

ELDER ZHU
The Medicine King said you were... different.

LING YUNLONG
(steadying his breathing)
Your payment is the Zhu family scrolls. Originals.

ELDER ZHU
We have billions, mansions—

LING YUNLONG
—I need a library, not a tomb.

He stands, revealing weariness beneath the power.

LING YUNLONG
Tell my disciple his homework is late.

EXT. HEAVENLY GATE - DAY

Ling Yunlong walks through an archway reading "Miraculous Healing Hands." Weathered, barely visible.

SENIOR DISCIPLE and JUNIOR DISCIPLE wait at attention.

SENIOR DISCIPLE
The council asks—will you take your seat?

LING YUNLONG
(sweeping dust from the stoop)
I left because they sat while people died.

JUNIOR DISCIPLE
The Gate opening? The century—

LING YUNLONG
—opens for those who need it, not those who can pay.

He hands broom to Junior Disciple.

LING YUNLONG
Sweep here. Learn more than in council.

EXT. COUNTRY ROAD - DAY

Convoy stops. YUAN LING, a young woman in a white lace qipao, exits surrounded by BLACK-SUITED BODYGUARDS.

EXT. HEAVENLY GATE ENTRANCE - DAY

Ling Yunlong washes hands in a basin. Yuan Ling's shadow falls across the water.

YUAN LING
(sizing him up)
You look like a janitor.

LING YUNLONG
I look like someone who cleans messes.

YUAN LING
Our families promised. Promises are chains.

She drops red box. It lands heavy, final.

YUAN LING
I forge my own chains now.

Ling Yunlong watches her turn to leave. Not surprised—resigned.

LING YUNLONG
Your brother's Gu poisoning. I removed it last month.

Yuan Ling freezes. Shoulders tense.

LING YUNLONG
The box is empty, Yuan Ling. It always was.

She doesn't turn back. Step falters, just slightly.

LING YUNLONG
(softly)
So are we.

He picks up box, weighs it in hand, sets aside. Water in basin still ripples from her shadow.

title: Betrayal and Rebirth
description: A woman who sacrificed everything for her boyfriend discovers his affair with a wealthy heiress on his birthday, leading to a heartbreaking confrontation.
context:
Title: Betrayal and Rebirth
Description: A woman who sacrificed everything for her boyfriend discovers his affair with a wealthy heiress on his birthday, leading to a heartbreaking confrontation.

INT. APARTMENT - DAY

SU YAO enters carrying a cake box, her face glowing with anticipation.

SU YAO (V.O.)
