He Qingjun's eyes flutter. Sees her face. Something registers.

HE AN'AN
The fire. You remember the fire.

FLASHBACK - INT. BURNING HOUSE - NIGHT (INSERT)

Young He An'an pounds on a window, flames behind her. Sees He Qingjun running past, carrying XU FENG's limp form. He doesn't stop. Doesn't look.

Young An'an's palm slaps the glass. Leaves a small, sooty print.

BACK TO PRESENT:

HE AN'AN
(touching his wet hair)
I had third-degree burns. She had a blister. You said, "Girls can't have scars."

A pill bottle floats past in a gutter stream.

HE AN'AN
(standing)
You gave them everything. They gave you a sidewalk. This is just math.

HE QINGJUN
(wheezing)
An'an...

HE AN'AN
Don't. The word doesn't belong to you.

He grabs her wrist. Surprisingly strong.

HE QINGJUN
I saw... red shoes...

His eyes focus past her, seeing something else.

HE QINGJUN
(whisper becoming a rasp)
Let me... try again...

His grip loosens. The rain intensifies.

He is still.

HE AN'AN stares at his hand on her wrist. Then at his face. Something breaks in her expression—just for a second.

INT. SHABBY ROOM - DAY

YOUNG HE QINGJUN (30s) gasps awake. Sunlight slashes through broken blinds onto his face. He looks at his hands—strong, unmarked.

On a nearby chair: a pair of bright red leather shoes, still in their box.

FADE OUT.

title: A Second Chance at Love
description: A wealthy CEO and his son visit a construction site incognito. The son meets a kind-hearted woman selling buns and decides she would be perfect for his widowed father.
context:
Title: A Second Chance at Love
Description: A wealthy CEO and his son visit a construction site incognito. The son meets a kind-hearted woman selling buns and decides she would be perfect for his widowed father.

INT. LUXURY CAR - DAY

A black Mercedes speeds down the road, performing a stylish drift and stopping abruptly at the entrance of a construction site.

EXT. CONSTRUCTION SITE ENTRANCE - DAY

ZHAO YI (Chairman of Zhao Group) and ZHAO YUNFAN (Zhao Yi's son) step out of the car. Yunfan pockets his phone.

A group of WORKERS wearing hard hats stand in formation, bowing in unison.

WORKERS
(in unison)
Hello, Chairman! Hello, Young Master!

An ASSISTANT approaches respectfully, handing them two sets of work uniforms and white hard hats.

ZHAO YI
Remember - we blend in today. See the real operation.

ZHAO YUNFAN
Dad, I've got the blueprints on my phone. Fully digital.

ZHAO YI
Your phone can't smell the mortar.

They change into the work uniforms and put on the hard hats.

EXT. CONSTRUCTION AREA - DAY

ZHAO YI and ZHAO YUNFAN walk the site. General Manager LIU FENG hurries over with a folder.

LIU FENG
Chairman, the Cultural Park bids.

ZHAO YI
Not now. Walk with us.

ZHAO YUNFAN
(intercepting the folder)
Dad's doing "undercover boss" today. The fifty million can wait.

ZHAO YUNFAN'S PHONE buzzes - dating app notifications. He silences it.

ZHAO YI
What smells so good?

YI walks toward the aroma. Yunfan follows.

EXT. BUN STAND - DAY

LI YUMEI kneads dough at her bun stand, a modified tricycle. Steam rises.

ZHAO YUNFAN
Two buns, please.

LI YUMEI
Four yuan. Cash only.

ZHAO YUNFAN pats his pockets - only his phone and Platinum cards.

ZHAO YUNFAN
(embarrassed)
I'm digital generation. Forgot cash.

LAO LUO, a nearby worker, steps up with cash.

LAO LUO
Two buns, Sister Mei.

LAO LUO spots Yunfan's hesitation.

LAO LUO
(mocking)
Forgot what money looks like?

ZHAO YUNFAN
Just forgot my wallet.

LAO LUO grabs ZHAO YUNFAN by the collar.

LAO LUO
Playing games while we work?

ZHAO YUNFAN
Let go!

LI YUMEI hurries over, separating them with flour-dusted hands.

LI YUMEI
Lao Luo, he's just hungry.
continuation:
(to Yunfan)
First day? My treat. Can't work on empty.

She bags three buns and adds a soy milk.

LI YUMEI
Bring your father by. That man needs real food.

ZHAO YUNFAN
You noticed him?

LI YUMEI
Hard to miss. He watches you like my husband watched our boy.

Yunfan studies her - her natural warmth, the dough-stained hands.

ZHAO YUNFAN
He hasn't eaten right since Mom died.

LI YUMEI
(softly)
Then make him eat. Good food helps grief.

She hands him the bag. Yunfan is deeply moved.

ZHAO YUNFAN
Auntie... are you single?

LI YUMEI
(stunned)
Huh?

ZHAO YUNFAN
Would you meet someone? He's... not good at this.

LI YUMEI
(laughing shyly)
A woman my age?

ZHAO YUNFAN
My dad's fifty too. And you look right for each other.

Li Yumei hesitates, then writes on a receipt.

LI YUMEI
Tell him: if he's serious, he finds me here. Every morning.

She hands him the flour-dusted note.

ZHAO YUNFAN
(taking it, happily)
Future Mom. I've got to work.

ZHAO YUNFAN walks away cheerfully.

LI YUMEI
(shy and helpless)
Oh, this kid...

A BLACK AUDI screeches to a halt nearby, throwing dust. YU FUSHENG chases QIAN LILI as she throws luggage.

QIAN LILI
Get your mother OUT or I'm GONE!

She hurls a designer suitcase. It crashes into Li Yumei's tricycle, toppling the steamer. Hot water spills. Li Yumei falls.

LI YUMEI
(screaming in pain)
Ah!

Yunfan drops the bag and sprints back. Zhao Yi appears, face pale.

ZHAO YI
Medical! Now!

He rips off his work shirt to staunch burns, revealing a tailored undershirt. His eyes lock with Li Yumei's.

LI YUMEI
(whispering)
Your son... good boy.

She passes out. Yunfan clutches the note, knuckles white.

ZHAO YUNFAN
Dad...

ZHAO YI
(into phone)
Dr. Chen. Construction site. Burns. Five minutes.

His other hand stays on Li Yumei's shoulder - protective, certain.

The scene freezes: Yunfan's desperation, Yi's focused calm, Li Yumei unconscious, the Zhao Group hard hat rolling in the dust.

title: Fifty-Year-Old Sister, Beautiful and Sassy (Episode 35)
description: A paralyzed woman suffers abuse from her caretaker while her husband carries on an affair, until her daughter discovers the truth.
context:
Title: Fifty-Year-Old Sister, Beautiful and Sassy (Episode 35)
Description: A paralyzed woman suffers abuse from her caretaker while her husband carries on an affair, until her daughter discovers the truth.

INT. ZHOU FAMILY KITCHEN - DAY

LANZI scrubs dishes with violent efficiency. Her knuckles are raw. She glances at a family photo on the windowsill—ZHOU JUAN stands vibrant between husband and daughter. The photo is turned facedown.

LANZI fills a bowl with congee, the steam fogging her expression.

INT. BEDROOM - DAY

ZHOU JUAN lies paralyzed, her fingers twitching involuntarily. Sunlight through half-drawn blinds casts prison bars across the bedsheets.

LANZI enters, the bowl cooling in her hands.

LANZI
Time for your medicine.

LANZI scoops the congee with deliberate sloppiness. Rice drips onto ZHOU JUAN's chin. ZHOU JUAN's throat convulses—she turns her head, the congee spilling.

LANZI
(with cold precision)
They say the sixth year is the hardest. Families break. Hearts give out.

LANZI presses the spoon against ZHOU JUAN's closed lips.

LANZI
(whispering)
You're the one who hired me. Remember that.

A key turns in the front door lock—soft, but LANZI freezes. She hears FOOTSTEPS. LANZI drops the spoon.

LANZI
(loudly, suddenly)
Sister Juan, please don't refuse food again!

ZHOU FUGUI (O.S.)
What's happening?

ZHOU FUGUI appears. His tie is loosened. He smells of whiskey lunches.

LANZI
(eyes downcast)
She won't eat. Says the texture reminds her of what she's lost.

ZHOU FUGUI moves to the bed, avoids his wife's eyes.

ZHOU FUGUI
(to ZHOU JUAN)
You're testing everyone's patience. ZHAODI graduates next month. She'll finally see you for the burden you are.

ZHOU FUGUI straightens, his gaze finding LANZI's in the mirror above the dresser. A silent communication.

ZHOU FUGUI
Be more useful.

ZHOU FUGUI exits. LANZI watches him go, a flicker of something—longing? calculation?—crossing her face.
continuation:
INT. HALLWAY - DAY

LANZI catches ZHOU FUGUI near the study. LANZI's hand on his arm is light, practiced.

LANZI
She didn't mean it. The pain makes her cruel.

ZHOU FUGUI
(turning, voice softening)
You always defend her. That's your kindness—and your fault.

ZHOU FUGUI touches her cheek. From the bedroom doorway, ZHOU JUAN's eyes—wide, reflecting the hallway light—watch. ZHOU JUAN has managed to roll onto her side, her paralyzed fingers digging into the mattress.

INT. LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

The front door opens. ZHOU ZHAODI stops mid-step.

Her father's hand on LANZI's face. LANZI's other hand on his chest.

ZHOU ZHAODI
(low, dangerous)
Dad. The caregiver you hired has a record. I checked.

A thud from the bedroom. ZHOU JUAN has pulled herself to the floor, her mouth open in a silent scream, one trembling finger pointing.

ZHOU FUGUI
(pulling away)
ZHAODI—it's not—

ZHOU ZHAODI
(not looking at her father, only at her mother on the floor)
Mama, I came home early because the doctor called. He said your paralysis tests came back negative.

ZHOU ZHAODI takes out her phone, presses play—a recording: LANZI's voice, clear and calculating. "Six months, and the house will be ours."

ZHOU ZHAODI
(to LANZI)
You miscalculated. And you—
(to ZHOU FUGUI)
—underestimated her.

ZHOU JUAN's pointing finger drops. ZHOU JUAN's lips form one word:

ZHOU JUAN
(whisper)
Wait.

title: Invincible From the Womb
description: A celestial being chooses to fall to the mortal realm rather than marry a persistent princess, only to be reborn and face new challenges.
context:
Title: Invincible From the Womb
Description: A celestial being chooses to fall to the mortal realm rather than marry a persistent princess, only to be reborn and face new challenges.

EXT. HEAVENLY REALM - ABOVE THE SEA OF CLOUDS - DAY

YE CHEN rides a burning fire dragon, flying through the immortal mist-wreathed sea of clouds. In the distance stand magnificent celestial palace buildings.

YE CHEN kneels on his dragon, black energy tearing through his body as his cultivation core destabilizes. Blood trickles from his lips.

YE CHEN (V.O.)
Invincible from the womb—yet this final step to Immortal Emperor has blocked me for a thousand years. What is "hardship"?

A woman in gorgeous red robes, DI AOSHUANG, appears in a ripple of light, a red marriage contract glowing in her hand.

DI AOSHUANG looks at the struggling YE CHEN.

DI AOSHUANG
Give it up. You were born a prodigy, never tested. Your Dao heart is incomplete. You'll never break through this way.

YE CHEN opens his eyes, his gaze cold.

YE CHEN
Then teach me, Princess. Or leave me to fail.

YE CHEN stands, noticing her robes with dawning realization.

YE CHEN
Red Phoenix bridal silk. Who's the fortunate groom?

DI AOSHUANG
You're the only one who recognizes it. The only one worthy of it.

YE CHEN
Spare me. Over these thousand years, you've asked me one hundred fifty-three thousand five hundred eighty-two times to dual cultivate. Persistence is not fate.

DI AOSHUANG laughs and unfurls the marriage contract. Golden characters blaze.

DI AOSHUANG
Father's seal says otherwise. Either you marry me now, or you fall to the mortal realm with your power sealed.

YE CHEN's smile vanishes. He stares at the contract's binding clauses.

YE CHEN
You would chain what you cannot understand?

DI AOSHUANG
I would bind what is mine.

She reaches for his hand to place on the contract.

DI AOSHUANG (CONT'D)
Sign it. Choose the easier path.

YE CHEN pushes her hand away. His voice is quiet but absolute.

YE CHEN
I choose the path I was never given.

YE CHEN shatters his own core. Golden light explodes as he falls toward the mortal realm. DI AOSHUANG holds the burning contract, her voice echoing.

DI AOSHUANG
Fall then! Powerless from the start, just like everyone else. I'll be waiting when you remember who you were!
continuation:
INT. MORTAL REALM - TUNNEL - DAY

YE CHEN's reincarnation, TIAN CHENG, and a girl named YAO YAO run through a narrow tunnel, panic on their faces. TIAN CHENG's eyes flicker with faint golden light as he stumbles.

YAO YAO
Tian Cheng! Your eyes—

Several men in black suits catch up to them. The lead man notices the light with unease.

SUITED MAN
Boss wants his money. The glowing trick won't save you.

YAO YAO helps TIAN CHENG up and shields him.

YAO YAO
Run! They need me alive—

TIAN CHENG breaks free and stands before her. Above, a dragon's roar echoes faintly. The suited man's subordinates flinch back.

TIAN CHENG
I won't let them use you.

A red energy ball—Di Aoshuang's seal—crashes through the ceiling and strikes YAO YAO's abdomen.

SUBORDINATE
Out of the way!

YAO YAO is hit. She clutches her stomach, a crimson mark burning into her skin.

FADE OUT.

title: The Road of Time Never Returns
description: At a rural wedding, a groom promises his bride a better future in the city, but harbors dark secrets about their relationship and children.
context:
Title: The Road of Time Never Returns
Description: At a rural wedding, a groom promises his bride a better future in the city, but harbors dark secrets about their relationship and children.

INT. WEDDING VENUE - DAY

A lively rural wedding courtyard, decorated with red lanterns and colorful ribbons everywhere. Guests sit around round tables.

MIDDLE-AGED WOMAN
The groom is here! Light the firecrackers, bring out the good food and wine!

XIAO PANG
(shouting)
Coming!

Firecrackers explode, smoke fills the air. Groom XU YIXIANG and bride LIN WANQING walk down the red carpet with their twin children (XU YIYANG and XU YIRU). The children carry baskets, scattering flower petals. Guests applaud warmly.

XU YIXIANG
(standing at the entrance, addressing the guests)
Thank you all for coming. We've prepared modest food and drink—please enjoy.

Guests begin to eat.

GOSSIP WOMAN 1
(whispering to GOSSIP WOMAN 2 at the same table)
Interesting timing, isn't it? Twins already walking and talking before the wedding.

GOSSIP WOMAN 2
Some girls know how to secure their future. Though I heard she wasn't exactly... born into good circumstances.

XU YIXIANG overhears, his face darkens.

XU YIXIANG
If anyone has something to say—

LIN WANQING
(gently touching his arm)
Yixiang. Please. Let them talk. Today is enough.

XU YIXIANG turns to her, his expression softening.

XU YIXIANG
You gave up everything for this family. I won't let them diminish what you've built. Once I finish school, we'll leave this place. A real home, in the city. A proper life.

LIN WANQING
(smiling, though her eyes hold something else)
I know you will.

FENG MEI approaches, holding a wrapped gift. Her floral shirt stands out among the countryside attire.

FENG MEI
City jobs and registrations don't just fall into your lap. Wanqing, you've made quite a sacrifice.

LIN WANQING
Feng Mei. You kept your promise to come.

FENG MEI
Why wouldn't I? We have history.

FENG MEI extends her hand to XU YIXIANG. Their handshake lasts a moment too long.

FENG MEI
Congratulations, Yixiang. You've achieved exactly what you planned.

XU YIXIANG
(swallows)
Thank you.

A jade pendant hangs from LIN WANQING's waist. Daughter XU YIRU points at it curiously.

XU YIRU
Mommy, what's that?

XU YIYANG
Let me see!

XU YIRU
It has tigers!

LIN WANQING kneels, removing the pendant which splits in two. She gives each child a half.

LIN WANQING
These are yours. Never take them off. They tell you who you are.

CHILDREN
Okay!

FENG MEI picks up a radio from the gift table.

FENG MEI
I'll put this in the bridal chamber. For later.

She exits toward the house. XU YIXIANG watches her go.
continuation:
INT. BRIDAL CHAMBER - DAY

XU YIXIANG sits on the wedding bed, head in hands. FENG MEI enters, already changed into LIN WANQING's qipao.

FENG MEI
The children are eating with their grandmother. We have time.

XU YIXIANG
(looking up, startled)
You shouldn't be wearing that.

FENG MEI
(teasing, but with an edge)
Why not? You bought it. For me.

XU YIXIANG stands, pacing.

XU YIXIANG
The plan is working. She's committed now. Mother talks to her, not to strangers. The kids are attached. But the money from the girl—that feels...

FENG MEI
Don't become sentimental. You chose this. You made her fall for you, got her pregnant, convinced her to stay. All so you could keep the son and fund our future.

XU YIXIANG
She thinks she's protecting me. The gossip, the sacrifice—she believes in it. That's the worst part.

FENG MEI
You did what you had to. Women like her don't belong in the city anyway.

A small cough from the doorway. XU YIYANG stands there, holding a cup of tea.

XU YIYANG
Dad. Mom says you should drink this. For the toast.

XU YIXIANG takes the cup, his hand trembling. Behind the boy, XU YIRU peeks in, her eyes going from the qipao to Feng Mei's face.

XU YIRU
(quietly)
You look like Mommy. But you're not.

The tea cup slips from XU YIXIANG's hand. It shatters on the floor.

FADE OUT.

title: Global Apocalypse Announcement & Rotating Disasters: Heatwave to Cold Wave to Extinction
description: After losing everything in a global apocalypse, a man is reborn 15 days before the end to save his sister and humanity from rotating monthly disasters.
context:
Title: Global Apocalypse Announcement & Rotating Disasters: Heatwave to Cold Wave to Extinction
Description: After losing everything in a global apocalypse, a man is reborn 15 days before the end to save his sister and humanity from rotating monthly disasters.

EXT. RUINED CITY - DAY

The city has become ruins, broken walls and debris, smoke and dust everywhere. Several scrapped cars are scattered on the muddy streets.

NARRATOR (V.O.)
At first, nobody understood the pattern. A heat dome in Siberia. A flash freeze in Panama. They called them isolated events. Until the grid failed everywhere.

EXT. SPACE/EARTH - DAY

Earth rotates in space, surrounded by purple nebulae. The scene cuts to dry, cracked earth, the sun scorching everything.

NARRATOR (V.O.)
The magnetosphere fractured. The planet began pulsing. Each month, a new extinction protocol.

EXT. ABOVE THE RUINS - DAY

On a desolate field of rubble, many corpses lie scattered. CHEN ASHENG holds his dying sister CHEN NAN, both covered in blood.

NARRATOR (V.O.)
January: The Burning. Over a billion dead. Governments collapsed by the third week.

CHEN NAN
(whispering, urgent)
The bunker coordinates... in my journal. Don't wait for me.

CHEN NAN presses a blood-stained notebook into his hand. Her breathing stutters.

CHEN ASHENG
(quiet, desperate)
Stay with me. The portals could reopen. Just hold on—

CHEN NAN
No more waiting. Promise me... you'll stop counting the dead.

CHEN NAN's hand goes limp. CHEN ASHENG bows his head, silent.

A figure approaches through the dust—LIU FANG, once polished, now hardened.

LIU FANG
(quiet, cold)
She's gone. We need to move. The Collective is heading west.

CHEN ASHENG
(not looking up)
You led them here. For what? A few cans of preserved meat?

LIU FANG
For a chance. Something you never understood.
continuation:
INT. BUILDING HALL - NIGHT

NARRATOR (V.O.)
February: The Deep Freeze. Survivors huddled in shelters... until the fuel ran out.

A MAN carrying a box of supplies is being pursued. His GIRLFRIEND lags behind, panic in her eyes.

GIRLFRIEND
(frantic)
Drop it! They'll kill you!

The MAN stumbles, refuses to let go. He's cornered, beaten.

GIRLFRIEND
(screaming)
Give them what they want!

The MAN is killed. The GIRLFRIEND, trembling, retrieves the box and approaches the attackers.

GIRLFRIEND
(hollow)
Can I... come with you? I know where there's more.

INT. SUBWAY CAR - NIGHT

NARRATOR (V.O.)
March: The Reanimate. The dead didn't stay dead. And the living turned faster.

The car is a mess, corpses everywhere. CHEN ASHENG, covered in blood, sits slumped on the ground. LIU FANG stands beside a man in tactical gear, KOVACS, who holds a chainsaw.

KOVACS
(grim efficiency)
You made the right call. We couldn't carry three.

LIU FANG
(to Chen)
There was only room for two in the tunnel. It was mathematical.

CHEN ASHENG
(bitter)
Mathematical. You slit JIN's throat while he slept. That's your math?

LIU FANG
JIN was wounded. He'd have slowed us down. You taught me that—survival calculus.

KOVACS
(raising the chainsaw)
Don't take it personal. The world's just optimizing.

CHEN ASHENG
(quiet, resigned)
See you in the next cycle.

EXT. TEACHING BUILDING PLAZA - DAY

CHEN ASHENG jolts awake, finding himself standing in a plaza, everything normal around him. He looks at his hands, completely intact.

CHEN ASHENG (V.O.)
Fifteen days. That's the buffer. The magnetosphere anomaly started on August 3rd. Today is July 19th.

CHEN ASHENG (V.O.)
This time, the math is different. This time, we don't leave anyone behind.

EXT. NATIONAL CRISIS COMMAND CENTER ENTRANCE - DAY

CHEN ASHENG runs toward a fortified building. SECURITY PERSONNEL block him.

CHEN ASHENG
I need to see Director Harding! Now!

QIN MUYAN, mid-30s, observant, steps out.

QIN MUYAN
Stand down. This is a restricted facility.

CHEN ASHENG
The August 3rd anomaly—it's going to cascade. Monthly disasters. I've seen the pattern.

QIN MUYAN
(senses his conviction)
Everybody's seen the solar flare reports. What makes your theory different?

CHEN ASHENG
Because I've already buried my sister three times. And I'm done counting.

QIN MUYAN studies him—a man who knows too many specifics.

QIN MUYAN
Wait here. Don't move.

She gestures to security, then disappears inside.

title: Dump the Ungrateful Woman
description: After eight years together, a man's marriage proposal is interrupted when his girlfriend abandons him to comfort her male best friend.
context:
Title: Dump the Ungrateful Woman
Description: After eight years together, a man's marriage proposal is interrupted when his girlfriend abandons him to comfort her male best friend.

INT. RESTAURANT - NIGHT

A group of FRIENDS sit around a large round table eating dinner, the atmosphere lively.

FRIEND
Ye Tian, eight years with Yiqing deserves more than a "we'll see."

QIN YIQING
(smiling)
We're still editing the story.

ZHANG HANZHI
(picking up a shrimp and placing it in Yiqing's bowl)
Sister Qing, your favorite.

QIN YIQING
(happily)
My hero. Some things never change.

YE TIAN's face darkens as he silently drinks his wine.

FRIEND
You two have your own rhythm, huh?

YE TIAN slams down his wine glass heavily, making a loud noise. Everyone turns to look.

ZHANG HANZHI
(clapping)
Good!

YE TIAN
(sarcastically)
Why don't you two just share a bowl while you're at it?

QIN YIQING
(shocked and angry)
Ye Tian, what are you saying?

YE TIAN
I'm saying eight years of watching this circus is enough. I wish you both the happiness you clearly deserve.

QIN YIQING
Ye Tian, you've had too much to drink.

ZHANG HANZHI
(seriously)
You'd better apologize to Sister Qing right now! Sister Qing and I are just friends.

YE TIAN
(sneering)
Male bestie, right? The kind who rates above a marriage proposal when he cries wolf?

FLASHBACK:
continuation:
INT. APARTMENT - NIGHT

ONE DAY EARLIER

The room is decorated with balloons and rose petals. YE TIAN kneels on one knee, holding a diamond ring, proposing to YIQING.

YE TIAN
Qingqing, will you marry me? Let me stop waiting.

YIQING's phone rings. The caller ID shows "Ahan." She answers the call.

ZHANG HANZHI (V.O.)
Sister Qing, I just broke up. Can you come keep me company?

QIN YIQING
(without hesitation)
I'm on my way.

YIQING turns to leave. YE TIAN quickly stands up and grabs her.

YE TIAN
Qingqing, the ring is still in my hand.

QIN YIQING
(impatiently)
Ahan needs me. Marriage can wait.

YE TIAN
His breakup is more important than our future?

QIN YIQING
(angrily)
Ye Tian, Ahan is family. If you can't respect that, we're done.

YE TIAN hugs her from behind.

YE TIAN
Eight years of "we'll talk later." How much longer?

ZHANG HANZHI's voice comes through the phone.

ZHANG HANZHI (V.O.)
Sister Qing, if it's not convenient, I can be alone tonight. It's fine.

QIN YIQING
(struggling)
Let go of me! He needs me right now!

YE TIAN
(painfully)
He needs you, but I don't? Does he need to marry you?

YIQING breaks free forcefully and slaps YE TIAN across the face.

QIN YIQING
(furiously)
I warned you not to test this.

She picks up her phone.

QIN YIQING
(into the phone, voice softening)
Ahan, I'm leaving now. Ye Tian understands.

YIQING kicks off her high heels and leaves without looking back. YE TIAN stands alone, looking at the scattered rose petals and the open ring box on the floor, his eyes filled with despair.

END FLASHBACK.

title: Goodbye, My Childhood Sweethearts
description: A successful designer is forced into an arranged marriage while dealing with her childhood friends who favor her rival.
context:
Title: Goodbye, My Childhood Sweethearts
Description: A successful designer is forced into an arranged marriage while dealing with her childhood friends who favor her rival.

EXT. CITY/NEWS REPORT - DAY

News footage rapidly switches: the Pangu Model AI interface, stock charts soaring, then a press conference.

NEWS ANCHOR (V.O.)
Gu Corporation's Pangu Model IPO has skyrocketed CEO Gu Cilan to the Forbes Celebrity List—net worth in the hundreds of billions, and according to a recent poll, the man most netizens want to marry.

EXT. ARCHERY RANGE - DAY

GU CILAN (30s, precise, controlled) draws a compound bow, his focus absolute. His ASSISTANT hovers nearby with a tablet.

ASSISTANT
Sir, the old master insists. This year, you marry the Song heir, no exceptions.

GU CILAN
I don't do arranged marriages.

He releases. Arrow splits the previous bullseye.

ASSISTANT
Shall I inform the Song family their daughter isn't convenient?

GU CILAN
(tensing slightly)
Which daughter?

ASSISTANT
The youngest—Song Shiwei. Currently based in Haicheng.

GU CILAN lowers his bow, considering. A beat.

GU CILAN
(quietly)
The one who turned down our Beijing partnership last year.

ASSISTANT
That's her.

GU CILAN
She's practical. Won't complicate things.
(beat)
Tell them I agree. But I'm handling this personally. Book Haicheng.

ASSISTANT
Yes, sir.
continuation:
EXT. CITY SKYLINE - DAY

Gu Corporation's red helicopter arcs across the skyline.

INT. APARTMENT - DAY

SONG SHIWEI (20s, sharp-eyed, tired) paces in a pink linen dress, phone to her ear.

SONG SHIWEI
Mom, I need time to—

SONG'S MOTHER (O.S.)
Your grandfather's heart medication isn't a negotiation, Weiwei. The engagement honors his generation.

SONG SHIWEI
(rubbing her temple)
Fine. But this conversation isn't over.

She hangs up. XIANG HAN (early 20s, polished, too-smiling) appears in the doorway holding a crystal trophy.

XIANG HAN
Shiwei? The director sent me with your award.

SONG SHIWEI
Just set it down.

XIANG HAN
Actually... I was hoping you'd let me announce this as a co-win. For my portfolio. You know how competitive senior designer promotions are.

SONG SHIWEI
You contributed one color suggestion.

XIANG HAN
(softly)
But everyone knows I need this more than you do.

She extends the trophy. Song reaches. Xiang Han "slips"—the trophy crashes. Glass shatters across tile.

A shard slices Song Shiwei's calf. Blood seeps through her dress.

GUO ZEYU and YUN SHEN (mid-20s, athletic, visibly closer to Xiang Han) burst in.

GUO ZEYU
Han!

They instinctively shield Xiang Han, checking her hands for cuts.

YUN SHEN
What happened?

XIANG HAN
(tearfully)
I just wanted to celebrate her win, but...

GUO ZEYU
(seeing Song's bleeding leg)
Weiwei, was this necessary? It's her birthday.

YUN SHEN
She came bearing gifts. You couldn't even pretend to be gracious?

Song Shiwei meets their eyes—first wounded, then something harder. She tears a strip from her dress, binds her leg herself.

SONG SHIWEI
(icy calm)
Get out. All of you.

XIANG HAN
Sister, I—

SONG SHIWEI
Now.

The three exchange glances—Xiang Han's subtly victorious, the boys' confused. They retreat. Song Shiwei stands alone, bleeding, and very still.

title: Winter Court Snow
description: A general's daughter waits in the snow on her beloved's wedding night, confronting him about their broken engagement and his betrayal.
context:
Title: Winter Court Snow
Description: A general's daughter waits in the snow on her beloved's wedding night, confronting him about their broken engagement and his betrayal.

EXT. PEI MANOR COURTYARD - NIGHT

The night is deep, heavy snow falls. The Pei Manor is decorated with lanterns and red silk. A plaque reads "General Pei's Manor."

In the silhouette of a window, a man and woman embrace intimately.

WOMAN (V.O.)
You've finally returned.

SHENG CANGLANG stands alone in the snow, wearing an elaborate red wedding dress and phoenix crown, gazing at that window. Her expression is both sorrowful and resolute.

ON-SCREEN TEXT: Sheng Canglang, legitimate daughter of the Duke Protector's Manor

BYSTANDER 1 (V.O.)
They say the Duke Protector's daughter has been standing there for hours. The General hasn't sent a single person out.

BYSTANDER 2 (V.O.)
Who could blame her? The man she nursed back from death—now he returns and marries another. I'd want answers too.

The maid QIU MIAN runs to SHENG CANGLANG's side, holding an oiled paper umbrella.

ON-SCREEN TEXT: Qiu Mian, Sheng Canglang's maid

QIU MIAN
Miss, your father has called for you three times already. If the Duke discovers you're here—

SHENG CANGLANG
(eyes resolute, voice barely above a whisper)
Then let him disown me. I just need to hear it from his own lips. That our engagement—that I—meant nothing.

The manor gate opens. PEI ZHAO walks out, wearing black ceremonial armor and a heavy cloak, his expression cold and distant.

ON-SCREEN TEXT: Pei Zhao, General Protector of the Nation

PEI ZHAO
On this day of Pei's wedding, before I could even change out of my wedding attire, I heard Miss Sheng was waiting here. Forgive my poor reception.

SHENG CANGLANG
(tearfully questioning)
Pei Zhao, I'll only ask you once: do you truly wish to break our engagement?

PEI ZHAO
I have already obtained an imperial edict to annul our engagement. Do you wish to defy the emperor's decree and have your entire family executed? 
(beat, voice dropping lower)
What we had... it was a child's promise. I grew up. You should too.

SHENG CANGLANG looks at him in shock. PEI ZHAO turns to leave, his cloak brushing her shoulder. SHENG CANGLANG staggers and falls to her knees in the snow.

She clutches a pure white jade hairpin tightly in her hand.

SHENG CANGLANG
(murmuring)
Then what does this mean?

FLASHBACK

ON-SCREEN TEXT: Ten years ago
continuation:
EXT. SNOWY STONE STEPS - DAY

Young and destitute PEI ZHAO, in tattered clothes, lies frozen on the stone steps of the Sheng family temple.

The young lady SHENG CANGLANG, wearing a white fur coat and holding an umbrella, appears before him. She is no older than twelve.

INT. ROOM - NIGHT

PEI ZHAO devours a bowl of rice ravenously.

PEI ZHAO
(mouth full)
This is the first thing I've eaten in three days. Thank you, Miss.

SHENG CANGLANG
The northern border campaign took your family?

PEI ZHAO
(stops eating, looks down)
Everyone. I have nothing left.

SHENG CANGLANG
(quietly)
Then stay. Learn to read, learn the sword. If you earn your place, you'll never go hungry again.

PEI ZHAO sets down his bowl and kneels solemnly. He takes out a jade hairpin from his chest—the only intact thing he owns.

PEI ZHAO
My father said this hairpin belonged to my mother. It's all I have of them. 
(he offers it to her)
I want you to have it. So I never forget.

END FLASHBACK

EXT. PEI MANOR COURTYARD - NIGHT

Back in the present, SHENG CANGLANG kneels in the snow, holding up that jade hairpin, tears streaming down her face.

SHENG CANGLANG
(voice trembling)
What does this jade hairpin mean? What do your promises mean? What do I, Sheng Canglang, mean to you?

PEI ZHAO
(coldly, but his jaw tightens)
It means you were a fool to believe them. And I was a fool to make them. We're both wiser now.

PEI ZHAO
My wife has traveled far and should not be disturbed. Leave us in peace.

At the doorway, another bride in red, SONG YANYAN, appears supported by a maid.

ON-SCREEN TEXT: Song Yanyan, Pei Zhao's newlywed wife

SONG YANYAN
(gently, but with steel beneath)
The General and I are grateful for your attendance, Miss Sheng. But the night grows cold, and some dreams belong only to winter. You should go home.

The words land like blows. SHENG CANGLANG's hand moves to the ceremonial sword at PEI ZHAO's belt—a wedding gift, ornate and sheathed. She draws it in one swift motion. PEI ZHAO does not flinch.

SHENG CANGLANG
(laughing through tears, voice breaking)
You said your life belonged to me. So now return it!

SHENG CANGLANG thrusts the sword forward. It pierces his side—not a killing blow, but deep enough. Blood spatters onto the snow, stark red against white.

SHENG CANGLANG grips the sword, her face showing a complex expression of shock, pain, and a dawning horror at what she's done.

PEI ZHAO's expression finally cracks—revealing not anger, but something like relief, or perhaps grief.

title: The Abandoned Concubine's Promotion Chronicle
description: A modern screenwriter is transported into her best friend's script as a disgraced concubine in the Cold Palace, forced to navigate palace intrigue to survive and return home.
context:
Title: The Abandoned Concubine's Promotion Chronicle
Description: A modern screenwriter is transported into her best friend's script as a disgraced concubine in the Cold Palace, forced to navigate palace intrigue to survive and return home.

INT. COLD PALACE - NIGHT

Thunder rumbles, lightning flashes.

LU YUNXI, dressed in white robes, hangs from a ceiling beam by a white silk rope, her hands clutching the silk as she struggles in pain.

LU YUNXI (V.O.)
What the hell is going on? Wasn't I just reading a script at home? How did I end up in this godforsaken place hanging myself? I can't take it anymore! Somebody get me a rewrite!

The maid LÜ YA rushes into the room. Seeing LU YUNXI hanging, she is so frightened she falls to her knees.

LÜ YA
(crying out)
Miss! Miss! Your family still needs you! Please!

LU YUNXI (V.O.)
I'm not dead yet. I can still be saved.

LÜ YA gets up and struggles to bring LU YUNXI down.

LÜ YA
Easy, Miss.

LU YUNXI is lowered down. She kneels on the ground, coughing violently.

INT. COLD PALACE - DAY

LU YUNXI has changed into light blue robes and sits on the edge of the bed. LÜ YA kneels before her.

LU YUNXI
You're saying I'm Concubine Xi, and I was sent to the Cold Palace for trying to seduce the Emperor?

LÜ YA
Yes, Miss.

LU YUNXI
(puzzled)
Why does this plot sound so familiar?

INT. MODERN APARTMENT - DAY

FLASHBACK:

LU YUNXI sits at a desk, looking at a script on her laptop.

LU YUNXI
(to herself)
Concubine Xi is sent to the Cold Palace for trying to seduce the Emperor.

Her best friend NING RUOCHU, wearing a red top and glasses, walks in dramatically.

NING RUOCHU
Xixi, this is my birthday present to you—a blockbuster script! Aren't you touched? As long as you play the female lead, I guarantee you'll be on fire! Then you can treat me to the good life!

NING RUOCHU gestures excitedly.

LU YUNXI
(annoyed)
Ning Ruochu! Do you even know how to write a script?

NING RUOCHU
Hey, don't mention it. After all, we're basically soulmates with different DNA.

LU YUNXI
(pushing her away)
Get lost! Look at what you've written! The female lead transmigrates into a book, gets sent to the Cold Palace, and has to win over the dog Emperor to become Empress before she can return to the modern world. Your brain must have been caught in a door!

NING RUOCHU
(leaning in)
Wait, the exciting part comes later. Soon, Noble Consort Ning will burst in and slap you!

LU YUNXI picks up a water kettle and accidentally spills water on the laptop. The computer immediately sparks with electricity.

LU YUNXI
Ning Ruochu, how dare you write me this kind of script!

NING RUOCHU
It's pretty good!

LU YUNXI is struck by the electric current, her body convulsing.

NING RUOCHU
(panicking)
Xixi, what's wrong? Xixi, what's happening?

A bright light flashes and LU YUNXI disappears.

END FLASHBACK.
continuation:
INT. COLD PALACE - DAY

LU YUNXI snaps back to reality, her face full of shock.

LÜ YA
Miss? Miss? Are you... somewhere else again? Well, the Cold Palace is just a worse place to live. At least you've never even seen the Emperor's face.

LU YUNXI
(suddenly realizing)
I remember now! Isn't this the script my idiot best friend wrote? I've transmigrated into the script? Wait, doesn't that mean in a moment, Noble Consort Ning will come in and—smack—slap me?

EUNUCH (O.S.)
Noble Consort Ning has arrived!

NOBLE CONSORT NING YUYAN enters with her maid YINGXIA and a group of attendants.

NING YUYAN
(contemptuously)
Little darling. Slut. Still clinging to fantasies, I see.

NING YUYAN walks up to LU YUNXI and raises her hand to slap her.

LU YUNXI
(head snaps to the side)
Wait, that's assault!

NING YUYAN
Little darling. Slut. Who gave you the nerve to seduce the Emperor?

LU YUNXI (V.O.)
It's real. All of it. Every trope.

LU YUNXI
(collapsing, shouting to the heavens)
Oh my God! Are you really going this far?

YINGXIA
(sternly)
Insolent! Kneel before our Noble Consort!

NING YUYAN
No manners.

NING YUYAN raises her hand to strike again, but LU YUNXI catches her wrist, twisting it with a pressure-point hold.

NING YUYAN
(shocked, pained)
How dare you, Concubine Xi! Release this consort at once!

YINGXIA
(supporting NING YUYAN)
My Lady! My Lady, are you alright?

NING YUYAN
(furious)
A discarded concubine attacks me? Guards! Break every bone in her body!

LU YUNXI's eyes widen in terror.

ON SCREEN: TO BE CONTINUED

title: The Hidden Truth
description: A young woman discovers evidence that suggests her mother might be a human trafficker and that she could be the lost daughter of a wealthy tycoon.
context:
Title: The Hidden Truth
Description: A young woman discovers evidence that suggests her mother might be a human trafficker and that she could be the lost daughter of a wealthy tycoon.

INT. LIVING ROOM - DAY

ZHOU YIYI sits at the table, her laptop displaying a missing person database. She touches the circular birthmark on her forearm.

ZHOU YIYI
(to herself)
Same age. Same mark. Same hospital where she "found" me.

LI HUILAN enters, grocery bags in hand, stopping when she sees the screen.

LI HUILAN
You blocked my calls.

ZHOU YIYI
(coldly)
I was busy.

LI HUILAN
Busy with what?

ZHOU YIYI
Finding out why you've been lying.

LI HUILAN
What nonsense—

ZHOU YIYI
—That you stole me? That I'm not your daughter?

LI HUILAN
(shocked)
Who's been filling your head with this?

ZHOU YIYI
Stop pretending. Look.

ZHOU YIYI rolls up her sleeve, revealing the birthmark. She turns the laptop toward LI HUILAN, showing a missing baby alert and age-progressed photo that mirrors her face.

ZHOU YIYI
And this. My real father. Still looking. Still paying investigators.

LI HUILAN
(sighing)
Yiyi, half the babies born that year had marks. You're imagining—
continuation:
LI HUILAN walks forward, reaching for YIYI's arm.

LI HUILAN
Listen. I've found a new school. We'll go next week, away from these influences.

ZHOU YIYI
(pulling her hand away)
I'm not going anywhere with you. Unless you take the test.

LI HUILAN
(voice tight)
Paternity test.

ZHOU YIYI
The only thing I trust.

LI HUILAN
(V.O.)
They'll take her. They'll say I kidnapped her. Everything ends.

LI HUILAN
(firmly)
No. No test.

ZHOU YIYI
(pressing closer)
Guilty conscience?

LI HUILAN
Don't push me, Yiyi. I am your mother. Your father died protecting us. That's the truth.

ZHOU YIYI
Then why are you shaking?

Li Huilan's hand trembles as she pulls back.

ZHOU YIYI
Once I contact him, we'll see who the liar is.

ZHOU YIYI walks into her room, the door clicking shut.

LI HUILAN stands motionless. She pulls out her phone, opens a hidden folder. Inside: a photo of her younger self holding baby Yiyi in a hospital bed, a man's arm around her—the same man from the missing person alert.

LI HUILAN
(V.O.)
She wants the truth. But truth means I was never her mother. Only her kidnapper.

She deletes the photo. The screen fades to black.

title: The Character of a Master Chef
description: A pregnant chef faces workplace betrayal when her ambitious apprentice plots to take her position by exploiting her condition.
context:
Title: The Character of a Master Chef
Description: A pregnant chef faces workplace betrayal when her ambitious apprentice plots to take her position by exploiting her condition.

INT. KITCHEN - DAY

CLOSE UP - wok

Oil sizzles in the hot pan, steam rising.

HAO PING, wearing a pristine white chef's uniform, focuses intently as she tosses the wok.

QUICK CUTS:
- Green peppers are rapidly sliced into thin strips.
- Carrots are cut into thin strips.
- Pork is sliced into shreds.

HAO PING adds the prepared ingredients to the wok one by one, her movements skilled and fluid. Flames rise along the edge of the pan.

She plates the stir-fried dish - a colorful and aromatic green pepper, carrot, and pork shred dish is complete.

HAO PING
Old Jia, order up!

OLD JIA
Coming!

OLD JIA takes the plate. HAO PING suddenly feels nauseous and steadies herself against the counter, breathing carefully.

OLD JIA
(quietly)
You alright?

HAO PING
(hand on her belly)
Not quite four months yet.

OLD JIA
High-risk at your age... doctor's okay with this?

HAO PING
(firmly)
She'll be raised in her father's kitchen. No matter what.

HAO PING strokes her belly, a quiet, determined smile on her face.
continuation:
EXT. STREET - DAY (FLASHBACK)

HAO PING stands by the street, touching her stomach beneath a trench coat, looking at a photograph. She closes her eyes, then walks toward a restaurant called "Happy Little Kitchen."

INT. KITCHEN - DAY

COLLEAGUE A
Starting to show now.

COLLEAGUE B
Xiaolin's been on prep six months. Thought he'd graduate to the wok by now.

HUANG XIAOLIN peeks out from behind the curtain, listening.

HAO PING
(smiling, focused on her work)
Flavor needs time. Prep the ginger.

HUANG XIAOLIN's expression tightens, his knuckles white on the curtain.

HUANG XIAOLIN
(internal monologue)
Six months. Exactly how long does "time" take?

INT. KITCHEN - LATER

COLLEAGUE A
Thinks she's irreplaceable.

COLLEAGUE B
(quietly)
Woman carries what she carries. Mind your tongue.

INT. RESTAURANT FRONT DESK - DAY

A female CUSTOMER gives thumbs up to the owner, DAI LI.

CUSTOMER
Boss lady, your chef is the best! I'll definitely come back!

DAI LI
(enthusiastically)
Take care!

After the customer leaves, DAI LI checks the ledger.

DAI LI
(to herself)
Eight-grand chef. Better be worth it.

HUANG XIAOLIN approaches, wiping his hands.

HUANG XIAOLIN
Boss, I've been studying her technique. Every move. Every recipe.

DAI LI
And?

HUANG XIAOLIN
Just saying... if she needs more check-ups, I can hold the line. For less.

DAI LI
(skeptical)
She told you she's pregnant?

HUANG XIAOLIN
Didn't have to.

DAI LI
(quietly furious)
If she can't fulfill the role, we'll need a solution. But that's her business, not yours. Yet.

HUANG XIAOLIN
(overjoyed)
Great!

HUANG XIAOLIN's face shows a triumphant smile.

INT. KITCHEN - NIGHT

HAO PING alone, cleaning her knives. She finds a prep list with Xiaolin's handwriting - her signature dishes, meticulously copied. She touches her belly, looks around the empty kitchen, then carefully wraps the knives in cloth.

HAO PING
(softly)
Your father built this place with his hands. I'll be damned if a boy who can't wait burns it down.

She pockets the prep list and walks out, straight-backed.

FADE OUT.

title: Four-Year-Old Empress Dowager: Surrounded by Descendants from Birth
description: A doctoral student wakes up reborn as a newborn baby in ancient times, only to be immediately taken to the palace to become the emperor's wife on the day of her birth.
context:
Title: Four-Year-Old Empress Dowager: Surrounded by Descendants from Birth
Description: A doctoral student wakes up reborn as a newborn baby in ancient times, only to be immediately taken to the palace to become the emperor's wife on the day of her birth.

EXT. PRIME MINISTER'S RESIDENCE - NIGHT

Snowflakes eddy through lantern glow above the Prime Minister's residence. The plaque "Embrace All Rivers" frosts over. PRIME MINISTER YUN paces, each footprint erasing the last. A newborn's cry slices the silence.

INT. DELIVERY ROOM - NIGHT

The MIDWIFE presents the swaddled infant with practiced reverence.

MIDWIFE
Prime Minister Yun—Madam delivers a healthy daughter. Both are safe.

PRIME MINISTER YUN rushes to the bedside, his scholar's hands trembling as he accepts the bundle.

PRIME MINISTER YUN
My pearl. My little scholar. Yun Shu—she'll write her own destiny.

MADAM YUN, pale but resolute, touches the baby's cheek.

YUN SHU (V.O.)
Doctoral dissertation defense in three days. Now I'm a fleshy blob with zero motor functions. Reincarnation really needs better onboarding.

PRIME MINISTER YUN
(to Madam)
You gave us a miracle.

Heavy boots crunch in the courtyard. A sharp voice cuts through—

EUNUCH (O.S.)
Imperial Edict!

The EUNUCH (50s, iron-faced) enters, edict raised like a blade. Everyone drops to their knees, foreheads to cold floor.

EUNUCH
By Heaven's Mandate: The Emperor lies dying. A sage's counsel demands the Prime Minister's newborn daughter wed His Majesty in a blessing rite to ease his passage. Let it be done.

YUN SHU's wail becomes a furious shriek.

YUN SHU (V.O.)
Marriage? I haven't even opened my eyes yet! This body can't consent to a nap!

PRIME MINISTER YUN
(whispered)
...We accept.

The EUNUCH moves to collect YUN SHU. MADAM YUN's grip becomes steel.

EUNUCH
Madam. Do not complicate this.

MADAM YUN
Her milk's still wet!

EUNUCH
(to Prime Minister)
Your loyalty is being measured.

PRIME MINISTER YUN's jaw tightens. He gently pries MADAM YUN's fingers loose. The EUNUCH sweeps YUN SHU away.

MADAM YUN
(crumpling)
She hasn't been named yet!
continuation:
INT. PALACE BEDCHAMBER - NIGHT

CROWN PRINCE HUAN (20s, sleepless eyes) keeps vigil. The EMPEROR's breathing is a wet rattle. The EUNUCH enters, YUN SHU's cries echoing off gilded walls.

EUNUCH
Crown Prince. The little Empress.

CROWN PRINCE HUAN studies the red-faced infant, his expression unreadable. He leans close.

CROWN PRINCE HUAN
(quietly)
Father. She's here. As promised.

EMPEROR
(strained)
...Good. My final decree... protect her...

The EMPEROR exhales. Does not inhale. The silence is absolute.

YUN SHU (V.O.)
"Alleviate suffering" = instant funeral. I'm a widow and a newborn. That's got to be a record.

CROWN PRINCE HUAN
(barely controlled)
Guard! Summon the physicians!

INT. PALACE THRONE HALL - DAY

White silk drapes every surface. The NEW EMPEROR (formerly Crown Prince Huan) holds YUN SHU with unnerving stillness as officials kowtow in waves.

EUNUCH
Long live Emperor Huan! The dynasty continues!

Lightning flashes—thunder cracks immediately after. An omen.

NEW EMPEROR
(monotone)
He saw her. Then died.

YUN SHU (V.O.)
That tone. Is he calculating my murder or his alibi?

The NEW EMPEROR's thumb brushes YUN SHU's throat. Gentle. Precise. The court holds its breath. He shifts his grip, cradling her neck in support.

NEW EMPEROR
(to the court)
The Little Empress Dowager will need a nursery. In my quarters.

Shock ripples through the hall. YUN SHU's eyes—finally open—meet his. The game begins.

title: Return of the National Hero
description: A brilliant scientist who faked his death to work on secret military projects receives a desperate call from his daughter after successfully testing a revolutionary hypersonic missile.
context:
Title: Return of the National Hero
Description: A brilliant scientist who faked his death to work on secret military projects receives a desperate call from his daughter after successfully testing a revolutionary hypersonic missile.

INT. SPACE COMMAND CENTER - DAY

A circular command hall humming with quiet intensity. At the center, a ring-shaped console where TECHNICIANS monitor streams of data. A massive curved screen displays telemetry from an orbital test platform.

LIN TIAN (40s, composed, faint shadows under his eyes) stands with ZHANG SHOU (military liaison, mid-30s) and the DIRECTOR OF TIANGONG BUREAU (50s, crisp suit) behind the console, watching in tense silence.

LIN TIAN
(quietly)
Orbital platform ready. Initiate Project Tathagata test sequence.

TECHNICIAN A
(into headset)
All stations, confirm status.

TECHNICIAN B
Environmental green. Thrusters primed. Guidance locked.

TECHNICIAN C
Trajectory calculated. Re-entry window confirmed.

LIN TIAN
(to Director)
Once we verify the glide vehicle's control surfaces, we'll have a deployable system.

The Director nods, fingertips drumming the console edge.

LIN TIAN
 ignition in three...

The screen shows a sleek vehicle detaching from the orbital platform, its heat shield glowing as it bites atmosphere.

TECHNICIAN B
Ignition confirmed. Hypersonic transition... now.

The telemetry shows velocity climbing rapidly. Trajectory curves across the Pacific.

TECHNICIAN A
Mach 15... Mach 20... Atmospheric skip trajectory stable.

ZHANG SHOU
(under his breath)
Come on...

TECHNICIAN C
Terminal phase initiated. Glide vehicle responding.

The screen switches to a remote camera feed—an uninhabited atoll in the distance. The vehicle streaks down like a falling star.

TECHNICIAN B
Impact in five... four...

A silent flash blossoms on the screen. The fireball is precise, contained. The command center releases its collective breath—

—then focused applause breaks out, restrained but genuine.

TECHNICIAN A
Direct hit. Impact deviation: less than three meters.

DIRECTOR OF TIANGONG BUREAU
(to Lin Tian, voice low)
Operational range?
continuation:
LIN TIAN
Anywhere on Earth within thirty minutes. Undetectable until terminal phase.

The Director's composure cracks—just barely. He squeezes Lin Tian's shoulder.

DIRECTOR OF TIANGONG BUREAU
Seven years, Commander. You've given us something... decisive.

A communication officer approaches with a tablet.

COMMUNICATION OFFICER
Sir. Five diplomatic channels requesting urgent consultation. State Department, Defense Ministry...

He glances at the tablet.

COMMUNICATION OFFICER
...and three allied nations offering cooperative research frameworks.

ZHANG SHOU
(a thin smile)
They're not demanding anything. They're asking.

LIN TIAN
(studying the telemetry)
The technology stabilizes the strategic balance. That's all that matters.

The Director gestures to the nearby seating area—modest, functional.

DIRECTOR OF TIANGONG BUREAU
Let's debrief. Then you take the leave you've been refusing.

They move toward the chairs. Lin Tian's steps are measured, but his hand strays to his pocket—instinctively, then catches himself. He sits.

The others settle, opening tablets. Lin Tian's phone—an older model, screen showing zero bars for years—suddenly vibrates. Once. Twice.

His body goes still. The Director is speaking, but the sound recedes.

Lin Tian stares at the device in his palm. The number is unknown. Area code from a city he left behind.

ZHANG SHOU
(noticing)
Commander Lin?

Lin Tian's thumb hovers. He answers.

FEMALE VOICE (O.S.)
(broken, whispering)
Dad... it's Meiying. They took Mom. They said you owe them seven years.

Lin Tian's face drains of color. The tablet in his other hand slips—

—he catches it, but his knuckles are white.

ZHANG SHOU
Commander?

Lin Tian stands. The room watches him.

LIN TIAN
(to the Director)
I need to take this.

He walks toward the exit, phone pressed to his ear, leaving silence behind him.

END SCENE

title: Good People Have Good Fortune
description: A young man who cannot swim saves a drowning child and nearly dies, only to be blessed by a deity with wishes coming true and extraordinary luck.
context:
Title: Good People Have Good Fortune
Description: A young man who cannot swim saves a drowning child and nearly dies, only to be blessed by a deity with wishes coming true and extraordinary luck.

EXT. LAKESIDE BOARDWALK - DAY

A young man (HAOYU, 28) lies unconscious on a wooden boardwalk, soaking wet. A JOGGER performs chest compressions. A small crowd watches.

A BOY (7) wrapped in a blanket trembles, eyes fixed on Haoyu.

JOGGER
(pressing rhythmically)
Come on. Breathe.

A WOMAN clutches the boy's shoulder, crying.

WOMAN
(to the boy, whispering)
Pray for him. He gave everything for you.

The boy nods, lips moving silently.

INT. HAOYU'S CONSCIOUSNESS SPACE - DAY

Golden light bleeds through watery darkness. Haoyu floats weightless.

A MUFFLED VOICE echoes, sourceless.

HAOYU (V.O.)
Am I...?

THE VOICE
You chose the deep when you couldn't touch bottom. Ten thousand ripples for one life. Wake, child of the current. The world bends for those who bend for others.

EXT. LAKESIDE BOARDWALK - DAY

Haoyu convulses, water spilling from his mouth. He gasps, eyes opening.

The Jogger sits back, exhausted. The crowd exhales.

JOGGER
Don't move. EMS is coming.

Haoyu pushes himself up, scanning until he spots the boy. Their eyes lock.

Haoyu manages a weak thumbs-up. The boy bursts into tears.

WOMAN
Please—hospital. We'll pay.

HAOYU
(raspy)
Just need dry clothes.

He stands, wobbles. The Jogger steadies him.

JOGGER
Your name?

HAOYU
(laughs weakly)
Just... a guy who saw splashing.

He walks off unsteadily, backpack dripping.

HAOYU (V.O.)
Three years of drought. One act of drowning. And now... voices in the deep? Must be oxygen deprivation.

Haoyu checks his phone—miraculously, it works.

The phone buzzes. Caller ID: "Manager Yang." He answers.

HAOYU
Manager Yang?
continuation:
INT. MANAGER YANG'S OFFICE - DAY

MANAGER YANG sits behind his desk, phone to his ear.

MANAGER YANG
Haoyu? Where are you?

EXT. LAKESIDE BOARDWALK - DAY

HAOYU
Personal day. My mom's—

MANAGER YANG (O.S.)
Chen Qiang's out. Fender-bender. Lingyun Group's revisiting their options this afternoon. They asked for you specifically—remember that proposal? They finally read it.

Haoyu stops walking, stunned.

HAOYU
But the promotion—

MANAGER YANG (O.S.)
Yours if you want it. Clean up. Be here by three.

The line goes dead. Haoyu stares at the phone.

HAOYU
(whispering)
Specifically...

The phone buzzes again. Caller ID: "Dr. Wang."

HAOYU
Dr. Wang? The results—

INT. DOCTOR'S OFFICE - DAY

DR. WANG sits at his desk, looking at a report.

DR. WANG
Benign. Better positioned than we thought. Laparoscopic possible—less invasive, half the cost. Come today?

EXT. LAKESIDE BOARDWALK - DAY

HAOYU
(voice breaking)
Yes. Yes, I can.

He pockets the phone, breathing hard.

Ahead, a LOTTERY BOOTH banner flaps in the wind.

Haoyu looks at his reflection in a puddle—soaking, but alive.

He smiles, walks past the booth without stopping.

ONLOOKER (O.S.)
Wait! He didn't leave his name!

Haoyu raises a hand in farewell, walking into the morning light.

FADE TO BLACK.

title: The Bridge Confrontation
description: A former CEO who gave up his billion-dollar empire for love confronts his ex-girlfriend on a bridge, only to discover the devastating truth about his sacrifice.
context:
Title: The Bridge Confrontation
Description: A former CEO who gave up his billion-dollar empire for love confronts his ex-girlfriend on a bridge, only to discover the devastating truth about his sacrifice.

EXT. BRIDGE - NIGHT

A young man (GU MING) sits on the bridge railing, looking dejected. A crowd of onlookers gathers around, taking out their phones to record.

FEMALE PASSERBY A
What's this guy doing? Is he going to jump?

A middle-aged MALE PASSERBY steps forward.

MALE PASSERBY
Hey buddy, it's dangerous standing up there. Come down quickly.

GU MING looks at his phone. A notification sound comes from it.

PHONE VOICE (V.O.)
Your order has been reassigned due to delay.

ON SCREEN: GU MING - Former Chairman, Tianlang Group.

MALE PASSERBY
Young man, whatever's troubling you, don't do anything foolish.

GU MING
Tell Gong Yue'er to come see me.

MALE PASSERBY
We can talk about whatever it is once you come down, okay?

GU MING
(shouting)
I said tell Gong Yue'er to come see me!

MALE PASSERBY
(turning to the crowd)
Does anyone know Gong Yue'er?

FEMALE PASSERBY B
Gong Yue'er? Is that the CEO who just took over Tianlang?

FEMALE PASSERBY B hands her phone to the MALE PASSERBY. The phone is playing a live stream of a press conference.

GONG YUE'ER (on phone video)
Tianlang Group will operate as an independent subsidiary under Gong Corporation.

MALE PASSERBY
(to GU MING)
You're a delivery driver. Why would the chairman—

GU MING climbs back over the railing onto the bridge.

MALE PASSERBY
Good, good, don't get agitated.
(to the crowd)
Tag Tianlang's account. Someone's life is at stake.

The onlookers all start operating their phones.

Several black luxury cars speed up and stop on the bridge. A group of BODYGUARDS get out and line up in two rows.

GONG YUE'ER, dressed in elegant clothing, gets out of a car and walks through the bodyguards toward GU MING.

GU MING
Yue'er, you finally came to see me.

ON SCREEN: GONG YUE'ER - CEO, Tianlang Group.

A man in a suit (ZHANG TAO) also gets out of the car.

ON SCREEN: ZHANG TAO - CFO, Gong Corporation.

ZHANG TAO
(to the onlookers)
continuation:
Stop filming. You're violating CEO Gong's rights. Leave now.

The bodyguards begin dispersing the crowd.

GU MING
Yue'er, I sent everything I made. Ten thousand.

ZHANG TAO
Gu Ming, she makes that in interest by noon.

GU MING
But... it's what I earned.

ZHANG TAO laughs contemptuously.

GU MING
I wanted to prove I could survive without Tianlang.

GONG YUE'ER
You proved you can't. Zhang Tao's bonus last month was one hundred thousand.

GU MING
That's because I gave you Tianlang!

GONG YUE'ER
I didn't force you. You signed the papers voluntarily.

GU MING
For you! So we could be together!

ZHANG TAO
She's with me now. We merged accounts last week.

GONG YUE'ER
Gu Ming, Zhang Tao and I are married.

GU MING
(shocked)
That's impossible. Yue'er, that's impossible, right?

GU MING tries to grab GONG YUE'ER's hand but is pushed away by ZHANG TAO.

ZHANG TAO
What are you doing?

GU MING
I gave you three generations of business. What more do you want?

GONG YUE'ER
Look at yourself. You think love is a transaction. You gave me a company to buy my loyalty. I'm not for sale.

GU MING
Yue'er, if you think I don't love you enough—

ZHANG TAO
Love? Gu Ming, when you were CEO, your life had value. Now? You're worthless.

GONG YUE'ER
Jump or don't. Either way, I won't be there.

GU MING
Yue'er, we've been together so long. Did you never—

GONG YUE'ER
I hate this pathetic version of you. Following me around like a dog. No—dogs have pride.

GONG YUE'ER and ZHANG TAO both laugh.

GU MING
Yue'er, stop joking.

ZHANG TAO
Joking? Your father died the moment you signed. He collapsed in Yue'er's office.

GU MING's expression changes drastically upon hearing this, his eyes filled with shock and disbelief.

title: Seven Year Itch in Marriage
description: A delivery man discovers his wife may be cheating on their wedding anniversary, only to receive shocking news that changes everything.
context:
Title: Seven Year Itch in Marriage
Description: A delivery man discovers his wife may be cheating on their wedding anniversary, only to receive shocking news that changes everything.

EXT. PARK - DAY

Delivery man ZHANG KANG, 32, sits on a park bench, scarfing down his lunch while checking delivery orders on his phone.

Another delivery man, SUN BIN, rides up on his electric scooter and parks beside him.

SUN BIN
Yo, Kang. Guilin Road's about to pop off. Those art students are flooding out—easy twenty, thirty orders.

ZHANG KANG
(mouth full, tapping his phone)
Pass. Already logged out.

ZHANG KANG jerks his thumb toward the grocery bags strapped to his scooter.

ZHANG KANG
Anniversary. Wife's been away on that conference all week. Surprise dinner.

SUN BIN
Lucky bastard. Still, heard the landlord's been sniffing around your building. Dude drives a Tesla.

ZHANG KANG
(grinning)
She's not even home 'til tonight. Nice try.

ZHANG KANG's phone BUZZES. He glances at it—it's a voice message from "AUNTIE WANG (2A)."

He presses play. Muffled through the speaker: bed creaking, rhythmic thumping, a woman's soft moan.

AUNTIE WANG (V.O.)
(filtered, tinny)
Zhang Kang? This is Wang Ayi from upstairs. I've been calling your wife about the water leak. Listen to this noise—four hours now. My kid can't study. Call me back!

ZHANG KANG's face drains. He replays the message, jaw tight.

SUN BIN
Everything cool?

ZHANG KANG
(stuffing phone in pocket)
Forgot something at home.

He vaults onto his scooter and PEELS OUT.
continuation:
INT. ZHANG KANG'S APARTMENT - DAY

ZHANG KANG bursts through the door, breathing hard.

His wife JIANG SHUYI, 30, elegant even in casual wear, sits on the sofa scrolling her phone. She wears an oversized white dress shirt—definitely not hers. She freezes.

JIANG SHUYI
You're... home early.

ZHANG KANG doesn't answer. His eyes scan the room—men's leather gloves on the coffee table, a glass with whiskey residue.

He strides to the bedroom door. The bed is unmade, a man's watch on the nightstand.

ZHANG KANG
(emerging, voice controlled)
Your conference end early?

JIANG SHUYI
Last night. Wanted to surprise you.

ZHANG KANG
Surprise.

He picks up the leather gloves.

ZHANG KANG
These yours too?

JIANG SHUYI
The landlord... fixed the AC. He left them.

ZHANG KANG
(nodding slowly)
The landlord. Who drives a Tesla.

JIANG SHUYI
(defensive)
What's that supposed to mean?

ZHANG KANG
Nothing. Just—funny timing.

He moves closer. She stands her ground. He notices the shirt's monogram on the cuff—initials that aren't his.

ZHANG KANG
New shirt?

JIANG SHUYI
You're scaring me.

ZHANG KANG
Do I smell?

He steps into her space. She flinches—just slightly—when he touches her waist.

JIANG SHUYI
Don't. You smell like... work.

She pulls away, grabs something from the sofa cushion.

JIANG SHUYI
But I have news.

She holds up a pregnancy test. Two clear lines.

JIANG SHUYI
Six weeks. I found out yesterday.

ZHANG KANG stares at the test. Then at her. Then at the whiskey glass.

ZHANG KANG
(softly)
Six weeks.

His phone BUZZES again—Auntie Wang's follow-up text: "Sorry, wrong apartment! Noise is from 3B. How's your wife's trip?"

ZHANG KANG reads it. Doesn't react. Just pockets the phone.

He looks at JIANG SHUYI, who watches him with wide, unreadable eyes.

ZHANG KANG
We need to talk about the father.

ZHANG KANG's voice is quiet. JIANG SHUYI's face goes pale.

FADE OUT.

title: Little Her
description: An elderly underground worker with limited time left is tasked with finding a legendary information genius known only as "Red Hat" to help with the urgent war effort.
context:
Title: Little Her
Description: An elderly underground worker with limited time left is tasked with finding a legendary information genius known only as "Red Hat" to help with the urgent war effort.

INT. GRANDFATHER'S HOUSE LIVING ROOM - DAY

RADIO (V.O.)
...mathematical genius program activated. Northern front encryption failing under enemy information warfare...

OLD WANG (70s, trembling hands) sits with XUANXUAN (8, still as a pond, eyes too old).

OLD WANG
Xuanxuan. Show me what I taught you.

OLD WANG places a ONE-JIAO COIN on the table.

OLD WANG
One jiao. One steamed bun. Base value.

OLD WANG places a FIVE-JIAO BILL beside it.

OLD WANG
Five jiao. One bun with filling. But context changes worth.

XUANXUAN
(calculating silently)
Plain: 80 grams. Filled: 120 grams. Filling density unknown. Value requires more data points.

OLD WANG
(faint pride)
Always more data.

AUNT DIAO (50s, practical, worn-thin) enters, envelope in hand.

AUNT DIAO
Hospital courier. Said deliver it straight.

She sets it down. Old Wang reads. His jaw tightens.

INSERT: DIAGNOSIS
"Daqing People's Hospital. Terminal. 30 days."

AUNT DIAO
(quieter)
My sister's boy could use a friend. She'd be fed. I'd see to it.

OLD WANG
She's not a pot to pass around when I'm gone.

AUNT DIAO
(defensive)
Someone has to think practical.

She leaves. Old Wang pockets the paper.

MONTAGE:
- A black sedan speeds through narrow alleys.
- SPECIAL AGENT A (30s, lean) exits, briefcase cuffed to his wrist.
- SPECIAL AGENT B (40s, solid) scans the street, urgent but controlled.
continuation:
INT. GRANDFATHER'S HOUSE LIVING ROOM - DAY

OLD WANG
(to himself)
One month.

The agents enter. Agent A notices the currency arranged in a pattern on the table.

SPECIAL AGENT A
Old Wang. Northern front's losing codes every three hours. We need Red Hat.

OLD WANG
Twenty years in Yuncheng underground. Never heard that name.

SPECIAL AGENT B
1962. Used newspaper circulation numbers to crack a diplomatic cipher. No description. Just the code name.

OLD WANG
No description... except he sees patterns.

SPECIAL AGENT A
(intense)
Exactly.

Xuanxuan has arranged the bills into a star pattern. She looks up, unblinking.

OLD WANG
Xuanxuan. Take five jiao. Buy a bun. Then count the bridge pillars. Bring me the pattern.

XUANXUAN
Pattern is data. Data has value.

She takes the bill and leaves. Agent B watches her measured steps.

SPECIAL AGENT A
The child—

OLD WANG
(to Aunt Diao)
Aunt Diao, please go back as well.

AUNT DIAO
Who cares.

AUNT DIAO leaves. SPECIAL AGENT A notices the diagnosis in Old Wang's pocket.

SPECIAL AGENT A
What's that?

OLD WANG
(laughing)
Gallstones. Two doses of herbs and fine.

EXT. COUNTRY ROAD - DAY

XUANXUAN walks, calculating aloud.

XUANXUAN
Bridge has six pillars. Six points on a star. Red Hat last seen Yuncheng '62. Grandpa's scarf has six red knots...

SPECIAL AGENT A (V.O.)
The situation at the front is extremely urgent right now. The enemy's information offensive against us is very fierce. We came here to find the legendary information genius.

OLD WANG (V.O.)
Information genius? Are there any distinguishing features?

SPECIAL AGENT A (V.O.)
No distinguishing features whatsoever.

SPECIAL AGENT B (V.O.)
All we know is that the last place he appeared was Yuncheng. The only thing we know is his code name: Red Hat.

EXT. DILAPIDATED BRIDGE UNDERPASS - DAY

A BEGGAR (60s, sleeping) wears a tattered RED HAT with a SIX-POINT STAR pattern. XUANXUAN approaches. She places her five-jiao bill beside him, then arranges SIX STONES in a matching star.

The beggar's eyes open—sharp, aware. He touches the pattern, nods slowly.

XUANXUAN
Grandpa says the pattern is the message.

She unties her scarf—same red star pattern—and holds it out.

FADE OUT.

title: Industrial Light
description: A brilliant scientist who invented a time machine seeks to return to the past to right the wrongs done to his love and his country.
context:
Title: Industrial Light
Description: A brilliant scientist who invented a time machine seeks to return to the past to right the wrongs done to his love and his country.

INT. FUTURISTIC LAB - DAY

A pristine laboratory of holographic displays and quantum interfaces. ZHOU SHENG stands on a circular platform, facing a 3D projection of his younger self.

Data streams flash across the projection.

SYSTEM (V.O.)
Temporal extraction verified. Anchor stable. Memory imprint complete.

ZHOU SHENG lowers his hands. They tremble slightly.

Above, the ELDERLY MAN watches from the observation deck with the FEMALE SCIENTIST and FOREIGN MALE SCIENTIST.

FEMALE SCIENTIST
(quietly)
Neural feedback is peaking. If he loses focus...

ELDERLY MAN
He won't.

The projection dissolves. Zhou steps off the platform.

ELDERLY MAN
(through intercom)
Chief Designer Zhou. The Council has approved your request.

The Elderly Man descends. A FEMALE ASSISTANT carries a metal case.

ELDERLY MAN
Controlled fusion, nanotech replicators, lunar transport, Mars independence... each breakthrough, you asked for nothing. Today, you ask for the impossible.

He opens the case. Inside, a crystalline medal pulses with light.

ELDERLY MAN
For Hua Nation's future.

He pins it to Zhou's black tunic.

ELDERLY MAN
What will you change?

ZHOU SHENG
(quietly)
One conversation. With Su Xiaoxi.

ELDERLY MAN
(reducing voice)
The sanctions, the blockades... you could rewrite a decade of defense policy.

ZHOU SHENG
(steady)
Without her, there's nothing to defend.

The Foreign Male Scientist steps forward.

FOREIGN MALE SCIENTIST
My country's resources are at your disposal. She was your compass.

ZHOU SHENG
She still is.
continuation:
INT. PARK - DAY (FLASHBACK)

Rain. Young ZHOU SHENG's vision blurs. He's on the ground, blood at his mouth.

SU XIAOXI struggles in LI KUNLUN's grip. Her eyes lock on Zhou's.

SU XIAOXI
(to Li)
Let him go! The drive is useless!

SU TIANBAO emerges, umbrella in hand.

SU TIANBAO
The Fengtian acquisition closes at midnight. Your interference stops now.

SU XIAOXI
(to Tianbao)
You're trading our family's name for a seat at their table?

SU TIANBAO
I'm buying our survival with it.

LI KUNLUN
(to Xiaoxi)
Come with me, or he doesn't leave this park.

THUGS raise their clubs. Su Xiaoxi sees Zhou's fingers twitch toward a broken data drive in the mud.

SU XIAOXI
(voice breaking)
I'll go. Just stop.

Li Kunlun nods. THUGS drag Zhou's unconscious body away.

Su Xiaoxi whispers something lost to the rain.

END FLASHBACK.

INT. FUTURISTIC LAB - DAY

Zhou Sheng stands motionless. The medal pulses with his heartbeat.

A monitor shows headlines: HUA TECH COMPANIES BLACKLISTED.

ZHOU SHENG (V.O.)
She traded herself for a fake blueprint. For ten years, I believed she betrayed us.

He walks toward the time machine - a neural interface chair.

ZHOU SHENG (V.O.)
Now I know. And I have three hours before Fengtian's deal locks.

He sits. Interfaces activate.

ZHOU SHENG
(whisper)
This time, I'll be standing.

The lab dims. The Elderly Man watches.

ELDERLY MAN
(to himself)
For all our sakes.

The temporal field ignites. The crystal medal goes dark.

FADE TO WHITE.

title: Luring Her Into the Trap
description: A woman betrayed by her husband and his mistress is reborn to the day they first brought deception into her home, determined to exact revenge.
context:
Title: Luring Her Into the Trap
Description: A woman betrayed by her husband and his mistress is reborn to the day they first brought deception into her home, determined to exact revenge.

INT. BEDROOM - NIGHT

The camera pans across a lit table lamp casting long shadows, a pair of slippers kicked aside, a prescription bottle on its side, pills scattered.

LIN XINLAN lies on the floor, eyes fixed on the ceiling, a trace of blood at her lips.

LIN XINLAN (V.O.)
They say your life flashes before you when you die. Mine didn't. I only saw the truth I'd refused to see.

A flashback flickers: HAO JIAN gently brushing hair from SHEN ZHIQING's neck, a look passing between them that could be mistaken for familial care.

INT. BEDROOM - TWO HOURS EARLIER

ON SCREEN: Two Hours Earlier

LIN XINLAN lies in bed, pale, coughing into a trembling hand. A wedding photo faces her on the nightstand.

HAO JIAN enters, carrying a bowl of steaming soup. He sets it down, helps her sit up.

LIN XINLAN's hand shakes as she reaches for her heart medication.

HAO JIAN watches her fumble with the bottle. He doesn't help.

Suddenly, LIN XINLAN gasps, clutching her chest. The pills scatter.

LIN XINLAN
(strangled)
Hao Jian... the medicine... it's wrong...

HAO JIAN's expression empties. He picks up the bottle, reads the label with mild interest.

HAO JIAN
(calculating)
Wrong? No. It's exactly what I requested. Double concentration.

LIN XINLAN
(whispering)
Why? I gave you everything...

HAO JIAN
You gave me a title and a cage. Ten years of playing the grateful husband.

LIN XINLAN
(realizing)
The company... you wanted Tianlan Group...

SHEN ZHIQING (O.S.)
He wanted me.

SHEN ZHIQING walks in, wearing LIN XINLAN's silk robe, belted loosely. She leans against the doorframe.

HAO JIAN releases the bottle. It rolls across the floor. SHEN ZHIQING picks it up, examining it.

LIN XINLAN
Cousin Shen...? You're family...

SHEN ZHIQING laughs, a sound like breaking glass.

HAO JIAN
We share a surname. That's all we ever shared.
continuation:
SHEN ZHIQING
(to LIN XINLAN)
Calling me 'cousin' let me help him pick out your anniversary gifts. Know your schedule. Your medical history.

LIN XINLAN
(dawning fury)
You were planning this... all along...

SHEN ZHIQING
We were waiting for your heart to finish what we started.

She places a manicured hand on HAO JIAN's shoulder. He covers it with his own.

LIN XINLAN
(struggling upright)
I'll destroy you both...

SHEN ZHIQING shoves her back with one sharp motion.

SHEN ZHIQING
You'll die. And the world will mourn the poor heiress who couldn't live without her husband.

HAO JIAN produces a small vial from his pocket, holds it up to the light.

HAO JIAN
Digitalis overdose. Looks like suicide. Depression is such a convenient disease.

LIN XINLAN
No—wait—

He forces it between her teeth. She fights, but he's stronger. The liquid burns down her throat.

HAO JIAN
(quietly)
Goodbye, Xinlan. Thank you for the empire.

He watches as she convulses, his face betraying nothing.

LIN XINLAN (V.O.)
I wouldn't get a next life. But I got something better: a second chance.

She goes still.

INT. LIVING ROOM - DAY

The clock on the wall spins backward, blurring.

LIN XINLAN gasps, jerking upright on the sofa, hand flying to her chest. Her heartbeat is strong. Impossible.

She's in a designer dress, hair perfectly styled. The living room is sunlit, vulgar in its opulence.

She grabs her phone from the coffee table. The screen shows "March 1st, 2023."

LIN XINLAN
(whisper)
The day I welcomed them home.

Her breathing steadies. Her hand stops trembling. She looks at her reflection in the darkened TV screen.

LIN XINLAN (V.O.)
Last time, I didn't know the rules.
(beat)
This time, I make them.

She sets the phone down gently. In her eyes, something colder than vengeance: certainty.

title: A Stunning Smile Captivates the Heavens
description: Chen Ping'an, the last male heir of a loyal military family, is forced to disguise himself as a woman to escape political purge, but unexpectedly gets summoned into the palace as an imperial consort.
context:
Title: A Stunning Smile Captivates the Heavens
Description: Chen Ping'an, the last male heir of a loyal military family, is forced to disguise himself as a woman to escape political purge, but unexpectedly gets summoned into the palace as an imperial consort.

INT. CHEN RESIDENCE - NIGHT

Candlelight flickers. Shadows stretch across painted screens.

CHEN PING'AN (18, sharp-featured, battle-hardened hands) sits before a bronze mirror. He presses red paper to his lips. His reflection shows fury warring with resignation.

CHEN PING'AN (V.O.)
Three generations of Chen blood soaked the borders. Now I'm painting my lips to survive.

He slams the rouge box down. Vermillion powder blooms like smoke across the table.

EXT. FOREST - DAY (FLASHBACK)

Sunlight slashes through canopy. Metal screams against metal.

CHEN PING'AN, in dented armor, spins his spear through a BARBARIAN RAIDER'S throat. Two more corpses litter the moss. He pivots, breathing hard, as the BARBARIAN GENERAL (40s, scarred, bored) spits blood.

BARBARIAN GENERAL
The Great Wall is rubble. Daxia's masters are carrion. Who are you, boy?

CHEN PING'AN
Tianbo Manor. Chen Ping'an.

He lunges. The spear takes the General through the heart.

INT. CHEN RESIDENCE MAIN HALL - DAY

GRAND MATRON SHE (70s, iron-gray hair, courtier's eyes) sits at a rosewood desk, studying a scroll marked with red seals. Four names are crossed out.

CHEN PING'AN strides in, tosses a bloodied sack on the floor. A head rolls out.

CHEN PING'AN
The barbarian raider is dead. Petition the Emperor. Let me lead the northern army.

GRAND MATRON SHE
You think a savage's head buys you the right to die?

CHEN PING'AN
Father died at the Wall. My brothers died at the Wall. I won't hide in women's quarters!

GRAND MATRON SHE rises, cane striking the floor like a gavel.

GRAND MATRON SHE
The Chancellor's faction has purged four military families this month. Every Chen male is marked for elimination.

She throws the scroll. It unfurls at his feet.

GRAND MATRON SHE
You want honor? Honor is a dead man's luxury.

The three SISTERS-IN-LAW enter, arms full of silk.

ELDEST SISTER-IN-LAW
We sold our dowries to bribe the census officials. You're registered as female now.
continuation:
SECOND SISTER-IN-LAW
Your second brother's death pension paid for it. Don't waste his sacrifice.

THIRD SISTER-IN-LAW
(softly)
We know what we ask, little brother. But ghosts don't father children.

Chen's jaw tightens. He closes his eyes.

CHEN PING'AN
(whisper)
Begin.

They undress him. Armor clatters. Silk whispers. They bind his chest, arrange his hair, slip earrings through untouched lobes. The transformation is silent, funereal.

SECOND SISTER-IN-LAW
(studying him)
Even Duke Xu would look plain beside you.

GRAND MATRON SHE
(nods, satisfied)
As a woman, you're invisible to our enemies. Survive first. The rest can follow.

EUNUCH (O.S.)
Imperial decree!

EUNUCH LI, flanked by GOLD-ARMORED GUARDS, sweeps in. The Chen family drops to their knees.

EUNUCH LI
(unfurling yellow silk)
By Heaven's Mandate: The maiden Chen Ping'an, virtuous and graceful, daughter of a loyal house, is summoned to the Inner Palace as Noble Consort. Let it be known!

The scroll snaps shut. Grand Matron She goes pale.

EXT. CHEN RESIDENCE ENTRANCE - DAY

Red lanterns hang like blood drops. GRAND MATRON SHE and the sisters-in-law watch the bridal sedan.

GRAND MATRON SHE
(to the ancestors' tablets)
Forgive us.

The sedan lifts. Chen's red-veiled face disappears behind swaying curtains.

INT. IMPERIAL PALACE BEDCHAMBER - NIGHT

Red candles weep wax. CHEN PING'AN sits rigid, veil in place.

CHEN PING'AN (V.O.)
Hide as a woman, they said. Become invisible. Instead, I'm unveiled before the Son of Heaven.

EUNUCH (O.S.)
Your Majesty! The auspicious hour arrives.

Chen's hand trembles. He lifts the veil's edge. In the copper mirror: a stranger's face, painted and terrified.

FADE OUT.

title: I Teamed Up With My Ex-Wife (Episode 1)
description: A successful painter is framed by his brother-in-law after his father-in-law's suicide, leading to his wife's vow for revenge.
context:
Title: I Teamed Up With My Ex-Wife (Episode 1)
Description: A successful painter is framed by his brother-in-law after his father-in-law's suicide, leading to his wife's vow for revenge.

INT. VILLA - DAY

A television news broadcast is playing.

NEWS ANCHOR (V.O.)
Allegations of securities fraud against Song Group President Song Tingchen continue to mount. Sources confirm illegal capital raising and manipulated stock trades through controlled accounts.

SONG TINGCHEN watches the news on TV expressionlessly. His photo is displayed on the screen. He picks up a rope hanging from the ceiling, ties a knot, and puts it around his neck.

He stands on a box, closes his eyes with a pained expression, then kicks the box away. His body hangs in the air.

Suddenly, a young woman, SONG WAN, rushes in.

SONG WAN
(screaming hysterically)
Dad! Dad! Dad!

SONG WAN kneels on the ground, holding SONG TINGCHEN who is now lying on the floor, crying bitterly.

SONG WAN
(sobbing)
Dad! Dad, look at Wanwan! You can't leave Wanwan alone! I've already thought of a solution! Dad!

The TV news continues.

NEWS ANCHOR (V.O.)
According to reliable sources, it was Song Group's son-in-law Wen Cheng who exposed the company's wrongdoings. In 2018, Wen Cheng married Song Wan, the only daughter of Song Group. After marriage, his career flourished. As one of Yun City's top ten outstanding painters, Wen Cheng is now worth over a hundred million.

SONG WAN stops crying upon hearing the news. She looks up in shock, her eyes filled with disbelief and rage.

SONG WAN
(through gritted teeth)
Wen Cheng... I will make you pay with blood.

EXT. CEMETERY - NIGHT

Heavy rain pours down with thunder rumbling. SONG WAN, dressed in black and wearing sunglasses, stands before a tombstone. A BODYGUARD holds an umbrella over her.

SONG WAN
(to the tombstone)
