Dad, rest assured. I will make Wen Cheng suffer a thousand cuts. Bring Wen Cheng to me! I want him to kneel before my father's grave and admit his guilt!

Two BODYGUARDS drag WEN CHENG over, soaking wet and covered in mud, forcing him to kneel on the ground.

SONG WAN
Wen Cheng, do you know? Your face used to be my favorite thing about you. But now, seeing your face makes me feel nothing but disgust! I hate myself for marrying you, for sponsoring you and making you famous! People like you should crawl in the gutter for the rest of your life and never rise again!

WEN CHENG
(weak)
Wanwan, Wanwan, it really wasn't me who betrayed Dad.

SONG WAN
But my father is already dead! I have no father anymore! Even my mother had a stroke because of you and is hospitalized! You've destroyed my family like this, how long will you keep making excuses!

WEN CHENG
At that time, Mom and I were following someone into the archive room. She had the proof.
continuation:
INT. ARCHIVE ROOM CORRIDOR/ARCHIVE ROOM - NIGHT (FLASHBACK)

WEN CHENG supports his mother SHEN LIZHEN as they walk through the company corridor. She clutches a folder—Song Group's original audit reports.

WEN CHENG
Why is someone still here at this hour?

SHEN LIZHEN
Your father said these would clear him. We need the hard copies.

WEN CHENG
I'll go check.

WEN CHENG enters the archive room, which is in complete disarray. A MAN wearing a mask and hat appears from behind the door and strikes WEN CHENG on the back of the head with a club. WEN CHENG falls unconscious.

When WEN CHENG wakes up, he finds himself lying on the floor with a splitting headache. He exits the archive room and sees his mother collapsed in the corridor, the folder gone.

WEN CHENG
(panicking)
Mom! Mom! Mom, don't scare me! Mom, wake up! Mom!

The scene shifts to SONG WAN holding the unconscious SHEN LIZHEN.

SONG WAN
(anxiously)
Mom!

Another man, ZHENG YUCHUAN, appears.

ZHENG YUCHUAN
Wen Cheng, you gave the company's confidential information to the media, and now you want to harm your mother-in-law?

WEN CHENG
(at the computer, frantically)
It wasn't me! Wanwan, it wasn't me!

EXT. CEMETERY - NIGHT

Back to reality, ZHENG YUCHUAN walks to SONG WAN's side holding an umbrella.

WEN CHENG
(to SONG WAN)
That person pretended to be...

ZHENG YUCHUAN
(interrupting him)
Wen Cheng! You're still stubborn even at death's door. Do you take everyone for fools? A real man should own up to his actions!

SONG WAN
(to ZHENG YUCHUAN)
How did the matter I asked you to handle go?

ZHENG YUCHUAN
It's done. The famous painter Wen Cheng is suspected of smuggling famous paintings with a case value of up to one billion. That's enough to put our great painter away for ten years.

SONG WAN
Ten years isn't enough. I want him dead.

ZHENG YUCHUAN
Don't worry, he won't come out alive.

ZHENG YUCHUAN kicks WEN CHENG to the ground.

ZHENG YUCHUAN
(crouching down, to WEN CHENG)
Competing with me for Song Wan? You're not worthy!

ZHENG YUCHUAN takes out a knife and stabs it viciously into WEN CHENG's palm.

WEN CHENG
(screaming)
Ah!

ZHENG YUCHUAN
(sneering)
Still want to be a painter? In your next life, be an animal instead!

ZHENG YUCHUAN twists the knife forcefully, then pulls it out and stands up to leave. WEN CHENG lies in the mud in agony.

title: The Lin Family Turmoil
description: A man is falsely accused of theft by his wife's family, leading to a confrontation that reveals deep-seated prejudice and ultimately prompts him to demand a divorce.
context:
Title: The Lin Family Turmoil
Description: A man is falsely accused of theft by his wife's family, leading to a confrontation that reveals deep-seated prejudice and ultimately prompts him to demand a divorce.

INT. LIN FAMILY LIVING ROOM - DAY

The Lin family sits in tense silence. LIN XUEQIN seizes QIN CHUAN's wrist and pries a jade pendant from his hand.

QIN CHUAN
(struggling)
Xueqin, that's—

LIN XUEQIN slaps him hard across the face.

QIN CHUAN stares at her.

LIN XUEQIN
Sili's jade pendant? My God, Qin Chuan.

MOTHER LIN
(from the sofa, voice cold)
We welcomed you into this family. This is how you repay us?

QI SILI
(leaning forward)
There's no need for this, Brother-in-law. If you admired it, you could have asked.

QIN CHUAN
It's mine.

LIN XUEYAN
(incredulous)
Yours? I've been married to you for five years. Don't I know—

LIN XUEQIN
You have any idea what that's worth?

LIN XUEYAN
At least ten million.

QI SILI
(shaking his head)
And to think I trusted you.

CHENGCHENG
(loudly)
Enough! He's my dad!

QI SILI crosses to CHENGCHENG, crouching before him.

QI SILI
(gently)
Chengcheng, tell everyone again what you saw.

CHENGCHENG
But I don't—

LIN XUEQIN
It's all right, sweetie. Just tell the truth.

CHENGCHENG
(eyes darting)
I saw Dad... in Uncle Qi's room. He had something shiny.

LIN XUEYAN
(hissing)
How could you, with your child watching?

QIN CHUAN
(desperate)
continuation:
It was my father's. Our name is carved—

MOTHER LIN
An heirloom? (scoffs) You expect us to believe that?

She rises, shoving QIN CHUAN.

MOTHER LIN
You need to learn respect!

LIN XUEQIN
Sili, take that thing.

QI SILI reaches for the pendant, examining it.

QI SILI
(quietly)
Wait... this isn't from my collection.

LIN XUEYAN
What?

MOTHER LIN
Not yours?

QI SILI
The craftsmanship is exquisite. I assumed... but I've never seen this piece.

LIN XUEYAN
Then whose is it?

QIN CHUAN
The seal. It's been in my family for generations.

LIN XUEYAN takes the pendant, holds it to the light.

LIN XUEYAN
(surprised)
There really is—
(drops it)
Fine. Take it.

QIN CHUAN bends, retrieves the pendant, wipes it.

QI SILI
(smoothing his collar)
Perhaps... he was trying to impress us. It happens when people feel... out of place.

MOTHER LIN
A poor man putting on airs—how pathetic.

LIN XUEYAN
I can't believe you'd go this far.

QIN CHUAN
(lifting his head, eyes hollow)
Is this really what you think of me?

LIN XUEYAN
What was I supposed to think? You've been so... embarrassed lately.

QIN CHUAN
(bitter smile)
Yes. I'm embarrassing. I have nothing more to say.

He stands, picks up his jacket.

QIN CHUAN
(calmly)
Lin Xueyan. I want a divorce.

title: My Mother's Life-Saving Money Became My Sister-in-Law's Dowry
description: A daughter witnesses her family torn apart when her brother diverts their mother's surgery funds for his girlfriend's demands, leading to tragic consequences.
context:
Title: My Mother's Life-Saving Money Became My Sister-in-Law's Dowry
Description: A daughter witnesses her family torn apart when her brother diverts their mother's surgery funds for his girlfriend's demands, leading to tragic consequences.

INT. FUNERAL PARLOR ENTRANCE - DAY

ZHOU XIAOLIN, dressed in white with a red scarf, holds an urn with a sorrowful expression, walking slowly.

ZHOU XIAOLIN (V.O.)
In this small box lies my mother. From now on, I have no mother. The culprit behind all this is my own brother.

ON SCREEN: SEVEN DAYS AGO

INT. HOSPITAL WARD - DAY

A door plate reads "Ward 403."

Inside the ward, MOTHER WANG CHUNFANG lies in bed. Daughter ZHOU XIAOLIN and son ZHOU XIAOFENG are at her bedside caring for her.

ZHOU XIAOLIN gently wipes MOTHER's frail hands with a warm towel. The monitor's steady beep fills the sterile room.

WANG CHUNFANG
You both took time off... your bosses won't be happy.

ZHOU XIAOLIN
The only boss I answer to right now is you, Mom.

ZHOU XIAOFENG sits peeling a pear, the ribbon falling in one continuous spiral.

ZHOU XIAOFENG
Chemo numbers were good today. One more surgery. That's all.

WANG CHUNFANG stares at the ceiling, her fingers worrying the blanket's edge.

WANG CHUNFANG
That house... your father built it with his own hands.

ZHOU XIAOLIN exchanges a glance with her brother.

ZHOU XIAOFENG
(quietly)
It's just wood and concrete, Mom. You're the real home.

He pats his jacket pocket, a faint card-shaped bulge, then squeezes his mother's shoulder.

WANG CHUNFANG
(turning away)
I'm so tired, children.

ZHOU XIAOLIN
Then rest. We'll be here when you wake up.

Mother's breathing steadies into sleep. The siblings share a moment of fragile hope.

ZHOU XIAOFENG
I'll handle the paperwork.

He exits. Xiaolin stays, holding mother's hand.
continuation:
INT. HOSPITAL CORRIDOR - DAY

ZHOU XIAOFENG rounds the corner, running a hand through his hair. LIU FEIFEI sits slumped in a plastic chair, a bruise blooming across her cheekbone.

ZHOU XIAOFENG
Feifei.

She flinches, then seizes his wrist with desperate strength.

LIU FEIFEI
Xiaofeng. They'll kill him. They'll really kill him.

ZHOU XIAOFENG
(trying to pull away)
Slow down. Who?

LIU FEIFEI
My brother. The loan sharks. He used our parents' shop as collateral. If I don't bring them 600,000 by tomorrow...

She chokes on a sob. Zhou Xiaofeng goes very still.

ZHOU XIAOFENG
600,000.

LIU FEIFEI
(pleading)
Just a loan. Just for a month. I'll pay it back, I swear. My brother's life, Xiaofeng. They'll take his life.

ZHOU XIAOFENG stares at the bank card in his hand. Then at the ward door. Then back at Feifei's tear-streaked face.

ZHOU XIAOFENG
(whispering)
One month.

He hands it to her. She clutches it to her chest.

INT. HOSPITAL WARD - NIGHT

ZHOU XIAOLIN wakes with a start, alone in the darkened ward. A NURSE stands nearby, chart in hand.

ZHOU XIAOLIN
Where's my mother?

NURSE
Emergency transfer to ICU an hour ago. Her son signed the forms. Said there were... complications with payment.

Xiaolin's phone buzzes. A bank notification: "Transfer of 600,000 yuan approved."

Her hand begins to tremble holding the phone. She looks at the empty bed.

BACK TO:

INT. FUNERAL PARLOR ENTRANCE - DAY

ZHOU XIAOLIN's knuckles whiten around the urn.

ZHOU XIAOLIN (V.O.)
He sold our past to buy her future. Then he sold our mother's future to pay for her past. The price was the same. The math was perfect. The tragedy was simple.

title: My Dad is the God of War
description: A legendary military commander must choose between his duty to the nation and his family when enemies attack while his wife is dying in the hospital.
context:
Title: My Dad is the God of War
Description: A legendary military commander must choose between his duty to the nation and his family when enemies attack while his wife is dying in the hospital.

EXT. MANOR ENTRANCE - DAY

Rain pours down. A black Maybach speeds in, drifting to a stop on the wet pavement.

A formation of BODYGUARDS in black tactical gear stands at attention, umbrellas forming a silent corridor.

The DRIVER emerges and opens the rear door.

CHEN PING'AN steps out, civilian clothes beneath an open coat. He moves with unnatural stillness.

INT. BUILDING LOBBY - DAY

CHEN PING'AN enters, water dripping from his coat. The bodyguards remain outside.

TAI SUI waits near the elevator, holding a medical file.

TAI SUI
The specialist landed ten minutes ago.

CHEN PING'AN
(taking the file)
How long have you known?

TAI SUI
Three weeks. She made us promise not to tell you. The border situation...

CHEN PING'AN
I retire tomorrow. Officially.

TAI SUI
The Heaven-Supporting Hall doesn't have a retirement plan.

CHEN PING'AN
(wearily)
Find one.

A MESSENGER stumbles through the entrance, blood soaking through his shirt. He collapses against the security desk.

MESSENGER
The Ten have breached the capital shield. They're at the Gate.

CHEN PING'AN's phone rings. The screen shows: LANLAN - HOSPITAL.

INT. HOSPITAL - DAY

NURSES wheel QING HE down a corridor, CHEN LAN running alongside, holding her mother's hand.

Heart monitors scream. QING HE's fingers twitch.

QING HE
(struggling)
Don't... blame him...

CHEN LAN
(into phone)
Dad? It's Mom. You need to—
continuation:
INT. BUILDING LOBBY - DAY

CHEN PING'AN watches the messenger's blood pool on the marble floor. He answers.

CHEN PING'AN
(into phone)
Lanlan.

MESSENGER
(kneeling)
The President's protection detail is down. The city will fall in hours.

CHEN PING'AN
(quietly)
I know. I'm sorry.

CHEN LAN (V.O.)
(distant, hollow)
She's asking for you.

CHEN PING'AN looks at the medical file in his hand. At the messenger's blood. At Tai Sui's face.

CHEN PING'AN
(into phone)
Tell her I'll be there in twenty minutes.

He hangs up. Turns to Tai Sui.

CHEN PING'AN
The Gate is fifteen minutes away.

TAI SUI
Sir, you can't—

CHEN PING'AN
(handing him the file)
If I'm not at the hospital in thirty, give her this. Tell her I read every page.

EXT. BATTLEFIELD - NIGHT

A crater in the city's financial district. Buildings sag like melted candles. At the center, CHEN PING'AN stands in ceremonial armor, etched patterns glowing faintly against the darkness.

The TEN surround him. Not soldiers. Something else. Their shadows move wrong.

CHEN PING'AN fights with economical violence. Each movement ends one of them. He takes wounds that would kill a normal man.

Last enemy down, he kneels, armor flickering, failing.

CHEN PING'AN
(barely a whisper)
Twenty minutes...

INT. HOSPITAL CORRIDOR - DAY

CHEN LAN sits outside the operating room, clutching her mother's wedding ring.

DOCTOR emerges, pulling off surgical gloves. The look says everything.

DOCTOR
My condolences. Four minutes ago.

CHEN LAN
(numb)
Thank you.

She stares at the ring. Doesn't cry. Not yet.

INT. HOSPITAL CORRIDOR - MOMENTS LATER

CHEN PING'AN limps into the corridor, coat soaked with blood. He sees his daughter. The ring.

CHEN PING'AN
Lanlan...

CHEN LAN stands. Her face is blank.

CHEN LAN
She waited. Kept asking if you were parking the car.

CHEN PING'AN takes a step forward.

CHEN LAN
(cold, precise)
You smell like gunpowder.

CHEN PING'AN stops.

CHEN LAN
(screaming, sudden)
Four minutes! You couldn't be four minutes earlier?!

She slams the ring into his chest. It drops to the floor, rolling away.

CHEN LAN
(breaking)
Four minutes, Dad.

She slides down the wall, sobbing. CHEN PING'AN stands frozen, ring at his feet, his daughter's words echoing the same measurement that decided a nation's fate.

title: Guardian's Promise - Heaven Rewards Diligence
description: A successful CEO returns to his homeland after building a business empire, only to receive a mysterious message that forces him to confront the past he left behind.
context:
Title: Guardian's Promise - Heaven Rewards Diligence
Description: A successful CEO returns to his homeland after building a business empire, only to receive a mysterious message that forces him to confront the past he left behind.

MONTAGE:

City skyline at night. News broadcast plays over glittering towers.

NEWS ANCHOR (V.O.)
Zhao Group's IPO closes at a three hundred billion valuation, making it Daxia's most valuable corporation.

INT. OFFICE - NIGHT

ZHAO QIN sits motionless in a designer chair, face half in shadow, watching the celebration on muted screens.

NEWS ANCHOR (V.O.)
Founder Zhao Qin has reportedly returned to the country, declining all interview requests.

The screens flicker through headlines: "Zhao Group's Record-Breaking IPO," "The Emperor of E-Commerce." Zhao Qin's reflection overlays the images.

END MONTAGE.

EXT. ZHAO GROUP BUILDING - DAY

A black Bentley glides to the entrance. SECRETARY WANG exits first, positioning herself by the rear door.

ZHAO QIN emerges, documents tucked under his arm, his expression a practiced mask of indifference.

ON SCREEN: ZHAO QIN - CEO, ZHAO GROUP

SECRETARY WANG
(solicitous, hovering)
The board is preparing the closing documents. They'll want your final signature today.

ZHAO QIN hands her the acquisition papers without breaking stride. They walk toward the entrance.

SECRETARY WANG
(scanning, breathless)
This gives us controlling interest in...
(glancing up)
You really did it, sir. No one in Daxia comes close now.

She holds the door. Zhao Qin pauses, looking at the building's facade as if seeing it for the first time.

ZHAO QIN
(quiet, almost to himself)
Neither did they ten years ago.

He enters.
continuation:
INT. ZHAO QIN'S OFFICE - DAY

ZHAO QIN crosses to the floor-to-ceiling window. He removes a handkerchief, polishes a smudge on the glass, then stares through it at the city below. His thumb traces circles on the windowpane—a nervous habit.

His phone BUZZES on the mahogany desk. Once. Twice.

ZHAO QIN
(finally turning)
Persistent spam.

He walks to the desk, glances at the screen. A text from an unknown number: "Sir, can you help me?"

ZHAO QIN
(scoffing)
They have my private number now?

He swipes to delete. Another message appears—an ultrasound image, timestamped. Below it: "Mom said this was you. She's gone now."

ZHAO QIN freezes. The handkerchief slips from his hand. He picks up the phone with both hands, zooming in on the image. His breathing stops.

ZHAO QIN
(whisper)
No. She wouldn't have...

The phone BUZZES again. A final message: "Please. The hospital says I have three days."

EXT. RUNDOWN CORNER - DAY

XIAO XIAO, ten years old, huddles against a concrete wall, her phone clutched to her chest. She watches people pass, their expensive shoes clicking past her worn sneakers. She doesn't look at the screen—just holds the phone like a talisman.

ON SCREEN: XIAO XIAO - XIAO YUROU'S DAUGHTER

Her finger hovers over the send button. She presses it, then quickly pockets the phone, hugging her knees.

FLASHBACK:

Ten years ago.

EXT. STREET - NIGHT

Young ZHAO QIN and XIAO YUROU share earbuds, dancing to music only they can hear, laughing. He spins her—she stumbles into him. They freeze, foreheads touching.

YOUNG ZHAO QIN
(soft)
Two years. I'll build us something real.

XIAO YUROU
(touching his face)
I don't need empires. I need you here.

EXT. STREET - CONTINUOUS

The same street. Rain hammers down. A taxi's hazards flash.

YOUNG ZHAO QIN blocks the car door, desperate.

YOUNG ZHAO QIN
Yurou, the medical trial in London—it could change everything. For us.

XIAO YUROU
(haunted, clutching her stomach)
You don't understand. Some things can't wait two years.

YOUNG ZHAO QIN
Then make me understand!

She pushes past him into the taxi. He slaps the window as it pulls away.

YOUNG ZHAO QIN
(running, voice breaking)
Yurou! You said we'd face everything together!

His foot catches a pothole. He goes down hard, palms scraping pavement. The taxi vanishes around the corner. He pushes himself up, blood mixing with rainwater, and stares at his torn hands—not with resentment, but with dawning terror that he's broken something irreparable.

INT. TAXI - NIGHT

XIAO YUROU stares at the rearview mirror, watching him fall. Her hand presses against her belly. She pulls out a Zhao Group business card—his old number circled in red. She kisses it, then tucks it into her coat pocket, close to her heart.

END FLASHBACK.

INT. ZHAO QIN'S OFFICE - DAY

ZHAO QIN stands motionless at the window, phone pressed to his forehead. Outside, rain begins to fall.

He scrolls to the ultrasound image again, his thumb hovering over the timestamp: October 12, 2014—nine months after she left.

ZHAO QIN
(quietly)
You tried to tell me.

His reflection shows a man no longer looking at a city, but at a ghost.

EXT. RUNDOWN CORNER - DAY

XIAO XIAO checks her phone. No reply. She pushes herself up, wincing—her hand goes to her side. She limps toward the hospital entrance, her small frame disappearing into the morning crowd.

Rain begins to fall on the empty corner where she sat.

title: Embracing the Moon Over Nanzhou
description: A woman with intellectual disabilities is rescued by a powerful man from her abusive family who tried to sell her.
context:
Title: Embracing the Moon Over Nanzhou
Description: A woman with intellectual disabilities is rescued by a powerful man from her abusive family who tried to sell her.

INT. BEDROOM - DAY

SONG LANYUE cowers against the headboard, blood seeping through crooked gauze. She clutches a crumpled photograph, humming a broken tune.
A FAT MAN leers down, his belt unbuckled.

FAT MAN
Your mommy already spent the money. Time to collect.

EXT. OUTSIDE VILLA - DAY

A black Bentley stops at a rusted gate. SONG'S MOTHER and SONG'S BROTHER wait.

SONG'S MOTHER
(whispering)
Another mark. Double the price.

The DRIVER opens the door. SHI NANZHOU steps out, flanked by BODYGUARDS. One carries a leather folio.

SHI NANZHOU
Song Lanyue. Where.

SONG'S BROTHER
Who're you?

SONG'S MOTHER blocks his path.

SONG'S MOTHER
Private property! Son, call the police!

A BODYGUARD crushes the Brother's phone with one hand.

SHI NANZHOU
The marriage license is legal. I'm taking my wife.

He walks past, another BODYGUARD already picking the villa lock.
continuation:
INT. BEDROOM - DAY

The FAT MAN pins SONG LANYUE's wrists. The door SPLINTERS open—kicked from its frame.
BODYGUARDS haul him screaming off the bed.
SHI NANZHOU enters, spots the photograph on the floor: his face, crudely pasted beside Song Lanyue's.

FAT MAN
My brother runs the docks!

SHI NANZHOU
(to Bodyguards)
His hands first. Then his brother's.

The Fat Man drops to his knees.

FAT MAN
Please! Her mother sold her! I have papers!

SHI NANZHOU's eyes stay on SONG LANYUE. He gestures. The BODYGUARDS gag the Fat Man and drag him out.

SHI NANZHOU approaches. SONG LANYUE swings at him. He catches her wrist, seeing the bruises.

SONG LANYUE
(whispering)
Husband... the picture promised you'd save Yueyue.

SHI NANZHOU
That picture lied.

SONG'S MOTHER and BROTHER burst in.

SONG'S MOTHER
You can't just—

She stops. A BODYGUARD holds her bamboo cane.

SHI NANZHOU
(softly, to Song Lanyue)
How?

SONG LANYUE
Stick stick. Here. Here. Here. Mommy says I'm a mistake. No food for mistakes.

SONG'S MOTHER
I made you! I can break you!

She lunges. The BODYGUARD snaps the cane.

SONG'S BROTHER
Triple price. Cash. Or we call the real cops.

SHI NANZHOU
Zhou Rui.

ZHOU RUI steps forward.

ZHOU RUI
Boss.

SHI NANZHOU
Document everything. Hundredfold.

Zhou Rui nods. The BODYGUARDS produce flex-cuffs and tablets.

SHI NANZHOU lifts SONG LANYUE. She goes stiff, then melts against his shoulder.

SONG LANYUE
Where is Yueyue's home?

SHI NANZHOU
Where mistakes don't exist.

He carries her out. Behind them, Zhou Rui activates a voice recorder.

ZHOU RUI
"Unlawful confinement. Assault. Fraud..."

The words follow them like a vow.

title: The Old Friend's Last Visit
description: A mysterious woman arrives at the Zhou family estate on a rainy day, claiming to be the only person the dying patriarch has been waiting for.
context:
Title: The Old Friend's Last Visit
Description: A mysterious woman arrives at the Zhou family estate on a rainy day, claiming to be the only person the dying patriarch has been waiting for.

EXT. ZHOU FAMILY ESTATE - DAY

A cold rain hammers the ancient Zhou family mansion gate. The plaque reading "Zhou Residence" barely gleams through the downpour.

A woman in an elegant cheongsam with a white knit cardigan, YUN SHA, holds an oil-paper umbrella and climbs the steps without hurry.

She lifts the door knocker and lets it fall. The impact echoes like a temple bell.

The door cracks open. A BUTLER in a long robe peers out.

BUTLER
The family is in mourning. We receive no one.

YUN SHA
I'm here to see Zhou Cangshan.

BUTLER
(eyes narrowing)
His name is not for strangers. Identify yourself.

Yun Sha tilts her umbrella. A jade cicada hairpin gleams at her temple.

BUTLER
(voice trembling)
That pin... please. Come in.

YUN SHA
You're wrong. Without seeing me, he won't release that last breath. If you want him to find peace, step aside.

BUTLER (V.O.)
Three months at death's door. He clings to something. Or someone...

BUTLER
(respectfully)
Miss, please enter. I'll announce you at once.

YUN SHA closes her umbrella and steps inside.
continuation:
EXT. ZHOU ESTATE COURTYARD - BAMBOO PATH - DAY

The Butler leads Yun Sha along a path where bamboo stalks bow under the rain's weight.

BUTLER
Please wait here, miss.

He hurries away, glancing back once at the hairpin.

Yun Sha stands alone in the bamboo grove. Rainwater streams off her umbrella's edge, writing temporary characters in the mud that the storm instantly erases.

YUN SHA (V.O.)
(barely a whisper)
Bean Sprout. You're going ahead after all.

INT. MASTER ZHOU'S BEDROOM - DAY

MASTER ZHOU lies in bed, eyes closed, his breathing a thin thread pulled taut.

Beside the bed, his two sons keep vigil. ZHOU YUAN holds his father's hand; ZHOU XIANG sits slumped in a corner chair.

ZHOU YUAN
(voice cracking)
Three months. Everyone's come. Everyone you've ever known.

He bows his head to his father's knuckles.

ZHOU YUAN
(whispering)
Just... stop fighting. Please.

The BUTLER rushes in, his shoes leaving wet marks on the pristine floor.

BUTLER
First Master, Second Master - a visitor.

ZHOU YUAN
(not looking up)
No more.

BUTLER
She wears the cicada. The one from the old master's sketches.

Zhou Yuan's head snaps up. In the corner, Zhou Xiang rises from his chair.

On the bed, Master Zhou's closed eyes move rapidly beneath paper-thin lids.

title: Sprinkling Sugar
description: On her wedding day, a woman awakens in a hospital to discover her fiancé is draining her blood to save his mistress—triggering fragmented memories of betrayal and awakening a vengeful resolve.
context:
Title: Sprinkling Sugar
Description: On her wedding day, a woman awakens in a hospital to discover her fiancé is draining her blood to save his mistress—triggering fragmented memories of betrayal and awakening a vengeful resolve.

INT. HOSPITAL ROOM - DAY

CLOSE ON a needle piercing skin. Dark red blood flows through a tube into a collection bag.

Widen to reveal JIANG YU (28, bridal makeup smudged) unconscious in a hospital gown, a wedding tiara still tangled in her hair. Her complexion is alarmingly pale.

NURSE (40s, harried) monitors the transfusion, her hands trembling.

The DOCTOR (50s, exhausted) bursts in, chart in hand.

DOCTOR
That's her third unit in an hour! Her pressure's already seventy over forty—

CHU KAI (32, tailored suit, flawless) stands flanked by two BODYGUARDS. His expression is ice.

CHU KAI
Then start a pressor. I need two more units before the specialist arrives.

DOCTOR
Sir, she's your fiancée. If you drain her dry, there won't be a wedding.

CHU KAI
There never will be. As long as she breathes, she'll keep Yingying alive.

Jiang Yu's eyes snap open. She gasps—a ragged, wet sound.

CHU KAI
(to Nurse)
Continue.

The Nurse shoots a desperate glance at the Doctor.

JIANG YU
(weak, disoriented)
Kai...?

CHU KAI
(Smiling placidly)
You're awake. Good. Saves me the paperwork.
continuation:
EXT. BRIDGE - NIGHT (FLASHBACK)

JIANG YU, radiant in her wedding dress, sprints through billowing smoke. Her veil tears free.

XIA YINGTONG (29, red silk dress, immaculate) emerges from the haze, holding a syringe.

XIA YINGTONG
Stop running, little nurse. You'll only die tired.

JIANG YU
(Panting)
Kai loves me.

XIA YINGTONG
He loves what you can do for him. Your rare blood type. Your medical connections. But I can give him a child.

She touches her own flat stomach.

XIA YINGTONG
Or I could have. Until you "accidentally" mixed my prenatal vitamins with oxytocin.

JIANG YU
(horrified)
I would never—I'm a doctor!

XIA YINGTONG
Exactly. Who else would know how to cause a miscarriage so perfectly?

A MAN IN BLACK steps from the shadows, baseball bat in hand.

XIA YINGTONG
Make it look like a suicide. Broken bride, jumped from the bridge.

JIANG YU
(Crying out)
Someone help—

The bat swings. Impact. Jiang Yu crumples.

FROM ABOVE: The three figures stand over her motionless body. Jiang Yu's blood begins to glow faintly—then fades.

INT. HOSPITAL ROOM - DAY (PRESENT)

Jiang Yu jolts, clutching her head. Her fingers brush raised letters on a medical bracelet: "DU LANG—VIP PATIENT."

Her vision blurs—memories overlaying like double exposure:

—A masked woman in black, her hands healing wounds with golden light.

—The same woman, cornered, swallowing a small jade pendant.

—Her own voice: "If I die, the secret dies with me."

Jiang Yu stares at her own hands. They glow faintly. The sensation is familiar. Terrifying. Right.

CHU KAI
(to Doctor)
Prep the fourth unit. Yingying's waiting.

Jiang Yu's fingers close around the IV pole. She sits up, steady despite the blood loss. Her voice is different—older, colder.

JIANG YU
You'll take no more from this body.

CHU KAI
(turning, amused)
Oh? And you'll stop me?

JIANG YU
I will. Because I'm not the woman you tried to kill.

She pulls the needle from her arm in one fluid motion. The wound seals instantly, glowing faintly.

JIANG YU
I'm the one who just remembered how to bury you.

SUPERIMPOSED TEXT: TO BE CONTINUED

title: Medical Encounter with the Ex
description: A 28-year-old teacher suffering from an embarrassing gynecological condition discovers her ex-boyfriend is now her doctor.
context:
Title: Medical Encounter with the Ex
Description: A 28-year-old teacher suffering from an embarrassing gynecological condition discovers her ex-boyfriend is now her doctor.

INT. HOSPITAL CORRIDOR - DAY

The hospital corridor is bustling with people. Doctors and nurses push gurneys past hurriedly. LIN QINGQING, wearing a patient gown, stands checking her phone.

ZIHAN'S MOTHER (V.O.)
Teacher Lin, our Zihan is so short, and you put him in the last row where he can't see the front. Zihan got a mosquito bite on his butt, why did the mosquito only bite our Zihan and not anyone else?

LIN QINGQING walks while holding her phone and medical records, talking on the phone, looking exhausted. She collides with a NURSE coming from the opposite direction. Medical records and papers scatter all over the floor.

LIN QINGQING
(flustered)
I'm sorry, I'm so sorry.

The NURSE also crouches down to help pick things up.

LIN QINGQING
I'll get them, I'll get them.

LIN QINGQING crouches down to pick up the items. Her phone on the floor rings, the screen showing "Director Zhang calling." She answers the call.

DIRECTOR (O.S.)
Lin Qingqing, what kind of homeroom teacher are you? Zihan's mother has been at-ing you in the group chat so many times, don't you know to reply?

LIN QINGQING
(holding back discomfort)
I'm sorry, Director. I'm at the hospital right now.

LIN QINGQING suddenly shows pain on her face, her hand clutching her lower abdomen.

LIN QINGQING (V.O.)
It's acting up again. So itchy. This damn gynecological condition.

NURSE
(calling out)
Lin Qingqing? Patient Lin Qingqing?

LIN QINGQING
continuation:
(quickly raising her hand)
Yes, I'm here, I'm here!

A MIDDLE-AGED WOMAN in a volunteer uniform walks over quickly and helps LIN QINGQING up.

MIDDLE-AGED WOMAN
Wait a moment.

The MIDDLE-AGED WOMAN turns to LIN QINGQING, her tone unfriendly but efficient.

MIDDLE-AGED WOMAN
Dr. Jiang's waiting. Move along.

The two crouch down together to pick up the items. Nearby, a couple in patient gowns, PASSERBY A and PASSERBY B, watch them.

PASSERBY A
(quietly)
So young to be here...

MIDDLE-AGED WOMAN
(while picking up items)
Exactly. Young people today.

The MIDDLE-AGED WOMAN looks up and glares at the couple.

MIDDLE-AGED WOMAN
Eyes on your own business.

LIN QINGQING (V.O.)
My name is Lin Qingqing. I'm 28 years old. I'm clearly an older single woman with no sex life whatsoever, yet I've contracted an embarrassing gynecological condition. My mother had no choice but to take me to see doctors everywhere.

INT. GYNECOLOGY EXAMINATION ROOM - DAY

LIN QINGQING walks into the examination room holding her medical records. A handsome male doctor in a white coat, JIANG YAN, is writing something at his desk with his head down.

The nameplate on the desk reads "Attending Physician JIANG YAN."

LIN QINGQING sees the nameplate, then looks up at the doctor. She freezes instantly, her face full of shock.

LIN QINGQING (V.O.)
Jiang Yan? The attending physician is actually my ex-boyfriend!

title: The New Benevolent Healer
description: A master with a pure yang body must find a woman with a pure yin body to break through the tenth level of martial arts and save his dying son.
context:
Title: The New Benevolent Healer
Description: A master with a pure yang body must find a woman with a pure yin body to break through the tenth level of martial arts and save his dying son.

INT. SUPREME HALL - DAY

The OLD SUPREME, white-haired and white-bearded, with an immortal demeanor, points at his disciple LU YUAN.

OLD SUPREME
You have a naturally pure yang body. Inside you is a massive energy. You only need to find a woman with a pure yin body and dual cultivate with her...

The OLD SUPREME's expression becomes slightly lecherous, then he quickly clears his throat and resumes his serious demeanor.

OLD SUPREME
(clearing throat)
Then you will surely break through to the tenth level of the Supreme Heart Method in one go.

EXT. MOUNTAIN ROAD - DAY

Several luxury sports cars race along a winding mountain road.

Inside one car, sisters LIU QING and LIU HONG shout excitedly.

LIU QING & LIU HONG
Brother Yuan, we're coming to marry you!

In another car, LIU PIAOLIN speaks disdainfully.

LIU PIAOLIN
(to herself)
As if that makes them worthy of Lu Yuan.

In a third car, FANG FEIXUE, wearing sunglasses, sneers.

FANG FEIXUE
With your old jalopies, you'll be eating my dust.

FANG FEIXUE floors the accelerator, and her sports car speeds ahead. The cars engage in a chase along the mountain road, finally stopping in front of the archway marked "Supreme Manor." Several beautifully dressed women get out of their cars one by one.
continuation:
INT. ILLUSION REALM - DAY

LU YUAN meditates in a realm of swirling energy and phantom landscapes, attempting to break through his martial arts technique, but the aura around him collapses. He suddenly opens his eyes, looking disappointed.

LU YUAN
I still haven't broken through to the tenth level of the Supreme Heart Method.

INT. SUPREME HALL - DAY

LU YUAN walks up to the OLD SUPREME, who is sweeping the floor, and bows respectfully.

LU YUAN
Master.

OLD SUPREME
Lu Yuan, you've been on the mountain for twenty years now, haven't you?

LU YUAN
Master, it will be exactly twenty years in one more month.

OLD SUPREME
I remember, when you came up the mountain, it was to cure your son's illness?

LU YUAN
Yes. My son was diagnosed with the Severed Meridian Body when he was ten years old. He can barely live past thirty. Unless I use the tenth level of the Supreme Heart Method to remake his body and reconstruct his meridians. Unfortunately, I still haven't grasped the essence of the tenth level.

OLD SUPREME
(smiling mysteriously)
Because you've been trying to force yang into yang. The tenth level requires harmony, not more power. You already have the answer I gave you.

LU YUAN
(urgently)
The pure yin body.

OLD SUPREME
(leaning closer)
Within one month. The union of opposites is the only way to save your son. Some sacrifices aren't sacrifices at all—they're merely choices we were too stubborn to make.

LU YUAN
(making a surprised sound)
Ah?

OLD SUPREME
Ah what? Your son needs a father who knows how to ask for help. Better to live with a woman's balance than die a solitary hero.

LU YUAN kneels down and kowtows heavily.

LU YUAN
Thank you, Master!

OLD SUPREME
Alright, alright, hurry down the mountain.

LU YUAN stands up but doesn't leave immediately. Instead, he looks down the mountain.

OLD SUPREME
Why aren't you leaving, boy?

The camera turns to the steps down the mountain, where LIU QING, LIU HONG, LIU PIAOLIN, FANG FEIXUE and several other women are walking up.

OLD SUPREME
(greatly alarmed, then amused)
Oh no, this boy's romantic debts have come knocking! And every one of them carries a different fate...

LU YUAN also looks at the approaching women with a stunned expression.

title: Late Summer Ripples
description: A woman discovers her fiancé is abandoning her to marry her stepsister for family inheritance, shattering their three-year relationship on what should have been their wedding day.
context:
Title: Late Summer Ripples
Description: A woman discovers her fiancé is abandoning her to marry her stepsister for family inheritance, shattering their three-year relationship on what should have been their wedding day.

INT. BRIDAL SHOP - DAY

Black curtains pull back, revealing LIN XIXIA in a gorgeous wedding dress, admiring herself in a three-way mirror. The train is enormous, covering the entire floor.

A SHOP ASSISTANT is arranging LIN XIXIA's veil.

SHOP ASSISTANT
Miss Lin, Mr. Fu treats you so well. This wedding dress is Vera Wang's latest design. Many brides in Haicheng fought to buy it but couldn't. Yet he reserved it for you a month ago.

LIN XIXIA
(smiling, fingers finding a cello charm hidden in the lining)
Yes... he remembers what I like.

FLASHBACK: Fu Zhun at her recital, his face uncomplicated and proud.

LIN XIXIA
(continuing, barely audible)
He used to listen.

INT. HALLWAY - DAY

FU ZHUN, wearing a suit, paces by a window on his phone, voice low and urgent.

FU ZHUN
(into phone)
Mom, I've exhausted every option. The board won't recognize a stepdaughter as a legitimate alliance. The bylaws are explicit.

LIN XIXIA appears at the far end of the hallway, holding two coffee cups. She slows, hearing his voice.

FU ZHUN
(continuing, voice cracking)
I know what Xixia sacrificed. But if I don't marry Lin Qiao, I lose the voting shares. I become nobody.

He turns, still unaware of her, studying his reflection.

FU ZHUN
(softly, to himself)
I can't become him. I can't be the man who gave up his birthright and regretted it.

One cup slips from LIN XIXIA's grip, SHATTERING on the marble floor.

FU ZHUN whirls around. Their eyes lock.

LIN XIXIA
(voice trembling)
The board... your inheritance. That's what this is about?

FU ZHUN
(steps forward, hands raised)
Xixia, let me explain -

LIN XIXIA
(cutting him off, tone hollow)
The canceled dinners. The late nights. You weren't working, were you?
continuation:
She sets the remaining cup down deliberately.

FU ZHUN
(struggling)
The Lin family will only vote with us if I marry into the bloodline. Qiaoqiao's talent, her connections - it's survival. Not personal.

LIN XIXIA
(tears falling but voice steady)
My audition for Berlin. The one I gave up for your company's crisis. Was that survival too?

FU ZHUN
(visibly shaken)
You made that choice. I never asked -

LIN XIXIA
(laughs, bitter)
Because you begged me to stay. And I believed we were a team.

She steps out of the wedding shoes, revealing bandaged heels.

LIN XIXIA
These shoes were never my size. None of this was.

She begins pulling off the veil with trembling hands.

FU ZHUN
(softening)
Xixia, I can fix this. A foundation, a house - don't destroy yourself.

LIN XIXIA
(rips the veil cleanly)
I'm not destroying myself. I'm shedding what was never mine.

She removes the diamond ring, holds it to the light.

LIN XIXIA
Your mother gave me this with a warning. "Remember your place." I thought she meant as your wife.

She places the ring on the windowsill.

LIN XIXIA
Thank you for finally being honest.

She walks toward the stairwell, barefoot.

FU ZHUN
(calls after her, voice breaking)
Xixia, please. If you walk away now, the families -

LIN XIXIA
(stops at the stairs, doesn't turn)
The household registration book. I'll send someone for it tomorrow.

She ascends the stairs, her silhouette small against the grand architecture.

FU ZHUN stands frozen, the ring gleaming on the windowsill, his face a mask of grief and relief.

title: The Moonlight Mirror
description: A construction worker receives his wages and attempts to use his money for his family, but faces disdain from his wife and contempt from his boss.
context:
Title: The Moonlight Mirror
Description: A construction worker receives his wages and attempts to use his money for his family, but faces disdain from his wife and contempt from his boss.

EXT. HOME HALLWAY - DAY

ON SCREEN: July 6, 2018, 8:03 AM

LIN YI (40s, calloused hands, hopeful eyes) adjusts his gray work uniform in the bathroom mirror. Behind him, his daughter's backpack hangs with a torn strap.

LIN YI
Hey. Got paid. Thought I'd get her that new bag.

MENG YUAN (30s, weary, not turning) holds their daughter's hand, staring at the floor.

MENG YUAN
Rent's due Tuesday. Electric's past due.

She meets his gaze in the mirror's reflection, her exhaustion louder than anger.

MENG YUAN
Just... bring what's left.

She leads their daughter away. Lin Yi stands alone, his reflection wavering. He lifts his sleeve—recognition, not confusion.

LIN YI
(to himself)
Can't wash it out.
continuation:
INT. UNFINISHED BUILDING - DAY

Concrete dust hangs in the air. Workers in identical uniforms wait, voices low, expectant.

ZHANG
Third time they've moved payday.

ZHAO
Long as it comes.

The FOREMAN (50s, leather jacket, clipboard) raps the table. The FEMALE ACCOUNTANT sits poised with a pen.

FOREMAN
Line up! One sound and you're back on the rubble.

Silence. They form a line.

FEMALE ACCOUNTANT
Zhang Long. 1200.

FEMALE ACCOUNTANT
Zhao Hu. 1200.

FEMALE ACCOUNTANT
Zhao Si. 1400.

FEMALE ACCOUNTANT
Lin Yi. 2500. Night shift bonus.

Lin Yi steps forward. The Foreman's hand stops him.

FOREMAN
(loud enough for all)
Working yourself dead for what? She still flinches when you touch her.

Lin Yi's signature wavers on the page. The Foreman turns to the room.

FOREMAN
Moonlighting for nothing.

INT. LOTTERY SHOP - DAY

LIN YI counts bills at the counter, fingers precise. The SHOPKEEPER waits.

SHOPKEEPER
Same numbers?

LIN YI
No.

He writes: his daughter's birth date, their apartment number, the bonus—2500.

LIN YI
(quietly)
Just these.

He holds the ticket to the light. His fingers glow red through the paper. He looks up at the shop's glass door—his reflection layered over the street, both there and not. He folds the ticket into his shirt pocket, next to his heart, and walks out.

title: The Temptation of Power: The Secretary's Glamorous Transformation
description: A devoted secretary discovers her boss has a fiancée after five years together, forcing her to confront the reality of being a substitute and make a difficult choice.
context:
Title: The Temptation of Power: The Secretary's Glamorous Transformation
Description: A devoted secretary discovers her boss has a fiancée after five years together, forcing her to confront the reality of being a substitute and make a difficult choice.

INT. BEDROOM - NIGHT

Moonlight streams through curtains. SHI SHENG stands at the window, a silk robe draped on her shoulders.

SHI SHENG (V.O.)
Five years of being his shadow. His secret. I stopped expecting the proposal. I just... forgot to expect anything.

Flashback: SHI SHENG gently removes LI JING's glasses as he sleeps. Kisses his forehead.

INT. BEDROOM - NIGHT

A phone BUZZES—not hers. SHI SHENG picks it up. The screen displays a message from "YE WANROU."

YE WANROU (V.O.)
Brother A-Jing, I miss you.

LI JING enters in a bathrobe. Freezes.

LI JING
You checked my phone.

SHI SHENG
(looking up)
Who is Ye Wanrou?

LI JING's phone RINGS. He answers, voice softening instantly.

LI JING
(on phone)
You're jet-lagged. Order room service.

He hangs up. The silence crystallizes.

LI JING
My fiancée. She returns tomorrow.

SHI SHENG
(steady)
I see.

LI JING
This ends now. Don't come back.

SHI SHENG
(hand on nightstand)
Five years. You couldn't say it until now.

LI JING
Don't make this difficult.

He turns. She watches him go, touches her reflection in the dark window.
continuation:
INT. OFFICE - DAY

SHI SHENG types at her desk—a resignation letter.

SHI SHENG (V.O.)
This job ends today too.

FEMALE COLLEAGUE
Sister Sheng, it's time. President Li is here.

SHI SHENG closes her laptop. Composed.

INT. COMPANY LOBBY - DAY

SHI SHENG stands apart from bowing employees.

LI JING enters with BODYGUARDS.

EMPLOYEES
(bowing)
Good morning, President!

LI JING stops before SHI SHENG.

LI JING
My office. Now.

SHI SHENG
Yes, President Li.

INT. LI JING'S OFFICE - DAY

LI JING reviews documents. SHI SHENG enters.

LI JING
The teal dress. Tonight's banquet with Jiang Huaichuan.

SHI SHENG
The one who harasses female employees.

LI JING
(looks up)
What?

SHI SHENG
The briefing mentioned his reputation.

LI JING
Then you know to avoid him.

SHI SHENG takes the dress.

SHI SHENG
Five years of handling your problems. Tonight, I handle mine.

At the door, she pauses.

SHI SHENG
I'm resigning after the banquet. Clean break.

She exits. LI JING stares at the closed door.

title: Photo Deletion
description: A girl discovers a mysterious instant camera at an old junk shop that can make people disappear forever, while a security guard encounters supernatural danger during his night patrol.
context:
Title: Photo Deletion
Description: A girl discovers a mysterious instant camera at an old junk shop that can make people disappear forever, while a security guard encounters supernatural danger during his night patrol.

EXT. JUNK SHOP - DAY

Rain drizzles on a narrow alley. XIAO WEN walks toward the weathered storefront of "Jizhou Junk Bookstore."

XIAO WEN enters, clutching a creased photograph.

INT. JUNK SHOP - DAY

The interior is dimly lit, filled with forgotten items. Dust motes drift in the weak light.

XIAO WEN moves through the narrow aisles. She stops at a pristine white Kodak instant camera on a shelf, oddly free of dust.

The JUNK SHOP OWNER appears behind her.

JUNK SHOP OWNER
That one doesn't just capture moments. It releases them.

XIAO WEN
(quietly)
That's exactly what I need.

She pockets the camera, her knuckles white around the photograph.
continuation:
EXT. RESIDENTIAL COMMUNITY GARDEN - NIGHT

Fog rolls through manicured hedges. SECURITY CAPTAIN and REN XIAOHAO patrol with dim flashlights.

SECURITY CAPTAIN
(reciting, voice low)
Dark moon, high wind—

REN XIAOHAO
(looking pained)
Boss, my grandma's scarier than any ghost story.

SECURITY CAPTAIN
(grinning)
Exactly. Ghosts can't fire you. I can.

A CAT YOWLS in the distance. The Captain's flashlight beam catches something—he freezes, pointing ahead. He vanishes with a soft POP, his cap left spinning on the ground.

REN XIAOHAO
Boss? This isn't—

Realization hits. Ren snatches the cap, his breath hitching.

Another cry—desperate. Ren follows the sound into the bushes, finds a black cat tangled in blue rope.

REN XIAOHAO
There you go, off you go.

He crouches, takes out a box cutter, carefully cuts the rope. The cat purrs, nuzzling his hand.

Behind him, XIAO WEN emerges, camera raised. The cat HISSES.

Just as Ren stands, the camera FLASHES. Ren stumbles back, something tightening around his neck.

A photograph ejects—his own face developing, eyes wide with terror.

title: Hai Tong
description: A kind-hearted young woman helps a lost elderly lady at a night market, unknowingly meeting the grandmother of a powerful CEO.
context:
Title: Hai Tong
Description: A kind-hearted young woman helps a lost elderly lady at a night market, unknowingly meeting the grandmother of a powerful CEO.

INT. CONVENIENCE STORE - NIGHT

HAI TONG (20s, plain clothes, baseball cap, towel around her neck) hauls the final case of bottled water through the door, her arms trembling with exhaustion. She sets it down with a soft thud, forcing a tired smile.

HAI TONG
Last case. That's ten total.

She wipes sweat from her brow, pulls out her phone. The screen shows three unread messages about overdue bills. She pockets it quickly.

HAI TONG
Five yuan, right?

The BOSS nods, scans her payment code without looking up. The transaction pings.

EXT. NIGHT MARKET - SAUSAGE STAND - NIGHT

GRANDMA ZHAN (70s, elegant coat, silver hair) watches sausages sizzle, her stomach growling audibly.

GRANDMA ZHAN
One, please.

VENDOR
Five yuan. Pay first.

GRANDMA ZHAN
My grandson will settle up. He always does.

VENDOR
(eyes narrowing)
No cash, no food. That's the rule.

GRANDMA ZHAN
I seem to have misplaced my purse...

VENDOR
(muttering)
Great. Another time-waster.

He turns his back, dismissing her. Grandma Zhan wobbles, clutching the stand for support.

HAI TONG
(O.S.)
Hey!

She catches Grandma Zhan's elbow just as she stumbles.

HAI TONG
Got you. You okay?

GRANDMA ZHAN
(studying Hai Tong's face)
You have her eyes. Same kindness.

HAI TONG
(confused)
I'm sorry?

GRANDMA ZHAN
My granddaughter-in-law. Before she... well. You remind me of her.

HAI TONG
(softening)
Oh. No, I'm just—I'm nobody.

Hai Tong glances at her phone wallpaper: a photo of her with an elderly woman.

HAI TONG
(to Vendor)
Two sausages. On my account.

VENDOR
You got an account now?

HAI TONG
(icy smile)
I do now.

She slaps a crumpled five and singles on the counter. The vendor grunts, but starts cooking.

HAI TONG
(to Grandma Zhan, gentle)
They'll be ready in a minute. No chili, right?

GRANDMA ZHAN
continuation:
How did you know?

HAI TONG
My grandmother couldn't handle spice either.

The vendor passes the sausages. Hai Tong hands them over, then hesitates. She pulls out the last of her cash—three singles.

HAI TONG
For the bus. Or... whatever you need.

GRANDMA ZHAN
I couldn't.

HAI TONG
Please. I'd want someone to help my nai nai if she were lost.

Hai Tong grabs a napkin, scribbles quickly.

HAI TONG
My number. If you get stuck again.

She presses napkin and cash into Grandma Zhan's hand.

HAI TONG
Gotta run. Last delivery.

Hai Tong sprints toward a beat-up electric scooter, hops on, and vanishes into the crowd.

Grandma Zhan watches her go, then looks at the napkin. A slow, knowing smile spreads across her face.

GRANDMA ZHAN
(whispers)
Hai Tong.

EXT. NIGHT MARKET STREET - CONTINUOUS

A black sedan with tinted windows glides to the curb. Two SECURITY GUARDS step out, efficient and calm.

SECURITY GUARD
Madam Zhan. Your grandson is concerned.

PASSERBY A
(whispering)
Is that...?

PASSERBY B
Zhan Group. Must be.

ZHAN YIN (30s, sharp suit, controlled intensity) emerges from the car, scanning the crowd with barely contained anxiety.

ZHAN YIN
Grandmother. You disappeared for two hours.

GRANDMA ZHAN
I was making a strategic investment.

ZHAN YIN
(sighs)
The doctor said—

GRANDMA ZHAN
—I'm fine. Better than fine.

She holds up the napkin like a winning lottery ticket.

GRANDMA ZHAN
I found the one.

ZHAN YIN
(pained)
We've talked about this. You can't just—

GRANDMA ZHAN
Oh, hush. She's different. I have receipts.

She waves the cash Hai Tong gave her.

GRANDMA ZHAN
Dinner tomorrow. Seven o'clock. You're driving.

She hobbles toward the car, leaving Zhan Yin staring at the napkin.

ZHAN YIN
(to himself)
Hai Tong. Jesus.

He follows, already pulling out his phone.

title: Love in the Eighties (Episode 74)
description: A middle-aged woman attends a dating show and faces ridiculous demands from male contestants, until a sincere security guard offers her genuine companionship.
context:
Title: Love in the Eighties (Episode 74)
Description: A middle-aged woman attends a dating show and faces ridiculous demands from male contestants, until a sincere security guard offers her genuine companionship.

INT. DATING SHOW STAGE - DAY

A brightly lit studio decorated with pink flowers, full of romantic atmosphere. The HOST stands at the side of the stage.

HOST
Please welcome our female guest number one, from Haicheng, forty-eight years old, Ms. Song!

Music plays. The door opens. In the bright light, SONG HAILIAN (48, elegant but visibly nervous) slowly walks to center stage. Three male contestants sit below: LI DASHENG (overdressed, slicked hair), FANG ZHIHAO (tank top, excessive jewelry), and NING JIANYE (crisp suit, practiced smile).

LI DASHENG stands and presses his light-off button.

LI DASHENG
(checking his watch)
Forty-eight? Look, I'm sure you're lovely, but I'm looking for someone who can give me a family. You know, before time runs out.

SONG HAILIAN
(steadying herself)
According to your profile, you're fifty-two. Does your timer have different rules?

LI DASHENG
(smoothing his collar)
Men mature later. It's biology. I'm just being practical.

He sits. FANG ZHIHAO stands and turns his light off.

FANG ZHIHAO
Kids? Already got six. Two different mamas. What I need is a woman who knows how to run a household. You cook, clean, handle the chaos while I build my empire.

SONG HAILIAN
So you're advertising for unpaid staff?

FANG ZHIHAO
(smirking)
Marriage is a partnership. I bring the vision, you bring the order. That's the deal.

He sits. NING JIANYE rises, finger hovering over his button.

NING JIANYE
You misunderstand, gentlemen. A woman of this caliber isn't for conventional needs. My foundation supports artists. You'd be perfect as a hostess for our gatherings. A muse, if you will. My wife understands this arrangement.

SONG HAILIAN
(frost forming in her voice)
An arrangement where I'm decorative and your wife tolerates it? How modern of you.

NING JIANYE
(offended, presses button)
High standards for someone taking such a public risk at your age.
continuation:
INT. COMPANY BUILDING - DAY

ZHAO GUOQIANG (late 50s, security uniform fitting him like a second skin) walks briskly through a marble lobby. Assistant WEN HUI (30s, anxious) trails behind.

WEN HUI
(handing over a radio)
The production team confirmed everything. You're listed as emergency security detail, but sir, this is highly irregular.

ZHAO GUOQIANG
(adjusting his belt)
What's irregular is using wealth as a wall instead of a door. I've read her file. She built her business from nothing after her husband left. She'll spot a fraud in seconds.

WEN HUI
But appearing as a security guard?

ZHAO GUOQIANG
What I am isn't what I wear. If she can't see that, we're both wasting time.

He exits. Wen Hui watches, troubled.

INT. DATING SHOW STAGE - DAY

SONG HAILIAN stands alone under harsh lights, three darkened screens behind her.

SONG HAILIAN (V.O.)
Life partner. The words sound heavier each time I hear them. Not a business merger. Not a caretaker. Just... someone to witness your life while you witness theirs.

A door stage-left cracks open. ZHAO GUOQIANG slips in, surveys the setup, then moves with quiet purpose toward the fourth contestant station.

SONG HAILIAN
(turning to the host)
May I say something?

HOST
Of course.

SONG HAILIAN
(to the darkened screens)
I'm not here to audition for anyone's second act. I built my own stage. I just hoped—

ZHAO GUOQIANG
(from the fourth station, not on camera yet)
Then maybe stop auditioning.

SONG HAILIAN
(startled, searching for the voice)

ZHAO GUOQIANG
(emerging, uniform straight, cap in hand)
Those three turned off their lights. My station was dark before I arrived. Clean slate.

He walks to center stage, addressing the host but looking at her.

ZHAO GUOQIANG
Zhao Guoqiang. Work security for the studio complex. Fifty-six. My daughter says I need to stop talking to the television and talk to real people.

(beat)

I clock in, I do my rounds, I go home to an empty apartment. You're right—building something alone means you get tired of being the only one who knows it exists.

(to Song)
I don't need an heir or a housekeeper or a gallery piece. I need someone who'll ask how my day was and actually want to hear the answer. Maybe we could start with coffee and see if we want to witness each other's lives.

SONG HAILIAN
studies him—the wear in his uniform, the steadiness in his eyes, the absence of performance.

SONG HAILIAN
Coffee sounds like a beginning.

INT. PHOTO STUDIO - DAY

ZHAO GUOQIANG and SONG HAILIAN sit side by side in white shirts, facing the camera. Her hand rests gently on his. A simple gold band catches the light on her finger.

FLASH.

In the frozen moment, they aren't looking at the camera. They're looking at each other, smiling at some private joke.

FADE OUT.

title: Hunting You
description: A mysterious woman in a black mask observes a nightclub before targeting Jin Xuan, a young man with a mysterious seven-year gap in his past, at a masquerade party.
context:
Title: Hunting You
Description: A mysterious woman in a black mask observes a nightclub before targeting Jin Xuan, a young man with a mysterious seven-year gap in his past, at a masquerade party.

INT. NIGHTCLUB - NIGHT

Neon veins pulse through the darkened space. Bodies move like a single organism to the thundering bass. At the VIP balcony, YAN LINGXI sits untouched champagne before her. The ornate black mask obscures her expression, but her eyes track every entrance below with predatory precision.

EXT. STREET - NIGHT

YAN LINGXI leans against a white sedan, checking her phone. XIE YOU approaches in a burgundy suit, extending a sealed folder.

XIE YOU
Jin Xuan's file. Heaven on Earth, masquerade tonight. One night only.

YAN LINGXI
(flicks it open, stills)
Fifteen to twenty-two. Seven years, erased.

XIE YOU
Someone buried him deep after his brother died. Be careful.

She snaps the folder shut, her knuckles white.

INT. NIGHTCLUB - NIGHT

A Venetian-style masquerade. Gold and crimson masks glimmer in candlelight. YAN LINGXI moves through the crowd like a shadow.

At the center, JIN XUAN holds court. His white mask is a stark contrast to his deliberate, performative charm. He raises his crystal tumbler.

JIN XUAN
To returning ghosts. May they stay buried.

The crowd laughs, uneasy. He scans the room while sipping, his smile never reaching his eyes.

YAN LINGXI watches from behind a marble pillar. She catches his reflection in a gilded mirror—just as his gaze flicks toward her. The music warps, distorts. For a heartbeat, their eyes lock.
continuation:
INT. NIGHTCLUB WASHROOM - NIGHT

JIN XUAN splashes water on his face, then freezes. On the marble counter lies a single playing card—the King of Spades, with "J.X." written in red ink. He pockets it, movements sharp. Behind him, a stall door clicks shut. He follows.

INT. WASHROOM STALL - NIGHT

YAN LINGXI waits, perched on the edge of the toilet tank. JIN XUAN enters, and she kicks the door closed. They stand chest-to-chest. She removes his mask, then her own. Recognition flickers in his eyes.

JIN XUAN
(quietly dangerous)
Breadcrumbs are a bold move.

YAN LINGXI
You followed. What does that make you?

She traces his jawline with one finger. His pulse hammers in his throat.

JIN XUAN
Curious. Seven years is a long time to be invisible.

YAN LINGXI
Not invisible. Sleeping. Now you're awake.

The door bangs open. DRUNKEN LAUGHTER echoes. Yan Lingxi pushes Jin Xuan back, straddles his lap on the closed toilet seat, her gown pooling around them. She presses a finger to his lips.

DRUNK MAN (O.S.)
Little dove?

JIN XUAN
(voice like ice)
Wrong stall.

Footsteps retreat. Yan Lingxi's finger stays on his lips. He's close enough to count her eyelashes.

JIN XUAN
(whisper)
Who sent you?

She answers with a kiss—brief, electric. When she pulls back, her eyes hold something like regret.

YAN LINGXI
Your past.

The door flies open. YU SIWAN stands there, white fur coat over a sequined gown, her mask dangling. Her face drains of color.

YU SIWAN
(voice breaking)
Xuan... you promised--

JIN XUAN
(turning, still holding Yan Lingxi)
Not here, Siwan.

YU SIWAN
(shaking, tears starting)
She's back. The one from the journal.

The script ends with Yan Lingxi's eyes widening—surprised. Jin Xuan's grip tightens on her waist, protective or possessive, as his face goes pale.

title: Reborn as a Demon Lord, I Only Seek Death
description: A soul transmigrates into the body of a fearsome demon lord during a wedding raid, completely changing the course of events.
context:
Title: Reborn as a Demon Lord, I Only Seek Death
Description: A soul transmigrates into the body of a fearsome demon lord during a wedding raid, completely changing the course of events.

INT. JADE POOL PALACE - DAY

A GRAND HALL DRAPED IN CRIMSON SILK FOR THE WEDDING CEREMONY. THE SAINTESS, 19, POISED IN ELABORATE RED ROBES, IS BEING ATTENDED BY HER MAIDENS. ELDER TEA, 60S, SHARP-EYED, STANDS NEARBY.

ELDER TEA
The Saintess looks radiant. That Dragon Palace brat doesn't know how fortunate he is.

SAINTESS
Elder Tea, please. Today is about alliance, not sentiment.

ELDER TEA
I'll still report your blushing.

A LOW, MENACING LAUGH REVERBERATES THROUGH THE HALL, SHAKING THE LANTERNS.

THE SAINTESS'S EYES NARROW. SHE EXTENDS HER HAND; A PURPLE CRYSTAL SWORD MATERIALIZES.

SAINTESS
(Intensely)
That energy... everyone, with me!

SHE SPRINTS FOR THE EXIT, ATTENDANTS FOLLOWING.

EXT. JADE POOL PALACE - DAY

THE SAINTESS AND HER ATTENDANTS BURST ONTO THE PALACE STEPS. ABOVE, QI YE, 30S, FLOATS IN OBSIDIAN ARMOR WREATED IN CRACKLING SHADOW-FLAMES.

SAINTESS
Identify yourself!

QI YE
(Smiling coldly)
Qi Ye, sovereign of the Demon Sect. I've come to claim what's mine.

ELDER TEA
(Whispering)
Saintess... it's the Butcher of Qingyun.

SAINTESS
I'm pledged to Long Aotian. Your claim is dust, demon.

SHE LAUNCHES UPWARD, SWORD ARCING WITH VIOLET LIGHT. QI YE DEFLECTS WITH A FLICK OF HIS WRIST. THE SAINTESS CRASHES ONTO THE RED CARPET, BLOOD STAINING HER VEIL.

ELDER TEA
Saintess!

QI YE DESCENDS SLOWLY.

QI YE
Dragon Palace is nothing. Kneel and live as my consort, or perish with your pride.

ELDER TEA
His cultivation... it's at the Void Shattering realm!

THE SAINTESS STAGGERS TO HER FEET, WIPES BLOOD FROM HER LIPS.

SAINTESS
(To attendants)
The Spring Water Formation. Target his meridians.

ELDER TEA
(Understanding)
Yes!

THE ATTENDANTS FORM A CIRCLE, PINK ENERGY WEAVING BETWEEN THEIR PALMS.
continuation:
INT. ILLUSORY REALM - DAY

QI YE STANDS IN A STEAMING HOT SPRING. THE SAINTESS AND ATTENDANTS MATERIALIZE THROUGH THE MIST, THEIR SILK CLINGING.

QI YE
(Amused)
An illusion? How quaint.

SAINTESS
(Breathily)
Lord Qi Ye, why conquer when you could indulge? Stay. Rule beside me.

HER HAND SLIDES BENEATH THE WATER, EMERGING WITH A GLOWING PURPLE DAGGER.

SAINTESS
Demon, you're mine!

SHE STRIKES. HE CATCHES HER WRIST EFFORTLESSLY.

QI YE
Dragon Palace's little toothpick? Even the Nine Heavens Thunder couldn't scratch this vessel. Break.

HE RELEASES A PULSE OF PURE DEMONIC ESSENCE. THE REALM SHATTERS LIKE GLASS.

EXT. JADE POOL PALACE - DAY

THE ATTENDANTS ARE HURLED BACKWARD, SCREAMING. QI YE RISES, GATHERING A BLUE ENERGY SPIRAL IN HIS PALM.

QI YE
Now, kneel.

THE SAINTESS CLASPS HER HANDS. THE FORMATION'S PINK ENERGY SURGES UPWARD, COLLIDING WITH QI YE'S ATTACK. THE ENERGIES CREATE A FEEDBACK LOOP.

DIVINE TRIBULATION CLOUDS FORM INSTANTLY IN THE SKY.

A BOLT OF HEAVENLY LIGHTNING STRIKES THE ENERGY NEXUS, ELECTROCUTING BOTH QI YE AND THE SAINTESS. THEY PLUMMET.

QI YE LANDS ACROSS THE UNCONSCIOUS SAINTESS. SMOKE RISES FROM HIS ARMOR.

AFTER A MOMENT, QI YE'S EYES SNAP OPEN. THE DARKNESS IN THEM IS GONE.

QI YE
(Confused)
Hospital...? No, this is...

HE TOUCHES HER FACE GENTLY.

QI YE
(Wondering)
Are you... real?

HE PINCHES HER CHEEK. HER EYES FLUTTER OPEN.

QI YE
(Grinning with relief)
You're okay!

THEY LOCK EYES. RECOGNITION AND HORROR HIT SIMULTANEOUSLY. THEY SCREAM IN UNISON.

LIGHT FLASHES, ENDING THE SCENE.

title: Eternal Emperor and Timeless Minister - Episode 1
description: A modern warehouse manager transmigrates into a minor county magistrate and has been living a laid-back life for ten years, but boredom leads him to make unusual reforms.
context:
Title: Eternal Emperor and Timeless Minister - Episode 1
Description: A modern warehouse manager transmigrates into a minor county magistrate and has been living a laid-back life for ten years, but boredom leads him to make unusual reforms.

INT. COUNTY OFFICE BACK HALL - DAY

The hall pulses with colored lanterns and a rotating mirror ball. Silken drapes cascade from rafters. Red petals drift across polished floorboards.

YUN'ER, in flowing silks, performs a mesmerizing dance that blends classical grace with modern rhythm, her sleeves painting patterns in the air.

YOUNG MASTER, in refined scholar's robes with dark lenses, watches intently from a low couch, tapping his fingers to the beat.

Yun'er's dance reaches a crescendo, then she flows into a graceful bow.

YUN'ER
(still breathless)
Well? Did my "fiscal revenue stimulation dance" meet the Young Master's approval?

YOUNG MASTER
(removing his lenses)
You're getting too good at this. Soon I'll need to institute a "too beautiful" tax just to keep the treasury balanced.

YUN'ER
(leaning in teasingly)
And when will you tax yourself for being too clever by half?

YOUNG MASTER
(grinning)
The day you stop pointing out my contradictions.

YOUNG MASTER (V.O.)
Ten years. Ten years since a warehouse inventory sheet became my life. I tried to be content with calligraphy and tea, but innovation is a habit that dies hard. So I've been... renovating. Quietly.

MA DE, a stout constable with an official's badge askew, bursts through the door.

MA DE
Young Master! Two merchants from the capital! They carry imperial travel permits!

YOUNG MASTER
And?

MA DE
(hesitant)
The old custom... the "road maintenance contribution"? Shall I... invite them to our "reception"?

YOUNG MASTER
(eyes narrowing)
Ma De, how long have we run a clean office here?

MA DE
(defensive)
Two years, but Young Master, these are high-born ladies! The contribution could fund the new irrigation--

YOUNG MASTER
The irrigation system is funded by the theater profits. As I've explained. Twelve times.

MA DE
But... they're very beautiful high-born ladies.

YOUNG MASTER
(standing abruptly)
Beautiful? Imperial permits? Do you want to bring the entire bureaucracy down on us?

MA DE
(confused)
So... no?

YOUNG MASTER
(throwing up his hands)
Bring them in properly! Official escort, proper lodging, no "contributions"! And Ma De-- try to remember we're civil servants, not theater villains.

MA DE
(perking up)
The theater needs villains! I could audition--

YOUNG MASTER
Get out.

Ma De exits hastily.
continuation:
EXT. YUNBIAN COUNTY OUTSKIRTS ROAD - DAY

A carriage with plain wooden panels rumbles along a well-maintained road. Drainage ditches line either side, engineered with precision.

INT. INSIDE CARRIAGE - DAY

HER MAJESTY, early thirties, wears simple brocade. Her posture is rigid with contained tension. FU RONG, her guard, watches the landscape.

FU RONG
Your Majesty, the reports can't be right. This district was supposed to be impoverished.

HER MAJESTY
(fingering a tax scroll)
Year after year, Yunbian pays its levies early. While the Three Rivers region floods and starves.

FU RONG
A fluke?

HER MAJESTY
Four consecutive years? That's not luck. That's a question I've come to answer.

FU RONG
Prime Minister Lin will notice your absence.

HER MAJESTY
Let him. He thinks me helpless. A woman playing at emperor.

HER MAJESTY (V.O.)
Father's throne was never meant for me. But I will not be the footnote in a man's history.

EXT. YUNBIAN COUNTY OUTSKIRTS ROAD - DAY

A mechanical ROAR echoes. A steam-powered tractor, brass and wood, belches white vapor as it passes the carriage, pulling three cargo carts.

INT. INSIDE CARRIAGE - DAY

Fu Rong's eyes widen.

FU RONG
Your Majesty! That contraption--

HER MAJESTY
(staring, a slow smile forming)
Yes. That is definitely a question worth answering.

ON SCREEN: TO BE CONTINUED

title: Mr. Gong, Please Behave Yourself
description: A tense confrontation between a man and a woman escalates into a dangerous negotiation.
context:
Title: Mr. Gong, Please Behave Yourself
Description: A tense confrontation between a man and a woman escalates into a dangerous negotiation.

INT. PRIVATE LOUNGE - NIGHT

GONG SHIXIONG corners TANG XUE against the wall. TANG XUE's stance is defensive but measured.

TANG XUE
We had an agreement.

GONG SHIXIONG
I'm revising it.

TANG XUE
My services are specialized. And costly.

GONG SHIXIONG
Cost is relative to satisfaction.

GONG SHIXIONG tries to close the gap. TANG XUE tracks his movement, poised.

GONG SHIXIONG
That defiance will cost you.

TANG XUE
I'm... particular about my clients. Perhaps I should withdraw.

TANG XUE tries to create space, but GONG SHIXIONG blocks her.
continuation:
GONG SHIXIONG
You don't get to bait and switch.

TANG XUE
Let me go!

GONG SHIXIONG
Everyone has their breaking point. Name yours.

TANG XUE
Two million. Verifiable transfer.

GONG SHIXIONG
(chuckling)
Done.

GONG SHIXIONG taps his phone. TANG XUE's hand finds the ashtray.

TANG XUE (V.O.)
Wire transfer initiated. Threat neutralization ready.

She strikes. He drops.

TANG XUE checks his pulse, then photographs the transaction screen.

TANG XUE
Professional consultation concluded. Proceeding to phase two.

ON SCREEN: TO BE CONTINUED

title: Rebirth of the Fat Wife: The Regent's Long Road to Win Her Back
description: A modern surgeon is betrayed by her boyfriend and stepsister, dies in a car accident, and is reborn into the body of an overweight ancient noblewoman who was left for dead.
context:
Title: Rebirth of the Fat Wife: The Regent's Long Road to Win Her Back
Description: A modern surgeon is betrayed by her boyfriend and stepsister, dies in a car accident, and is reborn into the body of an overweight ancient noblewoman who was left for dead.

INT. LUXURY CAR - NIGHT

XIAO CHURAN and XIA ROU'ER are intimate in the back seat, their clothes disheveled.

XIA ROU'ER (V.O.)
(moaning)
Churan...

EXT. PARKING LOT - NIGHT

A black luxury car is parked in a secluded spot, the vehicle swaying slightly.

XIA NANWEI, wearing a white lab coat and holding her phone out to livestream, walks toward the luxury car with an expressionless face.

XIA NANWEI
(broadcasting)
Third time this month. Same parking lot. Let's see if he notices his location is still shared.

She taps sharply on the tinted window with her keys. Several passersby are drawn over, taking out their phones to record.

INT. LUXURY CAR - NIGHT

The two people inside are startled by the sound and hastily straighten their clothes.

XIA ROU'ER
(hissing)
Someone's outside!

XIAO CHURAN
Shit.

XIA NANWEI suddenly yanks the car door open.

EXT. PARKING LOT - NIGHT

PASSERBY A
Look at this!

XIAO CHURAN
(shocked)
Nanwei? What are you doing?

XIA NANWEI
(to the phone)
Catching my boyfriend cheating. For the third time.

XIAO CHURAN awkwardly gets out of the car.

XIA ROU'ER
(leaning out)
Sister, please! This isn't—

XIAO CHURAN
(pointing at XIA NANWEI)
If anyone's to blame, it's you for refusing to open your legs!

XIA NANWEI
(furious)
You—

XIA ROU'ER
(getting out, clinging to XIAO CHURAN)
Sister, don't blame him! You drove him away!

XIA NANWEI
(to XIA ROU'ER)
Xia Rou'er. My own stepsister.
continuation:
XIA NANWEI steps forward and slaps XIA ROU'ER hard across the face.

XIA ROU'ER
(covering her face)
Xiao Churan!

XIA NANWEI
(to XIAO CHURAN)
You cheated on me with my family. Have you no shame?

XIAO CHURAN
You're the one who doesn't know what's good for you!

XIAO CHURAN forcefully pushes XIA NANWEI away. XIA NANWEI stumbles backward onto the road.

A car speeds toward her. Tires SCREECH. The impact is brutal and immediate.

XIA NANWEI lies in a pool of blood, barely alive. Her phone lies nearby, stream still live.

XIA NANWEI (V.O.)
(weak)
Every incision I ever made... every life I saved...

Her vision blurs. Phone screen shows scrolling comments: "CALL 911" "SHE'S NOT MOVING"

XIA NANWEI (V.O.)
(fierce)
If I die... everything goes to charity. Not them. Never them.

Her hand goes limp. A pulse of golden light escapes her fingertips and shoots toward the sky.

EXT. MASS GRAVE - NIGHT

A fat woman in ancient costume (ELDEST MISS) lies motionless on the ground.

LU LUO and two SERVANTS surround her.

SECOND MISS'S MAID
(checking her breath)
She's not breathing. She's dead.

SERVANT A
Second Miss said ruin her virtue, not... this.

SERVANT B
She ran. Tripped. The fall—

LU LUO
(quietly)
She's dead. That's what matters.

LU LUO picks up a thick wooden stick, preparing to finish the job.

LU LUO
(whispering)
Forgive me, Eldest Miss. You were just... in the way.

LU LUO raises the stick high. Suddenly, ELDEST MISS'S hand shoots up and grabs it.

ELDEST MISS (XIA NANWEI) gasps, eyes snapping open. Ancient memories flood her mind—insults, betrayal, forced marriage.

XIA NANWEI
(disoriented)
Where am I?

XIA NANWEI (V.O.)
Ancient costume? A different body? I've traveled through time...

She meets LU LUO's terrified gaze and smiles.

XIA NANWEI (V.O.)
Good. Let them be afraid.

title: Flowers Bloom in an Empty Hall
description: Qin Sang is brought back to the Prime Minister's Manor on the day Qin Yao dies. For three years, Qin Yao's death anniversary becomes Qin Sang's day of suffering.
context:
Title: Flowers Bloom in an Empty Hall
Description: Qin Sang is brought back to the Prime Minister's Manor on the day Qin Yao dies. For three years, Qin Yao's death anniversary becomes Qin Sang's day of suffering.

EXT. PRIME MINISTER'S MANOR - NIGHT

Snowflakes fall. QIN SANG dances with a red staff in the snow, her movements weakening. Blood stains the snow.

QIN SANG (V.O.)
The day I was brought back to the Prime Minister's Manor, Qin Yao died. For the next three years, her death anniversary became my day of suffering.

INT. BUDDHIST HALL - DAY

MADAM QIN kneels before the Buddha statue, praying. A SNAKE strikes her wrist. She collapses.

QIN SANG, wearing a pink dress, enters with offering incense. She rushes to MADAM QIN.

QIN SANG
(anxiously)
Madam! Madam!

QIN SANG kneels down to check and discovers bite marks on MADAM QIN's wrist.

QIN SANG
It's snake venom! I must remove it.

QIN SANG tears a strip from her own sleeve, binding it tightly above the wound. She uses her mouth to suck the wound, spitting black blood on the ground. After repeating this, QIN SANG's face turns pale and she collapses, poisoned.

QIN YAO walks in. She sees the scene and her eyes widen.

QIN YAO
(coldly)
The snake I released... bit Mother instead?

MADAM QIN slowly regains consciousness.

MADAM QIN
(weakly)
Ah Yao...

QIN YAO immediately changes her expression and steps forward to support MADAM QIN.

QIN YAO
(with concern)
Mother, are you alright?

MADAM QIN
Did you remove the snake venom?

QIN YAO
(without hesitation)
Yes, I removed it for you. Let's leave quickly.

MADAM QIN sees QIN SANG unconscious on the ground.

MADAM QIN
Who is she?

QIN YAO
A beggar who snuck in. Don't worry about her, let's go.

MADAM QIN struggles to stand up and notices the heart-shaped birthmark on QIN SANG's neck. She is shocked.

MADAM QIN
This birthmark... she is my biological daughter!

QIN YAO's expression changes.

QIN YAO (V.O.)
My own trap has caught me instead. Don't blame me for eliminating you completely.
continuation:
INT. ROOM - DAY

QIN SANG lies on the bed, still unconscious. MADAM QIN sits by the bedside, her face full of affection.

MADAM QIN
My daughter, you've finally woken up. This is wonderful.

QIN SANG slowly opens her eyes.

QIN SANG
(confused)
Daughter?

MADAM QIN
Heaven has shown mercy. I was bitten by a venomous snake, but fortunately Ah Yao removed the poison for me, and I found you. I'm so happy.

QIN SANG
(excited)
The one who removed the snake venom for you was clearly me, how could it be her?

QIN YAO stands to the side, feigning grievance.

QIN YAO
What?

MADAM QIN
(puzzled)
What is going on here?

QIN YAO
(crying)
Sister just returned and already wants to compete for favor and steal credit from me? It seems this manor can no longer accommodate me, this imposter. I might as well die!

MADAM QIN
(hastily)
Wait, Ah Yao!

QIN SANG tries to get up to explain, but her body is powerless.

QIN SANG
No, I must make things clear to them.

EXT. COURTYARD - DAY

QIN SANG chases after them and kneels on the ground.

QIN SANG
Mother, I'm not lying. It was truly me who saved you!

MADAM QIN turns around and angrily slaps QIN SANG.

MADAM QIN
Don't call me mother! If it weren't for you, Ah Yao wouldn't have died!

QIN SANG
(shocked)
What? Qin Yao is dead?

QIN YU steps forward and throws a blood letter in front of QIN SANG.

QIN YU
It's all because of you that Ah Yao drowned herself in the lake! I'll kill you right now!

QIN YU draws his sword and thrusts it at QIN SANG.

PRIME MINISTER QIN
Stop!

PRIME MINISTER QIN walks over.

PRIME MINISTER QIN
Ah Yao is already dead, and the marriage arrangement with Pei Heng still needs her to substitute. She cannot die.

MADAM QIN
(crying)
As soon as you returned, you stole Ah Yao's credit and caused her death. Now her body is barely cold and you want to steal her fiancé. How can you be so vicious!

QIN YU
Don't think marrying Pei Heng will bring you good days. I won't let you off!

QIN YU strikes QIN SANG with the sword hilt. QIN SANG coughs blood and falls to the ground.

QIN SANG (V.O.)
When Qin Yao was alive, she stole everything from me. After her death, I became the one blamed for killing her.

EXT. SNOWY GROUND - NIGHT

QIN SANG lies in the snow, recalling the scene from three years ago.

QIN SANG (V.O.)
Three years. Not a single person remembers that today is my birthday. Or perhaps, it's my death day.

INT. BUDDHIST HALL - FLASHBACK

QIN SANG lies on the ground. The Buddha statue emits golden light.

BUDDHA (V.O.)
You were poisoned by snake venom while saving someone. Your death is near. This True Heart Spell can temporarily delay the poison. Three years from today, if you receive a sincere blessing from a loved one, the death sentence can be lifted.

EXT. SNOWY GROUND - NIGHT

The snow falls heavier. QIN SANG lies on the ground, her breath weakening.

VOICE (O.S.)
Close the gates at noon!

QIN SANG
(weakly)
The hour of midnight is approaching. There's no time left.

QIN SANG crawls with difficulty through the snow and finally collapses, unconscious. In the distance, QIN YU, MADAM QIN, and others run toward her with panicked expressions.

QIN SANG
(whisper)
Save me, save me.

QIN SANG's hand drops limply.

title: Adorable Helpers: A Wedding at Fifty
description: A real estate CEO searches for a cure for his paralyzed grandson, unaware that the children are secretly matchmaking him with a skilled doctor they encountered on the street.
context:
Title: Adorable Helpers: A Wedding at Fifty
Description: A real estate CEO searches for a cure for his paralyzed grandson, unaware that the children are secretly matchmaking him with a skilled doctor they encountered on the street.

INT. LUXURY CAR - DAY

A black luxury car drives along a tree-lined road.

NARRATOR (V.O.)
Three years, seventeen specialists, and Zhou Zhenhua's hope has become a ritual.

Inside, XIANG DONG drives. ZHOU ZHENHUA sits in back, rubbing a child's crayon drawing.

XIANG DONG
Guangzhou specialist canceled. Said Dabao's case was "outside intervention range."

ZHOU ZHENHUA
(folds the drawing)
He stopped asking when he'll walk. Now he asks if I'll be too tired to carry him.

INT. CHILDREN'S ROOM - DAY

DABAO sits in his wheelchair by the ground-floor window, tablet showing a map. ERBAO studies a notebook.

DABAO
She always walks this way after Thursday clinic. Grandpa's meetings end at four.

ERBAO
One chance.

DABAO
Then we can't mess it up.

EXT. STREET - DAY

DR. JIANG YUEQIN walks briskly, medical bag in hand. She pauses to rub her ankle—an old injury—then continues.

INT. CHILDREN'S ROOM - DAY

DABAO and ERBAO each hold their phones, tracking a location dot.
continuation:
INT. LUXURY CAR - DAY

ZHOU ZHENHUA's phone receives a WeChat notification. He opens a voice message.

MOM (O.S.)
(voice message)
Your matchmaker has three women for Sunday. Unless you've found someone yourself?

ZHOU ZHENHUA
(types reply)
I'll handle it.

INT. CHILDREN'S ROOM - DAY

DABAO sees his grandfather's reply. ERBAO gives him a thumbs up, then drops a water balloon from the windowsill.

EXT. STREET - DAY

XIANG DONG's car swerves to avoid the burst balloon, hitting a deep pothole. Muddy water splashes JIANG YUEQIN's trousers.

JIANG YUEQIN
Stops, examines the damage.

The car stops. XIANG DONG rushes out.

XIANG DONG
I'm so sorry—are you hurt?

JIANG YUEQIN
(bends to check)
My dignity's taken worse hits. These were my good clinic trousers.

XIANG DONG
Please. Let me pay for cleaning. We're already late—

JIANG YUEQIN
(waves off)
Spend it on road repair. I've delivered babies in worse conditions.

She ties a handkerchief around her leg.

A SEDAN screeches to a halt. The CHUBBY DRIVER clutches his stomach.

JIANG YUEQIN
(approaches)
